95namespace v8 {
96namespace internal {
97
98#ifdef V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP
99Isolate* Heap::GetIsolateFromWritableObject(HeapObject object) {
100 return reinterpret_cast<Isolate*>(
101 third_party_heap::Heap::GetIsolate(object.address()));
102}
103#endif
104
105// These are outside the Heap class so they can be forward-declared
106// in heap-write-barrier-inl.h.
107bool Heap_PageFlagsAreConsistent(HeapObject object) {
108 return Heap::PageFlagsAreConsistent(object);
109}
110
111void Heap_GenerationalBarrierSlow(HeapObject object, Address slot,
112 HeapObject value) {
113 Heap::GenerationalBarrierSlow(object, slot, value);
114}
115
116void Heap_WriteBarrierForCodeSlow(Code host) {
117 Heap::WriteBarrierForCodeSlow(host);
118}
119
120void Heap_GenerationalBarrierForCodeSlow(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo,
121 HeapObject object) {
122 Heap::GenerationalBarrierForCodeSlow(host, rinfo, object);
123}
124
125void Heap_GenerationalEphemeronKeyBarrierSlow(Heap* heap,
126 EphemeronHashTable table,
127 Address slot) {
128 heap->RecordEphemeronKeyWrite(table, slot);
129}
130
131void Heap::SetArgumentsAdaptorDeoptPCOffset(int pc_offset) {
132 DCHECK_EQ(Smi::zero(), arguments_adaptor_deopt_pc_offset())((void) 0);
133 set_arguments_adaptor_deopt_pc_offset(Smi::FromInt(pc_offset));
134}
135
136void Heap::SetConstructStubCreateDeoptPCOffset(int pc_offset) {
137 DCHECK_EQ(Smi::zero(), construct_stub_create_deopt_pc_offset())((void) 0);
138 set_construct_stub_create_deopt_pc_offset(Smi::FromInt(pc_offset));
139}
140
141void Heap::SetConstructStubInvokeDeoptPCOffset(int pc_offset) {
142 DCHECK_EQ(Smi::zero(), construct_stub_invoke_deopt_pc_offset())((void) 0);
143 set_construct_stub_invoke_deopt_pc_offset(Smi::FromInt(pc_offset));
144}
145
146void Heap::SetInterpreterEntryReturnPCOffset(int pc_offset) {
147 DCHECK_EQ(Smi::zero(), interpreter_entry_return_pc_offset())((void) 0);
148 set_interpreter_entry_return_pc_offset(Smi::FromInt(pc_offset));
149}
150
151void Heap::SetSerializedObjects(FixedArray objects) {
152 DCHECK(isolate()->serializer_enabled())((void) 0);
153 set_serialized_objects(objects);
154}
155
156void Heap::SetSerializedGlobalProxySizes(FixedArray sizes) {
157 DCHECK(isolate()->serializer_enabled())((void) 0);
158 set_serialized_global_proxy_sizes(sizes);
159}
160
161void Heap::SetBasicBlockProfilingData(Handle<ArrayList> list) {
162 set_basic_block_profiling_data(*list);
163}
164
165bool Heap::GCCallbackTuple::operator==(
166 const Heap::GCCallbackTuple& other) const {
167 return other.callback == callback && other.data == data;
168}
169
170Heap::GCCallbackTuple& Heap::GCCallbackTuple::operator=(
171 const Heap::GCCallbackTuple& other) V8_NOEXCEPTnoexcept = default;
172
173struct Heap::StrongRootsList {
174 FullObjectSlot start;
175 FullObjectSlot end;
176 StrongRootsList* next;
177};
178
179class ScavengeTaskObserver : public AllocationObserver {
180 public:
181 ScavengeTaskObserver(Heap* heap, intptr_t step_size)
182 : AllocationObserver(step_size), heap_(heap) {}
183
184 void Step(int bytes_allocated, Address, size_t) override {
185 heap_->ScheduleScavengeTaskIfNeeded();
186 }
187
188 private:
189 Heap* heap_;
190};
191
192Heap::Heap()
193 : isolate_(isolate()),
194 memory_pressure_level_(MemoryPressureLevel::kNone),
195 global_pretenuring_feedback_(kInitialFeedbackCapacity),
196 safepoint_(new GlobalSafepoint(this)),
197 external_string_table_(this),
198 collection_barrier_(this) {
199 // Ensure old_generation_size_ is a multiple of kPageSize.
200 DCHECK_EQ(0, max_old_generation_size() & (Page::kPageSize - 1))((void) 0);
201
202 set_native_contexts_list(Smi::zero());
203 set_allocation_sites_list(Smi::zero());
204 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(Smi::zero());
205 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail(Smi::zero());
206 // Put a dummy entry in the remembered pages so we can find the list the
207 // minidump even if there are no real unmapped pages.
208 RememberUnmappedPage(kNullAddress, false);
209}
210
211Heap::~Heap() = default;
212
213size_t Heap::MaxReserved() {
214 const size_t kMaxNewLargeObjectSpaceSize = max_semi_space_size_;
215 return static_cast<size_t>(2 * max_semi_space_size_ +
216 kMaxNewLargeObjectSpaceSize +
217 max_old_generation_size());
218}
219
220size_t Heap::YoungGenerationSizeFromOldGenerationSize(size_t old_generation) {
221 // Compute the semi space size and cap it.
222 size_t ratio = old_generation <= kOldGenerationLowMemory
223 ? kOldGenerationToSemiSpaceRatioLowMemory
224 : kOldGenerationToSemiSpaceRatio;
225 size_t semi_space = old_generation / ratio;
226 semi_space = Min<size_t>(semi_space, kMaxSemiSpaceSize);
227 semi_space = Max<size_t>(semi_space, kMinSemiSpaceSize);
228 semi_space = RoundUp(semi_space, Page::kPageSize);
229 return YoungGenerationSizeFromSemiSpaceSize(semi_space);
230}
231
232size_t Heap::HeapSizeFromPhysicalMemory(uint64_t physical_memory) {
233 // Compute the old generation size and cap it.
234 uint64_t old_generation = physical_memory /
235 kPhysicalMemoryToOldGenerationRatio *
236 kHeapLimitMultiplier;
237 old_generation =
238 Min<uint64_t>(old_generation, MaxOldGenerationSize(physical_memory));
239 old_generation = Max<uint64_t>(old_generation, V8HeapTrait::kMinSize);
240 old_generation = RoundUp(old_generation, Page::kPageSize);
241
242 size_t young_generation = YoungGenerationSizeFromOldGenerationSize(
243 static_cast<size_t>(old_generation));
244 return static_cast<size_t>(old_generation) + young_generation;
245}
246
247void Heap::GenerationSizesFromHeapSize(size_t heap_size,
248 size_t* young_generation_size,
249 size_t* old_generation_size) {
250 // Initialize values for the case when the given heap size is too small.
251 *young_generation_size = 0;
252 *old_generation_size = 0;
253 // Binary search for the largest old generation size that fits to the given
254 // heap limit considering the correspondingly sized young generation.
255 size_t lower = 0, upper = heap_size;
256 while (lower + 1 < upper) {
257 size_t old_generation = lower + (upper - lower) / 2;
258 size_t young_generation =
259 YoungGenerationSizeFromOldGenerationSize(old_generation);
260 if (old_generation + young_generation <= heap_size) {
261 // This size configuration fits into the given heap limit.
262 *young_generation_size = young_generation;
263 *old_generation_size = old_generation;
264 lower = old_generation;
265 } else {
266 upper = old_generation;
267 }
268 }
269}
270
271size_t Heap::MinYoungGenerationSize() {
272 return YoungGenerationSizeFromSemiSpaceSize(kMinSemiSpaceSize);
273}
274
275size_t Heap::MinOldGenerationSize() {
276 size_t paged_space_count =
277 LAST_GROWABLE_PAGED_SPACE - FIRST_GROWABLE_PAGED_SPACE + 1;
278 return paged_space_count * Page::kPageSize;
279}
280
281size_t Heap::AllocatorLimitOnMaxOldGenerationSize() {
282#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
283 // Isolate and the young generation are also allocated on the heap.
284 return kPtrComprHeapReservationSize -
285 YoungGenerationSizeFromSemiSpaceSize(kMaxSemiSpaceSize) -
286 RoundUp(sizeof(Isolate), size_t{1} << kPageSizeBits);
287#endif
288 return std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max();
289}
290
291size_t Heap::MaxOldGenerationSize(uint64_t physical_memory) {
292 size_t max_size = V8HeapTrait::kMaxSize;
293 // Finch experiment: Increase the heap size from 2GB to 4GB for 64-bit
294 // systems with physical memory bigger than 16GB. The physical memory
295 // is rounded up to GB.
296 constexpr bool x64_bit = Heap::kHeapLimitMultiplier >= 2;
297 if (FLAG_huge_max_old_generation_size && x64_bit &&
298 (physical_memory + 512 * MB) / GB >= 16) {
299 DCHECK_EQ(max_size / GB, 2)((void) 0);
300 max_size *= 2;
301 }
302 return Min(max_size, AllocatorLimitOnMaxOldGenerationSize());
303}
304
305size_t Heap::YoungGenerationSizeFromSemiSpaceSize(size_t semi_space_size) {
306 return semi_space_size * (2 + kNewLargeObjectSpaceToSemiSpaceRatio);
307}
308
309size_t Heap::SemiSpaceSizeFromYoungGenerationSize(
310 size_t young_generation_size) {
311 return young_generation_size / (2 + kNewLargeObjectSpaceToSemiSpaceRatio);
312}
313
314size_t Heap::Capacity() {
315 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
316
317 return new_space_->Capacity() + OldGenerationCapacity();
318}
319
320size_t Heap::OldGenerationCapacity() {
321 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
322 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
323 size_t total = 0;
324 for (PagedSpace* space = spaces.Next(); space != nullptr;
325 space = spaces.Next()) {
326 total += space->Capacity();
327 }
328 return total + lo_space_->SizeOfObjects() + code_lo_space_->SizeOfObjects();
329}
330
331size_t Heap::CommittedOldGenerationMemory() {
332 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
333
334 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
335 size_t total = 0;
336 for (PagedSpace* space = spaces.Next(); space != nullptr;
337 space = spaces.Next()) {
338 total += space->CommittedMemory();
339 }
340 return total + lo_space_->Size() + code_lo_space_->Size();
341}
342
343size_t Heap::CommittedMemoryOfUnmapper() {
344 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
345
346 return memory_allocator()->unmapper()->CommittedBufferedMemory();
347}
348
349size_t Heap::CommittedMemory() {
350 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
351
352 return new_space_->CommittedMemory() + new_lo_space_->Size() +
353 CommittedOldGenerationMemory();
354}
355
356
357size_t Heap::CommittedPhysicalMemory() {
358 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
359
360 size_t total = 0;
361 for (SpaceIterator it(this); it.HasNext();) {
362 total += it.Next()->CommittedPhysicalMemory();
363 }
364
365 return total;
366}
367
368size_t Heap::CommittedMemoryExecutable() {
369 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
370
371 return static_cast<size_t>(memory_allocator()->SizeExecutable());
372}
373
374
375void Heap::UpdateMaximumCommitted() {
376 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return;
377
378 const size_t current_committed_memory = CommittedMemory();
379 if (current_committed_memory > maximum_committed_) {
380 maximum_committed_ = current_committed_memory;
381 }
382}
383
384size_t Heap::Available() {
385 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return 0;
386
387 size_t total = 0;
388
389 for (SpaceIterator it(this); it.HasNext();) {
390 total += it.Next()->Available();
391 }
392
393 total += memory_allocator()->Available();
394 return total;
395}
396
397bool Heap::CanExpandOldGeneration(size_t size) {
398 if (force_oom_) return false;
399 if (OldGenerationCapacity() + size > max_old_generation_size()) return false;
400 // The OldGenerationCapacity does not account compaction spaces used
401 // during evacuation. Ensure that expanding the old generation does push
402 // the total allocated memory size over the maximum heap size.
403 return memory_allocator()->Size() + size <= MaxReserved();
404}
405
406bool Heap::CanExpandOldGenerationBackground(size_t size) {
407 if (force_oom_) return false;
408 return memory_allocator()->Size() + size <= MaxReserved();
409}
410
411bool Heap::HasBeenSetUp() const {
412 // We will always have a new space when the heap is set up.
413 return new_space_ != nullptr;
414}
415
416GarbageCollector Heap::SelectGarbageCollector(AllocationSpace space,
417 const char** reason) {
418 // Is global GC requested?
419 if (space != NEW_SPACE && space != NEW_LO_SPACE) {
420 isolate_->counters()->gc_compactor_caused_by_request()->Increment();
421 *reason = "GC in old space requested";
422 return MARK_COMPACTOR;
423 }
424
425 if (FLAG_gc_global || ShouldStressCompaction()) {
426 *reason = "GC in old space forced by flags";
427 return MARK_COMPACTOR;
428 }
429
430 if (incremental_marking()->NeedsFinalization() &&
431 AllocationLimitOvershotByLargeMargin()) {
432 *reason = "Incremental marking needs finalization";
433 return MARK_COMPACTOR;
434 }
435
436 // Over-estimate the new space size using capacity to allow some slack.
437 if (!CanExpandOldGeneration(new_space_->TotalCapacity() +
438 new_lo_space()->Size())) {
439 isolate_->counters()
440 ->gc_compactor_caused_by_oldspace_exhaustion()
441 ->Increment();
442 *reason = "scavenge might not succeed";
443 return MARK_COMPACTOR;
444 }
445
446 // Default
447 *reason = nullptr;
448 return YoungGenerationCollector();
449}
450
451void Heap::SetGCState(HeapState state) {
452 gc_state_.store(state, std::memory_order_relaxed);
453}
454
455void Heap::PrintShortHeapStatistics() {
456 if (!FLAG_trace_gc_verbose) return;
457 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
458 "Memory allocator, used: %6zu KB,"
459 " available: %6zu KB\n",
460 memory_allocator()->Size() / KB,
461 memory_allocator()->Available() / KB);
462 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
463 "Read-only space, used: %6zu KB"
464 ", available: %6zu KB"
465 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
466 read_only_space_->Size() / KB, size_t{0},
467 read_only_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
468 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
469 "New space, used: %6zu KB"
470 ", available: %6zu KB"
471 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
472 new_space_->Size() / KB, new_space_->Available() / KB,
473 new_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
474 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
475 "New large object space, used: %6zu KB"
476 ", available: %6zu KB"
477 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
478 new_lo_space_->SizeOfObjects() / KB,
479 new_lo_space_->Available() / KB,
480 new_lo_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
481 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
482 "Old space, used: %6zu KB"
483 ", available: %6zu KB"
484 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
485 old_space_->SizeOfObjects() / KB, old_space_->Available() / KB,
486 old_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
487 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
488 "Code space, used: %6zu KB"
489 ", available: %6zu KB"
490 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
491 code_space_->SizeOfObjects() / KB, code_space_->Available() / KB,
492 code_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
493 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
494 "Map space, used: %6zu KB"
495 ", available: %6zu KB"
496 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
497 map_space_->SizeOfObjects() / KB, map_space_->Available() / KB,
498 map_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
499 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
500 "Large object space, used: %6zu KB"
501 ", available: %6zu KB"
502 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
503 lo_space_->SizeOfObjects() / KB, lo_space_->Available() / KB,
504 lo_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
505 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
506 "Code large object space, used: %6zu KB"
507 ", available: %6zu KB"
508 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
509 code_lo_space_->SizeOfObjects() / KB,
510 code_lo_space_->Available() / KB,
511 code_lo_space_->CommittedMemory() / KB);
512 ReadOnlySpace* const ro_space = read_only_space_;
513 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
514 "All spaces, used: %6zu KB"
515 ", available: %6zu KB"
516 ", committed: %6zu KB\n",
517 (this->SizeOfObjects() + ro_space->Size()) / KB,
518 (this->Available()) / KB,
519 (this->CommittedMemory() + ro_space->CommittedMemory()) / KB);
520 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
521 "Unmapper buffering %zu chunks of committed: %6zu KB\n",
522 memory_allocator()->unmapper()->NumberOfCommittedChunks(),
523 CommittedMemoryOfUnmapper() / KB);
524 PrintIsolate(isolate_, "External memory reported: %6" PRId64"l" "d" " KB\n",
525 external_memory_.total() / KB);
526 PrintIsolate(isolate_, "Backing store memory: %6zu KB\n",
527 backing_store_bytes_ / KB);
528 PrintIsolate(isolate_, "External memory global %zu KB\n",
529 external_memory_callback_() / KB);
530 PrintIsolate(isolate_, "Total time spent in GC : %.1f ms\n",
531 total_gc_time_ms_);
532}
533
534void Heap::PrintFreeListsStats() {
535 DCHECK(FLAG_trace_gc_freelists)((void) 0);
536
537 if (FLAG_trace_gc_freelists_verbose) {
538 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
539 "Freelists statistics per Page: "
540 "[category: length || total free bytes]\n");
541 }
542
543 std::vector<int> categories_lengths(
544 old_space()->free_list()->number_of_categories(), 0);
545 std::vector<size_t> categories_sums(
546 old_space()->free_list()->number_of_categories(), 0);
547 unsigned int pageCnt = 0;
548
549 // This loops computes freelists lengths and sum.
550 // If FLAG_trace_gc_freelists_verbose is enabled, it also prints
551 // the stats of each FreeListCategory of each Page.
552 for (Page* page : *old_space()) {
553 std::ostringstream out_str;
554
555 if (FLAG_trace_gc_freelists_verbose) {
556 out_str << "Page " << std::setw(4) << pageCnt;
557 }
558
559 for (int cat = kFirstCategory;
560 cat <= old_space()->free_list()->last_category(); cat++) {
561 FreeListCategory* free_list =
562 page->free_list_category(static_cast<FreeListCategoryType>(cat));
563 int length = free_list->FreeListLength();
564 size_t sum = free_list->SumFreeList();
565
566 if (FLAG_trace_gc_freelists_verbose) {
567 out_str << "[" << cat << ": " << std::setw(4) << length << " || "
568 << std::setw(6) << sum << " ]"
569 << (cat == old_space()->free_list()->last_category() ? "\n"
570 : ", ");
571 }
572 categories_lengths[cat] += length;
573 categories_sums[cat] += sum;
574 }
575
576 if (FLAG_trace_gc_freelists_verbose) {
577 PrintIsolate(isolate_, "%s", out_str.str().c_str());
578 }
579
580 pageCnt++;
581 }
582
583 // Print statistics about old_space (pages, free/wasted/used memory...).
584 PrintIsolate(
585 isolate_,
586 "%d pages. Free space: %.1f MB (waste: %.2f). "
587 "Usage: %.1f/%.1f (MB) -> %.2f%%.\n",
588 pageCnt, static_cast<double>(old_space_->Available()) / MB,
589 static_cast<double>(old_space_->Waste()) / MB,
590 static_cast<double>(old_space_->Size()) / MB,
591 static_cast<double>(old_space_->Capacity()) / MB,
592 static_cast<double>(old_space_->Size()) / old_space_->Capacity() * 100);
593
594 // Print global statistics of each FreeListCategory (length & sum).
595 PrintIsolate(isolate_,
596 "FreeLists global statistics: "
597 "[category: length || total free KB]\n");
598 std::ostringstream out_str;
599 for (int cat = kFirstCategory;
600 cat <= old_space()->free_list()->last_category(); cat++) {
601 out_str << "[" << cat << ": " << categories_lengths[cat] << " || "
602 << std::fixed << std::setprecision(2)
603 << static_cast<double>(categories_sums[cat]) / KB << " KB]"
604 << (cat == old_space()->free_list()->last_category() ? "\n" : ", ");
605 }
606 PrintIsolate(isolate_, "%s", out_str.str().c_str());
607}
608
609void Heap::DumpJSONHeapStatistics(std::stringstream& stream) {
610 HeapStatistics stats;
611 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(isolate())->GetHeapStatistics(&stats);
612
613// clang-format off
614#define DICT(s) "{" << s << "}"
615#define LIST(s) "[" << s << "]"
616#define ESCAPE(s) "\"" << s << "\""
617#define MEMBER(s) ESCAPE(s) << ":"
618
619 auto SpaceStatistics = [this](int space_index) {
620 HeapSpaceStatistics space_stats;
621 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(isolate())->GetHeapSpaceStatistics(
622 &space_stats, space_index);
623 std::stringstream stream;
624 stream << DICT(
625 MEMBER("name")
626 << ESCAPE(BaseSpace::GetSpaceName(
627 static_cast<AllocationSpace>(space_index)))
628 << ","
629 MEMBER("size") << space_stats.space_size() << ","
630 MEMBER("used_size") << space_stats.space_used_size() << ","
631 MEMBER("available_size") << space_stats.space_available_size() << ","
632 MEMBER("physical_size") << space_stats.physical_space_size());
633 return stream.str();
634 };
635
636 stream << DICT(
637 MEMBER("isolate") << ESCAPE(reinterpret_cast<void*>(isolate())) << ","
638 MEMBER("id") << gc_count() << ","
639 MEMBER("time_ms") << isolate()->time_millis_since_init() << ","
640 MEMBER("total_heap_size") << stats.total_heap_size() << ","
641 MEMBER("total_heap_size_executable")
642 << stats.total_heap_size_executable() << ","
643 MEMBER("total_physical_size") << stats.total_physical_size() << ","
644 MEMBER("total_available_size") << stats.total_available_size() << ","
645 MEMBER("used_heap_size") << stats.used_heap_size() << ","
646 MEMBER("heap_size_limit") << stats.heap_size_limit() << ","
647 MEMBER("malloced_memory") << stats.malloced_memory() << ","
648 MEMBER("external_memory") << stats.external_memory() << ","
649 MEMBER("peak_malloced_memory") << stats.peak_malloced_memory() << ","
650 MEMBER("spaces") << LIST(
651 SpaceStatistics(RO_SPACE) << "," <<
652 SpaceStatistics(NEW_SPACE) << "," <<
653 SpaceStatistics(OLD_SPACE) << "," <<
654 SpaceStatistics(CODE_SPACE) << "," <<
655 SpaceStatistics(MAP_SPACE) << "," <<
656 SpaceStatistics(LO_SPACE) << "," <<
657 SpaceStatistics(CODE_LO_SPACE) << "," <<
658 SpaceStatistics(NEW_LO_SPACE)));
659
660#undef DICT
661#undef LIST
662#undef ESCAPE
663#undef MEMBER
664 // clang-format on
665}
666
667void Heap::ReportStatisticsAfterGC() {
668 for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(v8::Isolate::kUseCounterFeatureCount);
669 ++i) {
670 int count = deferred_counters_[i];
671 deferred_counters_[i] = 0;
672 while (count > 0) {
673 count--;
674 isolate()->CountUsage(static_cast<v8::Isolate::UseCounterFeature>(i));
675 }
676 }
677}
678
679void Heap::AddHeapObjectAllocationTracker(
680 HeapObjectAllocationTracker* tracker) {
681 if (allocation_trackers_.empty() && FLAG_inline_new) {
682 DisableInlineAllocation();
683 }
684 allocation_trackers_.push_back(tracker);
685}
686
687void Heap::RemoveHeapObjectAllocationTracker(
688 HeapObjectAllocationTracker* tracker) {
689 allocation_trackers_.erase(std::remove(allocation_trackers_.begin(),
690 allocation_trackers_.end(), tracker),
691 allocation_trackers_.end());
692 if (allocation_trackers_.empty() && FLAG_inline_new) {
693 EnableInlineAllocation();
694 }
695}
696
697void Heap::AddRetainingPathTarget(Handle<HeapObject> object,
698 RetainingPathOption option) {
699 if (!FLAG_track_retaining_path) {
700 PrintF("Retaining path tracking requires --track-retaining-path\n");
701 } else {
702 Handle<WeakArrayList> array(retaining_path_targets(), isolate());
703 int index = array->length();
704 array = WeakArrayList::AddToEnd(isolate(), array,
705 MaybeObjectHandle::Weak(object));
706 set_retaining_path_targets(*array);
707 DCHECK_EQ(array->length(), index + 1)((void) 0);
708 retaining_path_target_option_[index] = option;
709 }
710}
711
712bool Heap::IsRetainingPathTarget(HeapObject object,
713 RetainingPathOption* option) {
714 WeakArrayList targets = retaining_path_targets();
715 int length = targets.length();
716 MaybeObject object_to_check = HeapObjectReference::Weak(object);
717 for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
718 MaybeObject target = targets.Get(i);
719 DCHECK(target->IsWeakOrCleared())((void) 0);
720 if (target == object_to_check) {
721 DCHECK(retaining_path_target_option_.count(i))((void) 0);
722 *option = retaining_path_target_option_[i];
723 return true;
724 }
725 }
726 return false;
727}
728
729void Heap::PrintRetainingPath(HeapObject target, RetainingPathOption option) {
730 PrintF("\n\n\n");
731 PrintF("#################################################\n");
732 PrintF("Retaining path for %p:\n", reinterpret_cast<void*>(target.ptr()));
733 HeapObject object = target;
734 std::vector<std::pair<HeapObject, bool>> retaining_path;
735 Root root = Root::kUnknown;
736 bool ephemeron = false;
737 while (true) {
738 retaining_path.push_back(std::make_pair(object, ephemeron));
739 if (option == RetainingPathOption::kTrackEphemeronPath &&
740 ephemeron_retainer_.count(object)) {
741 object = ephemeron_retainer_[object];
742 ephemeron = true;
743 } else if (retainer_.count(object)) {
744 object = retainer_[object];
745 ephemeron = false;
746 } else {
747 if (retaining_root_.count(object)) {
748 root = retaining_root_[object];
749 }
750 break;
751 }
752 }
753 int distance = static_cast<int>(retaining_path.size());
754 for (auto node : retaining_path) {
755 HeapObject object = node.first;
756 bool ephemeron = node.second;
757 PrintF("\n");
758 PrintF("^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\n");
759 PrintF("Distance from root %d%s: ", distance,
760 ephemeron ? " (ephemeron)" : "");
761 object.ShortPrint();
762 PrintF("\n");
763#ifdef OBJECT_PRINT1
764 object.Print();
765 PrintF("\n");
766#endif
767 --distance;
768 }
769 PrintF("\n");
770 PrintF("^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^\n");
771 PrintF("Root: %s\n", RootVisitor::RootName(root));
772 PrintF("-------------------------------------------------\n");
773}
774
775void Heap::AddRetainer(HeapObject retainer, HeapObject object) {
776 if (retainer_.count(object)) return;
777 retainer_[object] = retainer;
778 RetainingPathOption option = RetainingPathOption::kDefault;
779 if (IsRetainingPathTarget(object, &option)) {
780 // Check if the retaining path was already printed in
781 // AddEphemeronRetainer().
782 if (ephemeron_retainer_.count(object) == 0 ||
783 option == RetainingPathOption::kDefault) {
784 PrintRetainingPath(object, option);
785 }
786 }
787}
788
789void Heap::AddEphemeronRetainer(HeapObject retainer, HeapObject object) {
790 if (ephemeron_retainer_.count(object)) return;
791 ephemeron_retainer_[object] = retainer;
792 RetainingPathOption option = RetainingPathOption::kDefault;
793 if (IsRetainingPathTarget(object, &option) &&
794 option == RetainingPathOption::kTrackEphemeronPath) {
795 // Check if the retaining path was already printed in AddRetainer().
796 if (retainer_.count(object) == 0) {
797 PrintRetainingPath(object, option);
798 }
799 }
800}
801
802void Heap::AddRetainingRoot(Root root, HeapObject object) {
803 if (retaining_root_.count(object)) return;
804 retaining_root_[object] = root;
805 RetainingPathOption option = RetainingPathOption::kDefault;
806 if (IsRetainingPathTarget(object, &option)) {
807 PrintRetainingPath(object, option);
808 }
809}
810
811void Heap::IncrementDeferredCount(v8::Isolate::UseCounterFeature feature) {
812 deferred_counters_[feature]++;
813}
814
815bool Heap::UncommitFromSpace() { return new_space_->UncommitFromSpace(); }
816
817void Heap::GarbageCollectionPrologue() {
818 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_PROLOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_PROLOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id
); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic818 =
0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic818
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic818
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer818
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer818
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled818, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
819
820 // Reset GC statistics.
821 promoted_objects_size_ = 0;
822 previous_semi_space_copied_object_size_ = semi_space_copied_object_size_;
823 semi_space_copied_object_size_ = 0;
824 nodes_died_in_new_space_ = 0;
825 nodes_copied_in_new_space_ = 0;
826 nodes_promoted_ = 0;
827
828 UpdateMaximumCommitted();
829
830#ifdef DEBUG
831 DCHECK(!AllowHeapAllocation::IsAllowed() && gc_state() == NOT_IN_GC)((void) 0);
832
833 if (FLAG_gc_verbose) Print();
834#endif // DEBUG
835
836 if (new_space_->IsAtMaximumCapacity()) {
837 maximum_size_scavenges_++;
838 } else {
839 maximum_size_scavenges_ = 0;
840 }
841 if (FLAG_track_retaining_path) {
842 retainer_.clear();
843 ephemeron_retainer_.clear();
844 retaining_root_.clear();
845 }
846 memory_allocator()->unmapper()->PrepareForGC();
847}
848
849void Heap::GarbageCollectionPrologueInSafepoint() {
850 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_PROLOGUE_SAFEPOINT)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_PROLOGUE_SAFEPOINT); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer
(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic850
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic850
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic850
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer850
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850)
) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer850
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled850, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
851 gc_count_++;
852
853 UpdateNewSpaceAllocationCounter();
854 CheckNewSpaceExpansionCriteria();
855}
856
857size_t Heap::SizeOfObjects() {
858 size_t total = 0;
859
860 for (SpaceIterator it(this); it.HasNext();) {
861 total += it.Next()->SizeOfObjects();
862 }
863 return total;
864}
865
866size_t Heap::TotalGlobalHandlesSize() {
867 return isolate_->global_handles()->TotalSize();
868}
869
870size_t Heap::UsedGlobalHandlesSize() {
871 return isolate_->global_handles()->UsedSize();
872}
873
874void Heap::MergeAllocationSitePretenuringFeedback(
875 const PretenuringFeedbackMap& local_pretenuring_feedback) {
876 AllocationSite site;
877 for (auto& site_and_count : local_pretenuring_feedback) {
878 site = site_and_count.first;
879 MapWord map_word = site_and_count.first.map_word();
880 if (map_word.IsForwardingAddress()) {
881 site = AllocationSite::cast(map_word.ToForwardingAddress());
882 }
883
884 // We have not validated the allocation site yet, since we have not
885 // dereferenced the site during collecting information.
886 // This is an inlined check of AllocationMemento::IsValid.
887 if (!site.IsAllocationSite() || site.IsZombie()) continue;
888
889 const int value = static_cast<int>(site_and_count.second);
890 DCHECK_LT(0, value)((void) 0);
891 if (site.IncrementMementoFoundCount(value)) {
892 // For sites in the global map the count is accessed through the site.
893 global_pretenuring_feedback_.insert(std::make_pair(site, 0));
894 }
895 }
896}
897
898void Heap::AddAllocationObserversToAllSpaces(
899 AllocationObserver* observer, AllocationObserver* new_space_observer) {
900 DCHECK(observer && new_space_observer)((void) 0);
901 SafepointScope scope(this);
902
903 for (SpaceIterator it(this); it.HasNext();) {
904 Space* space = it.Next();
905 if (space == new_space()) {
906 space->AddAllocationObserver(new_space_observer);
907 } else {
908 space->AddAllocationObserver(observer);
909 }
910 }
911}
912
913void Heap::RemoveAllocationObserversFromAllSpaces(
914 AllocationObserver* observer, AllocationObserver* new_space_observer) {
915 DCHECK(observer && new_space_observer)((void) 0);
916 SafepointScope scope(this);
917
918 for (SpaceIterator it(this); it.HasNext();) {
919 Space* space = it.Next();
920 if (space == new_space()) {
921 space->RemoveAllocationObserver(new_space_observer);
922 } else {
923 space->RemoveAllocationObserver(observer);
924 }
925 }
926}
927
928namespace {
929inline bool MakePretenureDecision(
930 AllocationSite site, AllocationSite::PretenureDecision current_decision,
931 double ratio, bool maximum_size_scavenge) {
932 // Here we just allow state transitions from undecided or maybe tenure
933 // to don't tenure, maybe tenure, or tenure.
934 if ((current_decision == AllocationSite::kUndecided ||
935 current_decision == AllocationSite::kMaybeTenure)) {
936 if (ratio >= AllocationSite::kPretenureRatio) {
937 // We just transition into tenure state when the semi-space was at
938 // maximum capacity.
939 if (maximum_size_scavenge) {
940 site.set_deopt_dependent_code(true);
941 site.set_pretenure_decision(AllocationSite::kTenure);
942 // Currently we just need to deopt when we make a state transition to
943 // tenure.
944 return true;
945 }
946 site.set_pretenure_decision(AllocationSite::kMaybeTenure);
947 } else {
948 site.set_pretenure_decision(AllocationSite::kDontTenure);
949 }
950 }
951 return false;
952}
953
954inline bool DigestPretenuringFeedback(Isolate* isolate, AllocationSite site,
955 bool maximum_size_scavenge) {
956 bool deopt = false;
957 int create_count = site.memento_create_count();
958 int found_count = site.memento_found_count();
959 bool minimum_mementos_created =
960 create_count >= AllocationSite::kPretenureMinimumCreated;
961 double ratio = minimum_mementos_created || FLAG_trace_pretenuring_statistics
962 ? static_cast<double>(found_count) / create_count
963 : 0.0;
964 AllocationSite::PretenureDecision current_decision =
965 site.pretenure_decision();
966
967 if (minimum_mementos_created) {
968 deopt = MakePretenureDecision(site, current_decision, ratio,
969 maximum_size_scavenge);
970 }
971
972 if (FLAG_trace_pretenuring_statistics) {
973 PrintIsolate(isolate,
974 "pretenuring: AllocationSite(%p): (created, found, ratio) "
975 "(%d, %d, %f) %s => %s\n",
976 reinterpret_cast<void*>(site.ptr()), create_count, found_count,
977 ratio, site.PretenureDecisionName(current_decision),
978 site.PretenureDecisionName(site.pretenure_decision()));
979 }
980
981 // Clear feedback calculation fields until the next gc.
982 site.set_memento_found_count(0);
983 site.set_memento_create_count(0);
984 return deopt;
985}
986} // namespace
987
988void Heap::RemoveAllocationSitePretenuringFeedback(AllocationSite site) {
989 global_pretenuring_feedback_.erase(site);
990}
991
992bool Heap::DeoptMaybeTenuredAllocationSites() {
993 return new_space_->IsAtMaximumCapacity() && maximum_size_scavenges_ == 0;
994}
995
996void Heap::ProcessPretenuringFeedback() {
997 bool trigger_deoptimization = false;
998 if (FLAG_allocation_site_pretenuring) {
999 int tenure_decisions = 0;
1000 int dont_tenure_decisions = 0;
1001 int allocation_mementos_found = 0;
1002 int allocation_sites = 0;
1003 int active_allocation_sites = 0;
1004
1005 AllocationSite site;
1006
1007 // Step 1: Digest feedback for recorded allocation sites.
1008 bool maximum_size_scavenge = MaximumSizeScavenge();
1009 for (auto& site_and_count : global_pretenuring_feedback_) {
1010 allocation_sites++;
1011 site = site_and_count.first;
1012 // Count is always access through the site.
1013 DCHECK_EQ(0, site_and_count.second)((void) 0);
1014 int found_count = site.memento_found_count();
1015 // An entry in the storage does not imply that the count is > 0 because
1016 // allocation sites might have been reset due to too many objects dying
1017 // in old space.
1018 if (found_count > 0) {
1019 DCHECK(site.IsAllocationSite())((void) 0);
1020 active_allocation_sites++;
1021 allocation_mementos_found += found_count;
1022 if (DigestPretenuringFeedback(isolate_, site, maximum_size_scavenge)) {
1023 trigger_deoptimization = true;
1024 }
1025 if (site.GetAllocationType() == AllocationType::kOld) {
1026 tenure_decisions++;
1027 } else {
1028 dont_tenure_decisions++;
1029 }
1030 }
1031 }
1032
1033 // Step 2: Deopt maybe tenured allocation sites if necessary.
1034 bool deopt_maybe_tenured = DeoptMaybeTenuredAllocationSites();
1035 if (deopt_maybe_tenured) {
1036 ForeachAllocationSite(
1037 allocation_sites_list(),
1038 [&allocation_sites, &trigger_deoptimization](AllocationSite site) {
1039 DCHECK(site.IsAllocationSite())((void) 0);
1040 allocation_sites++;
1041 if (site.IsMaybeTenure()) {
1042 site.set_deopt_dependent_code(true);
1043 trigger_deoptimization = true;
1044 }
1045 });
1046 }
1047
1048 if (trigger_deoptimization) {
1049 isolate_->stack_guard()->RequestDeoptMarkedAllocationSites();
1050 }
1051
1052 if (FLAG_trace_pretenuring_statistics &&
1053 (allocation_mementos_found > 0 || tenure_decisions > 0 ||
1054 dont_tenure_decisions > 0)) {
1055 PrintIsolate(isolate(),
1056 "pretenuring: deopt_maybe_tenured=%d visited_sites=%d "
1057 "active_sites=%d "
1058 "mementos=%d tenured=%d not_tenured=%d\n",
1059 deopt_maybe_tenured ? 1 : 0, allocation_sites,
1060 active_allocation_sites, allocation_mementos_found,
1061 tenure_decisions, dont_tenure_decisions);
1062 }
1063
1064 global_pretenuring_feedback_.clear();
1065 global_pretenuring_feedback_.reserve(kInitialFeedbackCapacity);
1066 }
1067}
1068
1069void Heap::InvalidateCodeDeoptimizationData(Code code) {
1070 CodePageMemoryModificationScope modification_scope(code);
1071 code.set_deoptimization_data(ReadOnlyRoots(this).empty_fixed_array());
1072}
1073
1074void Heap::DeoptMarkedAllocationSites() {
1075 // TODO(hpayer): If iterating over the allocation sites list becomes a
1076 // performance issue, use a cache data structure in heap instead.
1077
1078 ForeachAllocationSite(allocation_sites_list(), [](AllocationSite site) {
1079 if (site.deopt_dependent_code()) {
1080 site.dependent_code().MarkCodeForDeoptimization(
1081 DependentCode::kAllocationSiteTenuringChangedGroup);
1082 site.set_deopt_dependent_code(false);
1083 }
1084 });
1085
1086 Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeMarkedCode(isolate_);
1087}
1088
1089void Heap::GarbageCollectionEpilogueInSafepoint() {
1090 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EPILOGUE_SAFEPOINT)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EPILOGUE_SAFEPOINT); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer
(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1090
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1090
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1090
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1090
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer1090
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1090, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
1091
1092#define UPDATE_COUNTERS_FOR_SPACE(space) \
1093 isolate_->counters()->space##_bytes_available()->Set( \
1094 static_cast<int>(space()->Available())); \
1095 isolate_->counters()->space##_bytes_committed()->Set( \
1096 static_cast<int>(space()->CommittedMemory())); \
1097 isolate_->counters()->space##_bytes_used()->Set( \
1098 static_cast<int>(space()->SizeOfObjects()));
1099#define UPDATE_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE(space) \
1100 if (space()->CommittedMemory() > 0) { \
1101 isolate_->counters()->external_fragmentation_##space()->AddSample( \
1102 static_cast<int>(100 - (space()->SizeOfObjects() * 100.0) / \
1103 space()->CommittedMemory())); \
1104 }
1105#define UPDATE_COUNTERS_AND_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE(space) \
1106 UPDATE_COUNTERS_FOR_SPACE(space) \
1107 UPDATE_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE(space)
1108
1109 UPDATE_COUNTERS_FOR_SPACE(new_space)
1110 UPDATE_COUNTERS_AND_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE(old_space)
1111 UPDATE_COUNTERS_AND_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE(code_space)
1112 UPDATE_COUNTERS_AND_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE(map_space)
1113 UPDATE_COUNTERS_AND_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE(lo_space)
1114#undef UPDATE_COUNTERS_FOR_SPACE
1115#undef UPDATE_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE
1116#undef UPDATE_COUNTERS_AND_FRAGMENTATION_FOR_SPACE
1117
1118#ifdef DEBUG
1119 // Old-to-new slot sets must be empty after each collection.
1120 for (SpaceIterator it(this); it.HasNext();) {
1121 Space* space = it.Next();
1122
1123 for (MemoryChunk* chunk = space->first_page(); chunk != space->last_page();
1124 chunk = chunk->list_node().next())
1125 DCHECK_NULL(chunk->invalidated_slots<OLD_TO_NEW>())((void) 0);
1126 }
1127
1128 if (FLAG_print_global_handles) isolate_->global_handles()->Print();
1129 if (FLAG_print_handles) PrintHandles();
1130 if (FLAG_gc_verbose) Print();
1131 if (FLAG_code_stats) ReportCodeStatistics("After GC");
1132 if (FLAG_check_handle_count) CheckHandleCount();
1133#endif
1134
1135 if (Heap::ShouldZapGarbage() || FLAG_clear_free_memory) {
1136 ZapFromSpace();
1137 }
1138
1139 {
1140 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EPILOGUE_REDUCE_NEW_SPACE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EPILOGUE_REDUCE_NEW_SPACE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope
(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1140
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1140
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1140
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1140
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer1140
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1140, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
1141 ReduceNewSpaceSize();
1142 }
1143}
1144
1145void Heap::GarbageCollectionEpilogue() {
1146 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EPILOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EPILOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id
); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1146 =
0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1146
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1146
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1146
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer1146
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1146, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
1147 AllowHeapAllocation for_the_rest_of_the_epilogue;
1148
1149 UpdateMaximumCommitted();
1150
1151 isolate_->counters()->alive_after_last_gc()->Set(
1152 static_cast<int>(SizeOfObjects()));
1153
1154 isolate_->counters()->string_table_capacity()->Set(
1155 isolate()->string_table()->Capacity());
1156 isolate_->counters()->number_of_symbols()->Set(
1157 isolate()->string_table()->NumberOfElements());
1158
1159 if (CommittedMemory() > 0) {
1160 isolate_->counters()->external_fragmentation_total()->AddSample(
1161 static_cast<int>(100 - (SizeOfObjects() * 100.0) / CommittedMemory()));
1162
1163 isolate_->counters()->heap_sample_total_committed()->AddSample(
1164 static_cast<int>(CommittedMemory() / KB));
1165 isolate_->counters()->heap_sample_total_used()->AddSample(
1166 static_cast<int>(SizeOfObjects() / KB));
1167 isolate_->counters()->heap_sample_map_space_committed()->AddSample(
1168 static_cast<int>(map_space()->CommittedMemory() / KB));
1169 isolate_->counters()->heap_sample_code_space_committed()->AddSample(
1170 static_cast<int>(code_space()->CommittedMemory() / KB));
1171
1172 isolate_->counters()->heap_sample_maximum_committed()->AddSample(
1173 static_cast<int>(MaximumCommittedMemory() / KB));
1174 }
1175
1176#ifdef DEBUG
1177 ReportStatisticsAfterGC();
1178#endif // DEBUG
1179
1180 last_gc_time_ = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
1181}
1182
1183class GCCallbacksScope {
1184 public:
1185 explicit GCCallbacksScope(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {
1186 heap_->gc_callbacks_depth_++;
1187 }
1188 ~GCCallbacksScope() { heap_->gc_callbacks_depth_--; }
1189
1190 bool CheckReenter() { return heap_->gc_callbacks_depth_ == 1; }
1191
1192 private:
1193 Heap* heap_;
1194};
1195
1196
1197void Heap::HandleGCRequest() {
1198 if (FLAG_stress_scavenge > 0 && stress_scavenge_observer_->HasRequestedGC()) {
1199 CollectAllGarbage(NEW_SPACE, GarbageCollectionReason::kTesting);
1200 stress_scavenge_observer_->RequestedGCDone();
1201 } else if (HighMemoryPressure()) {
1202 incremental_marking()->reset_request_type();
1203 CheckMemoryPressure();
1204 } else if (incremental_marking()->request_type() ==
1205 IncrementalMarking::COMPLETE_MARKING) {
1206 incremental_marking()->reset_request_type();
1207 CollectAllGarbage(current_gc_flags_,
1208 GarbageCollectionReason::kFinalizeMarkingViaStackGuard,
1209 current_gc_callback_flags_);
1210 } else if (incremental_marking()->request_type() ==
1211 IncrementalMarking::FINALIZATION &&
1212 incremental_marking()->IsMarking() &&
1213 !incremental_marking()->finalize_marking_completed()) {
1214 incremental_marking()->reset_request_type();
1215 FinalizeIncrementalMarkingIncrementally(
1216 GarbageCollectionReason::kFinalizeMarkingViaStackGuard);
1217 }
1218}
1219
1220void Heap::ScheduleScavengeTaskIfNeeded() {
1221 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(scavenge_job_)((void) 0);
1222 scavenge_job_->ScheduleTaskIfNeeded(this);
1223}
1224
1225TimedHistogram* Heap::GCTypePriorityTimer(GarbageCollector collector) {
1226 if (IsYoungGenerationCollector(collector)) {
1227 if (isolate_->IsIsolateInBackground()) {
1228 return isolate_->counters()->gc_scavenger_background();
1229 }
1230 return isolate_->counters()->gc_scavenger_foreground();
1231 } else {
1232 if (!incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
1233 if (ShouldReduceMemory()) {
1234 if (isolate_->IsIsolateInBackground()) {
1235 return isolate_->counters()->gc_finalize_reduce_memory_background();
1236 }
1237 return isolate_->counters()->gc_finalize_reduce_memory_foreground();
1238 } else {
1239 if (isolate_->IsIsolateInBackground()) {
1240 return isolate_->counters()->gc_finalize_background();
1241 }
1242 return isolate_->counters()->gc_finalize_foreground();
1243 }
1244 } else {
1245 if (isolate_->IsIsolateInBackground()) {
1246 return isolate_->counters()->gc_compactor_background();
1247 }
1248 return isolate_->counters()->gc_compactor_foreground();
1249 }
1250 }
1251}
1252
1253TimedHistogram* Heap::GCTypeTimer(GarbageCollector collector) {
1254 if (IsYoungGenerationCollector(collector)) {
1255 return isolate_->counters()->gc_scavenger();
1256 }
1257 if (incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
1258 return isolate_->counters()->gc_compactor();
1259 }
1260 if (ShouldReduceMemory()) {
1261 return isolate_->counters()->gc_finalize_reduce_memory();
1262 }
1263 if (incremental_marking()->IsMarking() &&
1264 incremental_marking()->local_marking_worklists()->IsPerContextMode()) {
1265 return isolate_->counters()->gc_finalize_measure_memory();
1266 }
1267 return isolate_->counters()->gc_finalize();
1268}
1269
1270void Heap::CollectAllGarbage(int flags, GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason,
1271 const v8::GCCallbackFlags gc_callback_flags) {
1272 // Since we are ignoring the return value, the exact choice of space does
1273 // not matter, so long as we do not specify NEW_SPACE, which would not
1274 // cause a full GC.
1275 set_current_gc_flags(flags);
1276 CollectGarbage(OLD_SPACE, gc_reason, gc_callback_flags);
1277 set_current_gc_flags(kNoGCFlags);
1278}
1279
1280namespace {
1281
1282intptr_t CompareWords(int size, HeapObject a, HeapObject b) {
1283 int slots = size / kTaggedSize;
1284 DCHECK_EQ(a.Size(), size)((void) 0);
1285 DCHECK_EQ(b.Size(), size)((void) 0);
1286 Tagged_t* slot_a = reinterpret_cast<Tagged_t*>(a.address());
1287 Tagged_t* slot_b = reinterpret_cast<Tagged_t*>(b.address());
1288 for (int i = 0; i < slots; i++) {
1289 if (*slot_a != *slot_b) {
1290 return *slot_a - *slot_b;
1291 }
1292 slot_a++;
1293 slot_b++;
1294 }
1295 return 0;
1296}
1297
1298void ReportDuplicates(int size, std::vector<HeapObject>* objects) {
1299 if (objects->size() == 0) return;
1300
1301 sort(objects->begin(), objects->end(), [size](HeapObject a, HeapObject b) {
1302 intptr_t c = CompareWords(size, a, b);
1303 if (c != 0) return c < 0;
1304 return a < b;
1305 });
1306
1307 std::vector<std::pair<int, HeapObject>> duplicates;
1308 HeapObject current = (*objects)[0];
1309 int count = 1;
1310 for (size_t i = 1; i < objects->size(); i++) {
1311 if (CompareWords(size, current, (*objects)[i]) == 0) {
1312 count++;
1313 } else {
1314 if (count > 1) {
1315 duplicates.push_back(std::make_pair(count - 1, current));
1316 }
1317 count = 1;
1318 current = (*objects)[i];
1319 }
1320 }
1321 if (count > 1) {
1322 duplicates.push_back(std::make_pair(count - 1, current));
1323 }
1324
1325 int threshold = FLAG_trace_duplicate_threshold_kb * KB;
1326
1327 sort(duplicates.begin(), duplicates.end());
1328 for (auto it = duplicates.rbegin(); it != duplicates.rend(); ++it) {
1329 int duplicate_bytes = it->first * size;
1330 if (duplicate_bytes < threshold) break;
1331 PrintF("%d duplicates of size %d each (%dKB)\n", it->first, size,
1332 duplicate_bytes / KB);
1333 PrintF("Sample object: ");
1334 it->second.Print();
1335 PrintF("============================\n");
1336 }
1337}
1338} // anonymous namespace
1339
1340void Heap::CollectAllAvailableGarbage(GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason) {
1341 // Since we are ignoring the return value, the exact choice of space does
1342 // not matter, so long as we do not specify NEW_SPACE, which would not
1343 // cause a full GC.
1344 // Major GC would invoke weak handle callbacks on weakly reachable
1345 // handles, but won't collect weakly reachable objects until next
1346 // major GC. Therefore if we collect aggressively and weak handle callback
1347 // has been invoked, we rerun major GC to release objects which become
1348 // garbage.
1349 // Note: as weak callbacks can execute arbitrary code, we cannot
1350 // hope that eventually there will be no weak callbacks invocations.
1351 // Therefore stop recollecting after several attempts.
1352 if (gc_reason == GarbageCollectionReason::kLastResort) {
1353 InvokeNearHeapLimitCallback();
1354 }
1355 RuntimeCallTimerScope runtime_timer(
1356 isolate(), RuntimeCallCounterId::kGC_Custom_AllAvailableGarbage);
1357
1358 // The optimizing compiler may be unnecessarily holding on to memory.
1359 isolate()->AbortConcurrentOptimization(BlockingBehavior::kDontBlock);
1360 isolate()->ClearSerializerData();
1361 set_current_gc_flags(
1362 kReduceMemoryFootprintMask |
1363 (gc_reason == GarbageCollectionReason::kLowMemoryNotification ? kForcedGC
1364 : 0));
1365 isolate_->compilation_cache()->Clear();
1366 const int kMaxNumberOfAttempts = 7;
1367 const int kMinNumberOfAttempts = 2;
1368 for (int attempt = 0; attempt < kMaxNumberOfAttempts; attempt++) {
1369 if (!CollectGarbage(OLD_SPACE, gc_reason, kNoGCCallbackFlags) &&
1370 attempt + 1 >= kMinNumberOfAttempts) {
1371 break;
1372 }
1373 }
1374
1375 set_current_gc_flags(kNoGCFlags);
1376 new_space_->Shrink();
1377 new_lo_space_->SetCapacity(new_space_->Capacity() *
1378 kNewLargeObjectSpaceToSemiSpaceRatio);
1379 UncommitFromSpace();
1380 EagerlyFreeExternalMemory();
1381
1382 if (FLAG_trace_duplicate_threshold_kb) {
1383 std::map<int, std::vector<HeapObject>> objects_by_size;
1384 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
1385 for (PagedSpace* space = spaces.Next(); space != nullptr;
1386 space = spaces.Next()) {
1387 PagedSpaceObjectIterator it(this, space);
1388 for (HeapObject obj = it.Next(); !obj.is_null(); obj = it.Next()) {
1389 objects_by_size[obj.Size()].push_back(obj);
1390 }
1391 }
1392 {
1393 LargeObjectSpaceObjectIterator it(lo_space());
1394 for (HeapObject obj = it.Next(); !obj.is_null(); obj = it.Next()) {
1395 objects_by_size[obj.Size()].push_back(obj);
1396 }
1397 }
1398 for (auto it = objects_by_size.rbegin(); it != objects_by_size.rend();
1399 ++it) {
1400 ReportDuplicates(it->first, &it->second);
1401 }
1402 }
1403}
1404
1405void Heap::PreciseCollectAllGarbage(int flags,
1406 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason,
1407 const GCCallbackFlags gc_callback_flags) {
1408 if (!incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
1409 FinalizeIncrementalMarkingAtomically(gc_reason);
1410 }
1411 CollectAllGarbage(flags, gc_reason, gc_callback_flags);
1412}
1413
1414void Heap::ReportExternalMemoryPressure() {
1415 const GCCallbackFlags kGCCallbackFlagsForExternalMemory =
1416 static_cast<GCCallbackFlags>(
1417 kGCCallbackFlagSynchronousPhantomCallbackProcessing |
1418 kGCCallbackFlagCollectAllExternalMemory);
1419 int64_t current = external_memory_.total();
1420 int64_t baseline = external_memory_.low_since_mark_compact();
1421 int64_t limit = external_memory_.limit();
1422 TRACE_EVENT2(static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1425 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1425
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::
base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1425), (reinterpret_cast
<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1425
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "external_memory_mb", static_cast<int>((current
- baseline) / MB), "external_memory_limit_mb", static_cast<
int>((limit - baseline) / MB)); trace_event_unique_tracer1425
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, h); }
1423 "devtools.timeline,v8", "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure", "external_memory_mb",static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1425 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1425

<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1425
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "external_memory_mb", static_cast<int>((current
- baseline) / MB), "external_memory_limit_mb", static_cast<
int>((limit - baseline) / MB)); trace_event_unique_tracer1425
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, h); }
1424 static_cast<int>((current - baseline) / MB), "external_memory_limit_mb",static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1425 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1425
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::
base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1425), (reinterpret_cast
<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1425
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "external_memory_mb", static_cast<int>((current
- baseline) / MB), "external_memory_limit_mb", static_cast<
int>((limit - baseline) / MB)); trace_event_unique_tracer1425
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, h); }
1425 static_cast<int>((limit - baseline) / MB))static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1425 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1425
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::
base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1425), (reinterpret_cast
<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1425
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "external_memory_mb", static_cast<int>((current
- baseline) / MB), "external_memory_limit_mb", static_cast<
int>((limit - baseline) / MB)); trace_event_unique_tracer1425
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1425, "V8.ExternalMemoryPressure"
, h); };
1426 if (current > baseline + external_memory_hard_limit()) {
1427 CollectAllGarbage(
1428 kReduceMemoryFootprintMask,
1429 GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalMemoryPressure,
1430 static_cast<GCCallbackFlags>(kGCCallbackFlagCollectAllAvailableGarbage |
1431 kGCCallbackFlagsForExternalMemory));
1432 return;
1433 }
1434 if (incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
1435 if (incremental_marking()->CanBeActivated()) {
1436 StartIncrementalMarking(GCFlagsForIncrementalMarking(),
1437 GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalMemoryPressure,
1438 kGCCallbackFlagsForExternalMemory);
1439 } else {
1440 CollectAllGarbage(i::Heap::kNoGCFlags,
1441 GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalMemoryPressure,
1442 kGCCallbackFlagsForExternalMemory);
1443 }
1444 } else {
1445 // Incremental marking is turned on an has already been started.
1446 const double kMinStepSize = 5;
1447 const double kMaxStepSize = 10;
1448 const double ms_step = Min(
1449 kMaxStepSize,
1450 Max(kMinStepSize, static_cast<double>(current) / limit * kMinStepSize));
1451 const double deadline = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs() + ms_step;
1452 // Extend the gc callback flags with external memory flags.
1453 current_gc_callback_flags_ = static_cast<GCCallbackFlags>(
1454 current_gc_callback_flags_ | kGCCallbackFlagsForExternalMemory);
1455 incremental_marking()->AdvanceWithDeadline(
1456 deadline, IncrementalMarking::GC_VIA_STACK_GUARD, StepOrigin::kV8);
1457 }
1458}
1459
1460int64_t Heap::external_memory_limit() { return external_memory_.limit(); }
1461
1462void Heap::EnsureFillerObjectAtTop() {
1463 // There may be an allocation memento behind objects in new space. Upon
1464 // evacuation of a non-full new space (or if we are on the last page) there
1465 // may be uninitialized memory behind top. We fill the remainder of the page
1466 // with a filler.
1467 Address to_top = new_space_->top();
1468 Page* page = Page::FromAddress(to_top - kTaggedSize);
1469 if (page->Contains(to_top)) {
1470 int remaining_in_page = static_cast<int>(page->area_end() - to_top);
1471 CreateFillerObjectAt(to_top, remaining_in_page, ClearRecordedSlots::kNo);
1472 }
1473}
1474
1475Heap::DevToolsTraceEventScope::DevToolsTraceEventScope(Heap* heap,
1476 const char* event_name,
1477 const char* event_type)
1478 : heap_(heap), event_name_(event_name) {
1479 TRACE_EVENT_BEGIN2("devtools.timeline,v8", event_name_, "usedHeapSizeBefore",do { static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1480

() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::

<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1480
))); };; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const
v8::base::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1480
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('B'), trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1480

::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<

1481}
1482

1484 TRACE_EVENT_END1("devtools.timeline,v8", event_name_, "usedHeapSizeAfter",do { static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1485

<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1485

)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('E'), trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1485
, event_name_, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal

1485 heap_->SizeOfObjects())do { static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1485

; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1485 = reinterpret_cast

)) { v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('E'), trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1485
, event_name_, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal
::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<
unsigned int>(0)), "usedHeapSizeAfter", heap_->SizeOfObjects
()); } } while (false);
1486}
1487
1488bool Heap::CollectGarbage(AllocationSpace space,
1489 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason,
1490 const v8::GCCallbackFlags gc_callback_flags) {
1491 const char* collector_reason = nullptr;
1492 GarbageCollector collector = SelectGarbageCollector(space, &collector_reason);
1493 is_current_gc_forced_ = gc_callback_flags & v8::kGCCallbackFlagForced ||
1494 current_gc_flags_ & kForcedGC;
1495
1496 DevToolsTraceEventScope devtools_trace_event_scope(
1497 this, IsYoungGenerationCollector(collector) ? "MinorGC" : "MajorGC",
1498 GarbageCollectionReasonToString(gc_reason));
1499
1500 if (!CanExpandOldGeneration(new_space()->Capacity() +
1501 new_lo_space()->Size())) {
1502 InvokeNearHeapLimitCallback();
1503 }
1504
1505 // Filter on-stack reference below this method.
1506 isolate()
1507 ->global_handles()
1508 ->CleanupOnStackReferencesBelowCurrentStackPosition();
1509
1510 // Ensure that all pending phantom callbacks are invoked.
1511 isolate()->global_handles()->InvokeSecondPassPhantomCallbacks();
1512
1513 // The VM is in the GC state until exiting this function.
1514 VMState<GC> state(isolate());
1515
1516#ifdef V8_ENABLE_ALLOCATION_TIMEOUT
1517 // Reset the allocation timeout, but make sure to allow at least a few
1518 // allocations after a collection. The reason for this is that we have a lot
1519 // of allocation sequences and we assume that a garbage collection will allow
1520 // the subsequent allocation attempts to go through.
1521 if (FLAG_random_gc_interval > 0 || FLAG_gc_interval >= 0) {
1522 allocation_timeout_ = Max(6, NextAllocationTimeout(allocation_timeout_));
1523 }
1524#endif
1525
1526 EnsureFillerObjectAtTop();
1527
1528 if (IsYoungGenerationCollector(collector) &&
1529 !incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
1530 if (FLAG_trace_incremental_marking) {
1531 isolate()->PrintWithTimestamp(
1532 "[IncrementalMarking] Scavenge during marking.\n");
1533 }
1534 }
1535
1536 size_t freed_global_handles = 0;
1537
1538 size_t committed_memory_before = 0;
1539
1540 if (collector == MARK_COMPACTOR) {
1541 committed_memory_before = CommittedOldGenerationMemory();
1542 }
1543
1544 {
1545 tracer()->Start(collector, gc_reason, collector_reason);
1546 DCHECK(AllowHeapAllocation::IsAllowed())((void) 0);
1547 DisallowHeapAllocation no_allocation_during_gc;
1548 GarbageCollectionPrologue();
1549
1550 {
1551 TimedHistogram* gc_type_timer = GCTypeTimer(collector);
1552 TimedHistogramScope histogram_timer_scope(gc_type_timer, isolate_);
1553 TRACE_EVENT0("v8", gc_type_timer->name())static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1553 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1553
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("v8"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1553), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1553
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553, gc_type_timer
->name(), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal
::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<
unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer1553 .Initialize
(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1553, gc_type_timer
->name(), h); };
1554
1555 TimedHistogram* gc_type_priority_timer = GCTypePriorityTimer(collector);
1556 OptionalTimedHistogramScopeMode mode =
1557 isolate_->IsMemorySavingsModeActive()
1558 ? OptionalTimedHistogramScopeMode::DONT_TAKE_TIME
1559 : OptionalTimedHistogramScopeMode::TAKE_TIME;
1560 OptionalTimedHistogramScope histogram_timer_priority_scope(
1561 gc_type_priority_timer, isolate_, mode);
1562
1563 if (!IsYoungGenerationCollector(collector)) {
1564 PROFILE(isolate_, CodeMovingGCEvent())(isolate_)->code_event_dispatcher()->CodeMovingGCEvent(
);;
1565 }
1566
1567 GCType gc_type = collector == MARK_COMPACTOR ? kGCTypeMarkSweepCompact
1568 : kGCTypeScavenge;
1569 {
1570 GCCallbacksScope scope(this);
1571 // Temporary override any embedder stack state as callbacks may create
1572 // their own state on the stack and recursively trigger GC.
1573 EmbedderStackStateScope embedder_scope(
1574 local_embedder_heap_tracer(),
1575 EmbedderHeapTracer::EmbedderStackState::kMayContainHeapPointers);
1576 if (scope.CheckReenter()) {
1577 AllowHeapAllocation allow_allocation;
1578 AllowJavascriptExecution allow_js(isolate());
1579 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EXTERNAL_PROLOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EXTERNAL_PROLOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer
(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1579
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1579
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1579
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1579
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer1579
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1579, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
1580 VMState<EXTERNAL> state(isolate_);
1581 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate_);
1582 CallGCPrologueCallbacks(gc_type, kNoGCCallbackFlags);
1583 }
1584 }
1585
1586 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse) {
1587 tp_heap_->CollectGarbage();
1588 } else {
1589 freed_global_handles +=
1590 PerformGarbageCollection(collector, gc_callback_flags);
1591 }
1592 // Clear is_current_gc_forced now that the current GC is complete. Do this
1593 // before GarbageCollectionEpilogue() since that could trigger another
1594 // unforced GC.
1595 is_current_gc_forced_ = false;
1596
1597 {
1598 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EXTERNAL_WEAK_GLOBAL_HANDLES)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EXTERNAL_WEAK_GLOBAL_HANDLES); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope
(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1598
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1598
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1598
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1598
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer1598
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1598, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
1599 gc_post_processing_depth_++;
1600 {
1601 AllowHeapAllocation allow_allocation;
1602 AllowJavascriptExecution allow_js(isolate());
1603 freed_global_handles +=
1604 isolate_->global_handles()->PostGarbageCollectionProcessing(
1605 collector, gc_callback_flags);
1606 }
1607 gc_post_processing_depth_--;
1608 }
1609
1610 {
1611 GCCallbacksScope scope(this);
1612 if (scope.CheckReenter()) {
1613 AllowHeapAllocation allow_allocation;
1614 AllowJavascriptExecution allow_js(isolate());
1615 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EXTERNAL_EPILOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EXTERNAL_EPILOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer
(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic1615
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1615
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic1615
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer1615
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer1615
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled1615, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
1616 VMState<EXTERNAL> state(isolate_);
1617 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate_);
1618 CallGCEpilogueCallbacks(gc_type, gc_callback_flags);
1619 }
1620 }
1621 if (collector == MARK_COMPACTOR || collector == SCAVENGER) {
1622 tracer()->RecordGCPhasesHistograms(gc_type_timer);
1623 }
1624 }
1625
1626 GarbageCollectionEpilogue();
1627 if (collector == MARK_COMPACTOR && FLAG_track_detached_contexts) {
1628 isolate()->CheckDetachedContextsAfterGC();
1629 }
1630
1631 if (collector == MARK_COMPACTOR) {
1632 // Calculate used memory first, then committed memory. Following code
1633 // assumes that committed >= used, which might not hold when this is
1634 // calculated in the wrong order and background threads allocate
1635 // in-between.
1636 size_t used_memory_after = OldGenerationSizeOfObjects();
1637 size_t committed_memory_after = CommittedOldGenerationMemory();
1638 MemoryReducer::Event event;
1639 event.type = MemoryReducer::kMarkCompact;
1640 event.time_ms = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
1641 // Trigger one more GC if
1642 // - this GC decreased committed memory,
1643 // - there is high fragmentation,
1644 event.next_gc_likely_to_collect_more =
1645 (committed_memory_before > committed_memory_after + MB) ||
1646 HasHighFragmentation(used_memory_after, committed_memory_after);
1647 event.committed_memory = committed_memory_after;
1648 if (deserialization_complete_) {
1649 memory_reducer_->NotifyMarkCompact(event);
1650 }
1651 if (initial_max_old_generation_size_ < max_old_generation_size() &&
1652 used_memory_after < initial_max_old_generation_size_threshold_) {
1653 set_max_old_generation_size(initial_max_old_generation_size_);
1654 }
1655 }
1656
1657 tracer()->Stop(collector);
1658 }
1659
1660 if (collector == MARK_COMPACTOR &&
1661 (gc_callback_flags & (kGCCallbackFlagForced |
1662 kGCCallbackFlagCollectAllAvailableGarbage)) != 0) {
1663 isolate()->CountUsage(v8::Isolate::kForcedGC);
1664 }
1665
1666 collection_barrier_.CollectionPerformed();
1667
1668 // Start incremental marking for the next cycle. We do this only for scavenger
1669 // to avoid a loop where mark-compact causes another mark-compact.
1670 if (IsYoungGenerationCollector(collector)) {
1671 StartIncrementalMarkingIfAllocationLimitIsReached(
1672 GCFlagsForIncrementalMarking(),
1673 kGCCallbackScheduleIdleGarbageCollection);
1674 }
1675
1676 return freed_global_handles > 0;
1677}
1678
1679
1680int Heap::NotifyContextDisposed(bool dependant_context) {
1681 if (!dependant_context) {
1682 tracer()->ResetSurvivalEvents();
1683 old_generation_size_configured_ = false;
1684 old_generation_allocation_limit_ = initial_old_generation_size_;
1685 MemoryReducer::Event event;
1686 event.type = MemoryReducer::kPossibleGarbage;
1687 event.time_ms = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
1688 memory_reducer_->NotifyPossibleGarbage(event);
1689 }
1690 isolate()->AbortConcurrentOptimization(BlockingBehavior::kDontBlock);
1691 if (!isolate()->context().is_null()) {
1692 RemoveDirtyFinalizationRegistriesOnContext(isolate()->raw_native_context());
1693 isolate()->raw_native_context().set_retained_maps(
1694 ReadOnlyRoots(this).empty_weak_array_list());
1695 }
1696
1697 tracer()->AddContextDisposalTime(MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs());
1698 return ++contexts_disposed_;
1699}
1700
1701void Heap::StartIncrementalMarking(int gc_flags,
1702 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason,
1703 GCCallbackFlags gc_callback_flags) {
1704 DCHECK(incremental_marking()->IsStopped())((void) 0);
1705 SafepointScope safepoint(this);
1706 set_current_gc_flags(gc_flags);
1707 current_gc_callback_flags_ = gc_callback_flags;
1708 incremental_marking()->Start(gc_reason);
1709}
1710
1711void Heap::StartIncrementalMarkingIfAllocationLimitIsReached(
1712 int gc_flags, const GCCallbackFlags gc_callback_flags) {
1713 if (incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
1714 IncrementalMarkingLimit reached_limit = IncrementalMarkingLimitReached();
1715 if (reached_limit == IncrementalMarkingLimit::kSoftLimit) {
1716 incremental_marking()->incremental_marking_job()->ScheduleTask(this);
1717 } else if (reached_limit == IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit) {
1718 StartIncrementalMarking(
1719 gc_flags,
1720 OldGenerationSpaceAvailable() <= new_space_->Capacity()
1721 ? GarbageCollectionReason::kAllocationLimit
1722 : GarbageCollectionReason::kGlobalAllocationLimit,
1723 gc_callback_flags);
1724 }
1725 }
1726}
1727
1728void Heap::StartIncrementalMarkingIfAllocationLimitIsReachedBackground() {
