1729 if (!incremental_marking()->IsStopped() ||
1730 !incremental_marking()->CanBeActivated()) {
1731 return;
1732 }
1733
1734 const size_t old_generation_space_available = OldGenerationSpaceAvailable();
1735 const base::Optional<size_t> global_memory_available =
1736 GlobalMemoryAvailable();
1737
1738 if (old_generation_space_available < new_space_->Capacity() ||
1739 (global_memory_available &&
1740 *global_memory_available < new_space_->Capacity())) {
1741 incremental_marking()->incremental_marking_job()->ScheduleTask(this);
1742 }
1743}
1744
1745void Heap::StartIdleIncrementalMarking(
1746 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason,
1747 const GCCallbackFlags gc_callback_flags) {
1748 StartIncrementalMarking(kReduceMemoryFootprintMask, gc_reason,
1749 gc_callback_flags);
1750}
1751
1752void Heap::MoveRange(HeapObject dst_object, const ObjectSlot dst_slot,
1753 const ObjectSlot src_slot, int len,
1754 WriteBarrierMode mode) {
1755 DCHECK_NE(len, 0)((void) 0);
1756 DCHECK_NE(dst_object.map(), ReadOnlyRoots(this).fixed_cow_array_map())((void) 0);
1757 const ObjectSlot dst_end(dst_slot + len);
1758 // Ensure no range overflow.
1759 DCHECK(dst_slot < dst_end)((void) 0);
1760 DCHECK(src_slot < src_slot + len)((void) 0);
1761
1762 if (FLAG_concurrent_marking && incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
1763 if (dst_slot < src_slot) {
1764 // Copy tagged values forward using relaxed load/stores that do not
1765 // involve value decompression.
1766 const AtomicSlot atomic_dst_end(dst_end);
1767 AtomicSlot dst(dst_slot);
1768 AtomicSlot src(src_slot);
1769 while (dst < atomic_dst_end) {
1770 *dst = *src;
1771 ++dst;
1772 ++src;
1773 }
1774 } else {
1775 // Copy tagged values backwards using relaxed load/stores that do not
1776 // involve value decompression.
1777 const AtomicSlot atomic_dst_begin(dst_slot);
1778 AtomicSlot dst(dst_slot + len - 1);
1779 AtomicSlot src(src_slot + len - 1);
1780 while (dst >= atomic_dst_begin) {
1781 *dst = *src;
1782 --dst;
1783 --src;
1784 }
1785 }
1786 } else {
1787 MemMove(dst_slot.ToVoidPtr(), src_slot.ToVoidPtr(), len * kTaggedSize);
1788 }
1789 if (mode == SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER) return;
1790 WriteBarrierForRange(dst_object, dst_slot, dst_end);
1791}
1792
1793// Instantiate Heap::CopyRange() for ObjectSlot and MaybeObjectSlot.
1794template void Heap::CopyRange<ObjectSlot>(HeapObject dst_object,
1795 ObjectSlot dst_slot,
1796 ObjectSlot src_slot, int len,
1797 WriteBarrierMode mode);
1798template void Heap::CopyRange<MaybeObjectSlot>(HeapObject dst_object,
1799 MaybeObjectSlot dst_slot,
1800 MaybeObjectSlot src_slot,
1801 int len, WriteBarrierMode mode);
1802
1803template <typename TSlot>
1804void Heap::CopyRange(HeapObject dst_object, const TSlot dst_slot,
1805 const TSlot src_slot, int len, WriteBarrierMode mode) {
1806 DCHECK_NE(len, 0)((void) 0);
1807
1808 DCHECK_NE(dst_object.map(), ReadOnlyRoots(this).fixed_cow_array_map())((void) 0);
1809 const TSlot dst_end(dst_slot + len);
1810 // Ensure ranges do not overlap.
1811 DCHECK(dst_end <= src_slot || (src_slot + len) <= dst_slot)((void) 0);
1812
1813 if (FLAG_concurrent_marking && incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
1814 // Copy tagged values using relaxed load/stores that do not involve value
1815 // decompression.
1816 const AtomicSlot atomic_dst_end(dst_end);
1817 AtomicSlot dst(dst_slot);
1818 AtomicSlot src(src_slot);
1819 while (dst < atomic_dst_end) {
1820 *dst = *src;
1821 ++dst;
1822 ++src;
1823 }
1824 } else {
1825 MemCopy(dst_slot.ToVoidPtr(), src_slot.ToVoidPtr(), len * kTaggedSize);
1826 }
1827 if (mode == SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER) return;
1828 WriteBarrierForRange(dst_object, dst_slot, dst_end);
1829}
1830
1831#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
1832// Helper class for verifying the string table.
1833class StringTableVerifier : public RootVisitor {
1834 public:
1835 explicit StringTableVerifier(Isolate* isolate) : isolate_(isolate) {}
1836
1837 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
1838 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
1839 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
1840 }
1841 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
1842 OffHeapObjectSlot start,
1843 OffHeapObjectSlot end) override {
1844 // Visit all HeapObject pointers in [start, end).
1845 for (OffHeapObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
1846 Object o = p.load(isolate_);
1847 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(o))((void) 0);
1848 if (o.IsHeapObject()) {
1849 HeapObject object = HeapObject::cast(o);
1850 // Check that the string is actually internalized.
1851 CHECK(object.IsInternalizedString())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(object.IsInternalizedString()
)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "object.IsInternalizedString()"
); } } while (false);
1852 }
1853 }
1854 }
1855
1856 private:
1857 Isolate* isolate_;
1858};
1859
1860static void VerifyStringTable(Isolate* isolate) {
1861 StringTableVerifier verifier(isolate);
1862 isolate->string_table()->IterateElements(&verifier);
1863}
1864#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
1865
1866bool Heap::ReserveSpace(Reservation* reservations, std::vector<Address>* maps) {
1867 bool gc_performed = true;
1868 int counter = 0;
1869 static const int kThreshold = 20;
1870 while (gc_performed && counter++ < kThreshold) {
1871 gc_performed = false;
1872 for (int space = FIRST_SPACE;
1873 space < static_cast<int>(SnapshotSpace::kNumberOfHeapSpaces);
1874 space++) {
1875 Reservation* reservation = &reservations[space];
1876 DCHECK_LE(1, reservation->size())((void) 0);
1877 if (reservation->at(0).size == 0) {
1878 DCHECK_EQ(1, reservation->size())((void) 0);
1879 continue;
1880 }
1881 bool perform_gc = false;
1882 if (space == MAP_SPACE) {
1883 // We allocate each map individually to avoid fragmentation.
1884 maps->clear();
1885 DCHECK_LE(reservation->size(), 2)((void) 0);
1886 int reserved_size = 0;
1887 for (const Chunk& c : *reservation) reserved_size += c.size;
1888 DCHECK_EQ(0, reserved_size % Map::kSize)((void) 0);
1889 int num_maps = reserved_size / Map::kSize;
1890 for (int i = 0; i < num_maps; i++) {
1891 AllocationResult allocation;
1892#if V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse
1893 allocation = AllocateRaw(Map::kSize, AllocationType::kMap,
1894 AllocationOrigin::kRuntime, kWordAligned);
1895#else
1896 allocation = map_space()->AllocateRawUnaligned(Map::kSize);
1897#endif
1898 HeapObject free_space;
1899 if (allocation.To(&free_space)) {
1900 // Mark with a free list node, in case we have a GC before
1901 // deserializing.
1902 Address free_space_address = free_space.address();
1903 CreateFillerObjectAt(free_space_address, Map::kSize,
1904 ClearRecordedSlots::kNo);
1905 maps->push_back(free_space_address);
1906 } else {
1907 perform_gc = true;
1908 break;
1909 }
1910 }
1911 } else if (space == LO_SPACE) {
1912 // Just check that we can allocate during deserialization.
1913 DCHECK_LE(reservation->size(), 2)((void) 0);
1914 int reserved_size = 0;
1915 for (const Chunk& c : *reservation) reserved_size += c.size;
1916 perform_gc = !CanExpandOldGeneration(reserved_size);
1917 } else {
1918 for (auto& chunk : *reservation) {
1919 AllocationResult allocation;
1920 int size = chunk.size;
1921 DCHECK_LE(static_cast<size_t>(size),((void) 0)
1922 MemoryChunkLayout::AllocatableMemoryInMemoryChunk(((void) 0)
1923 static_cast<AllocationSpace>(space)))((void) 0);
1924#if V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse
1925 AllocationType type = (space == CODE_SPACE)
1926 ? AllocationType::kCode
1927 : (space == RO_SPACE)
1928 ? AllocationType::kReadOnly
1929 : AllocationType::kYoung;
1930 AllocationAlignment align =
1931 (space == CODE_SPACE) ? kCodeAligned : kWordAligned;
1932 allocation =
1933 AllocateRaw(size, type, AllocationOrigin::kRuntime, align);
1934#else
1935 if (space == NEW_SPACE) {
1936 allocation = new_space()->AllocateRaw(
1937 size, AllocationAlignment::kWordAligned);
1938 } else if (space == RO_SPACE) {
1939 allocation = read_only_space()->AllocateRaw(
1940 size, AllocationAlignment::kWordAligned);
1941 } else {
1942 // The deserializer will update the skip list.
1943 allocation = paged_space(space)->AllocateRawUnaligned(size);
1944 }
1945#endif
1946 HeapObject free_space;
1947 if (allocation.To(&free_space)) {
1948 // Mark with a free list node, in case we have a GC before
1949 // deserializing.
1950 Address free_space_address = free_space.address();
1951 CreateFillerObjectAt(free_space_address, size,
1952 ClearRecordedSlots::kNo);
1953 DCHECK(IsPreAllocatedSpace(static_cast<SnapshotSpace>(space)))((void) 0);
1954 chunk.start = free_space_address;
1955 chunk.end = free_space_address + size;
1956 } else {
1957 perform_gc = true;
1958 break;
1959 }
1960 }
1961 }
1962 if (perform_gc) {
1963 // We cannot perfom a GC with an uninitialized isolate. This check
1964 // fails for example if the max old space size is chosen unwisely,
1965 // so that we cannot allocate space to deserialize the initial heap.
1966 if (!deserialization_complete_) {
1967 V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(
1968 isolate(), "insufficient memory to create an Isolate");
1969 }
1970 if (space == NEW_SPACE) {
1971 CollectGarbage(NEW_SPACE, GarbageCollectionReason::kDeserializer);
1972 } else {
1973 if (counter > 1) {
1974 CollectAllGarbage(kReduceMemoryFootprintMask,
1975 GarbageCollectionReason::kDeserializer);
1976 } else {
1977 CollectAllGarbage(kNoGCFlags,
1978 GarbageCollectionReason::kDeserializer);
1979 }
1980 }
1981 gc_performed = true;
1982 break; // Abort for-loop over spaces and retry.
1983 }
1984 }
1985 }
1986
1987 return !gc_performed;
1988}
1989
1990
1991void Heap::EnsureFromSpaceIsCommitted() {
1992 if (new_space_->CommitFromSpaceIfNeeded()) return;
1993
1994 // Committing memory to from space failed.
1995 // Memory is exhausted and we will die.
1996 FatalProcessOutOfMemory("Committing semi space failed.");
1997}
1998
1999void Heap::CollectionBarrier::CollectionPerformed() {
2000 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
2001 gc_requested_ = false;
2002 cond_.NotifyAll();
2003}
2004
2005void Heap::CollectionBarrier::ShutdownRequested() {
2006 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
2007 shutdown_requested_ = true;
2008 cond_.NotifyAll();
2009}
2010
2011void Heap::CollectionBarrier::Wait() {
2012 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
2013
2014 if (shutdown_requested_) return;
2015
2016 if (!gc_requested_) {
2017 heap_->MemoryPressureNotification(MemoryPressureLevel::kCritical, false);
2018 gc_requested_ = true;
2019 }
2020
2021 while (gc_requested_ && !shutdown_requested_) {
2022 cond_.Wait(&mutex_);
2023 }
2024}
2025
2026void Heap::RequestAndWaitForCollection() { collection_barrier_.Wait(); }
2027
2028void Heap::UpdateSurvivalStatistics(int start_new_space_size) {
2029 if (start_new_space_size == 0) return;
2030
2031 promotion_ratio_ = (static_cast<double>(promoted_objects_size_) /
2032 static_cast<double>(start_new_space_size) * 100);
2033
2034 if (previous_semi_space_copied_object_size_ > 0) {
2035 promotion_rate_ =
2036 (static_cast<double>(promoted_objects_size_) /
2037 static_cast<double>(previous_semi_space_copied_object_size_) * 100);
2038 } else {
2039 promotion_rate_ = 0;
2040 }
2041
2042 semi_space_copied_rate_ =
2043 (static_cast<double>(semi_space_copied_object_size_) /
2044 static_cast<double>(start_new_space_size) * 100);
2045
2046 double survival_rate = promotion_ratio_ + semi_space_copied_rate_;
2047 tracer()->AddSurvivalRatio(survival_rate);
2048}
2049
2050size_t Heap::PerformGarbageCollection(
2051 GarbageCollector collector, const v8::GCCallbackFlags gc_callback_flags) {
2052 DisallowJavascriptExecution no_js(isolate());
2053 base::Optional<SafepointScope> optional_safepoint_scope;
2054 if (FLAG_local_heaps) {
2055 optional_safepoint_scope.emplace(this);
2056 }
2057#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
2058 if (FLAG_verify_heap) {
2059 Verify();
2060 }
2061#endif
2062 tracer()->StartInSafepoint();
2063
2064 GarbageCollectionPrologueInSafepoint();
2065
2066 EnsureFromSpaceIsCommitted();
2067
2068 size_t start_young_generation_size =
2069 Heap::new_space()->Size() + new_lo_space()->SizeOfObjects();
2070
2071 switch (collector) {
2072 case MARK_COMPACTOR:
2073 MarkCompact();
2074 break;
2075 case MINOR_MARK_COMPACTOR:
2076 MinorMarkCompact();
2077 break;
2078 case SCAVENGER:
2079 Scavenge();
2080 break;
2081 }
2082
2083 ProcessPretenuringFeedback();
2084
2085 UpdateSurvivalStatistics(static_cast<int>(start_young_generation_size));
2086 ConfigureInitialOldGenerationSize();
2087
2088 if (collector != MARK_COMPACTOR) {
2089 // Objects that died in the new space might have been accounted
2090 // as bytes marked ahead of schedule by the incremental marker.
2091 incremental_marking()->UpdateMarkedBytesAfterScavenge(
2092 start_young_generation_size - SurvivedYoungObjectSize());
2093 }
2094
2095 if (!fast_promotion_mode_ || collector == MARK_COMPACTOR) {
2096 ComputeFastPromotionMode();
2097 }
2098
2099 isolate_->counters()->objs_since_last_young()->Set(0);
2100
2101 isolate_->eternal_handles()->PostGarbageCollectionProcessing();
2102
2103 // Update relocatables.
2104 Relocatable::PostGarbageCollectionProcessing(isolate_);
2105
2106 size_t freed_global_handles;
2107
2108 {
2109 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EXTERNAL_WEAK_GLOBAL_HANDLES)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EXTERNAL_WEAK_GLOBAL_HANDLES); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope
(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic2109
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2109
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2109
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer2109
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer2109
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2109, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
2110 // First round weak callbacks are not supposed to allocate and trigger
2111 // nested GCs.
2112 freed_global_handles =
2113 isolate_->global_handles()->InvokeFirstPassWeakCallbacks();
2114 }
2115
2116 if (collector == MARK_COMPACTOR) {
2117 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::HEAP_EMBEDDER_TRACING_EPILOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
HEAP_EMBEDDER_TRACING_EPILOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope
(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic2117
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2117
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2117
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer2117
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer2117
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2117, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
2118 // TraceEpilogue may trigger operations that invalidate global handles. It
2119 // has to be called *after* all other operations that potentially touch and
2120 // reset global handles. It is also still part of the main garbage
2121 // collection pause and thus needs to be called *before* any operation that
2122 // can potentially trigger recursive garbage
2123 local_embedder_heap_tracer()->TraceEpilogue();
2124 }
2125
2126#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
2127 if (FLAG_verify_heap) {
2128 Verify();
2129 }
2130#endif
2131
2132 RecomputeLimits(collector);
2133
2134 GarbageCollectionEpilogueInSafepoint();
2135
2136 tracer()->StopInSafepoint();
2137
2138 return freed_global_handles;
2139}
2140
2141void Heap::RecomputeLimits(GarbageCollector collector) {
2142 if (!((collector == MARK_COMPACTOR) ||
2143 (HasLowYoungGenerationAllocationRate() &&
2144 old_generation_size_configured_))) {
2145 return;
2146 }
2147
2148 double v8_gc_speed =
2149 tracer()->CombinedMarkCompactSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond();
2150 double v8_mutator_speed =
2151 tracer()->CurrentOldGenerationAllocationThroughputInBytesPerMillisecond();
2152 double v8_growing_factor = MemoryController<V8HeapTrait>::GrowingFactor(
2153 this, max_old_generation_size(), v8_gc_speed, v8_mutator_speed);
2154 double global_growing_factor = 0;
2155 if (UseGlobalMemoryScheduling()) {
2156 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(local_embedder_heap_tracer())((void) 0);
2157 double embedder_gc_speed = tracer()->EmbedderSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond();
2158 double embedder_speed =
2159 tracer()->CurrentEmbedderAllocationThroughputInBytesPerMillisecond();
2160 double embedder_growing_factor =
2161 (embedder_gc_speed > 0 && embedder_speed > 0)
2162 ? MemoryController<GlobalMemoryTrait>::GrowingFactor(
2163 this, max_global_memory_size_, embedder_gc_speed,
2164 embedder_speed)
2165 : 0;
2166 global_growing_factor = Max(v8_growing_factor, embedder_growing_factor);
2167 }
2168
2169 size_t old_gen_size = OldGenerationSizeOfObjects();
2170 size_t new_space_capacity = new_space()->Capacity();
2171 HeapGrowingMode mode = CurrentHeapGrowingMode();
2172
2173 if (collector == MARK_COMPACTOR) {
2174 external_memory_.ResetAfterGC();
2175
2176 old_generation_allocation_limit_ =
2177 MemoryController<V8HeapTrait>::CalculateAllocationLimit(
2178 this, old_gen_size, min_old_generation_size_,
2179 max_old_generation_size(), new_space_capacity, v8_growing_factor,
2180 mode);
2181 if (UseGlobalMemoryScheduling()) {
2182 DCHECK_GT(global_growing_factor, 0)((void) 0);
2183 global_allocation_limit_ =
2184 MemoryController<GlobalMemoryTrait>::CalculateAllocationLimit(
2185 this, GlobalSizeOfObjects(), min_global_memory_size_,
2186 max_global_memory_size_, new_space_capacity,
2187 global_growing_factor, mode);
2188 }
2189 CheckIneffectiveMarkCompact(
2190 old_gen_size, tracer()->AverageMarkCompactMutatorUtilization());
2191 } else if (HasLowYoungGenerationAllocationRate() &&
2192 old_generation_size_configured_) {
2193 size_t new_old_generation_limit =
2194 MemoryController<V8HeapTrait>::CalculateAllocationLimit(
2195 this, old_gen_size, min_old_generation_size_,
2196 max_old_generation_size(), new_space_capacity, v8_growing_factor,
2197 mode);
2198 if (new_old_generation_limit < old_generation_allocation_limit_) {
2199 old_generation_allocation_limit_ = new_old_generation_limit;
2200 }
2201 if (UseGlobalMemoryScheduling()) {
2202 DCHECK_GT(global_growing_factor, 0)((void) 0);
2203 size_t new_global_limit =
2204 MemoryController<GlobalMemoryTrait>::CalculateAllocationLimit(
2205 this, GlobalSizeOfObjects(), min_global_memory_size_,
2206 max_global_memory_size_, new_space_capacity,
2207 global_growing_factor, mode);
2208 if (new_global_limit < global_allocation_limit_) {
2209 global_allocation_limit_ = new_global_limit;
2210 }
2211 }
2212 }
2213}
2214
2215void Heap::CallGCPrologueCallbacks(GCType gc_type, GCCallbackFlags flags) {
2216 RuntimeCallTimerScope runtime_timer(
2217 isolate(), RuntimeCallCounterId::kGCPrologueCallback);
2218 for (const GCCallbackTuple& info : gc_prologue_callbacks_) {
2219 if (gc_type & info.gc_type) {
2220 v8::Isolate* isolate = reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this->isolate());
2221 info.callback(isolate, gc_type, flags, info.data);
2222 }
2223 }
2224}
2225
2226void Heap::CallGCEpilogueCallbacks(GCType gc_type, GCCallbackFlags flags) {
2227 RuntimeCallTimerScope runtime_timer(
2228 isolate(), RuntimeCallCounterId::kGCEpilogueCallback);
2229 for (const GCCallbackTuple& info : gc_epilogue_callbacks_) {
2230 if (gc_type & info.gc_type) {
2231 v8::Isolate* isolate = reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this->isolate());
2232 info.callback(isolate, gc_type, flags, info.data);
2233 }
2234 }
2235}
2236
2237
2238void Heap::MarkCompact() {
2239 PauseAllocationObserversScope pause_observers(this);
2240
2241 SetGCState(MARK_COMPACT);
2242
2243 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("markcompact", "begin"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("markcompact", "begin"
); } while (false);
2244
2245 CodeSpaceMemoryModificationScope code_modifcation(this);
2246
2247 UpdateOldGenerationAllocationCounter();
2248 uint64_t size_of_objects_before_gc = SizeOfObjects();
2249
2250 mark_compact_collector()->Prepare();
2251
2252 ms_count_++;
2253
2254 MarkCompactPrologue();
2255
2256 mark_compact_collector()->CollectGarbage();
2257
2258 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("markcompact", "end"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("markcompact", "end"
); } while (false);
2259
2260 MarkCompactEpilogue();
2261
2262 if (FLAG_allocation_site_pretenuring) {
2263 EvaluateOldSpaceLocalPretenuring(size_of_objects_before_gc);
2264 }
2265 old_generation_size_configured_ = true;
2266 // This should be updated before PostGarbageCollectionProcessing, which
2267 // can cause another GC. Take into account the objects promoted during
2268 // GC.
2269 old_generation_allocation_counter_at_last_gc_ +=
2270 static_cast<size_t>(promoted_objects_size_);
2271 old_generation_size_at_last_gc_ = OldGenerationSizeOfObjects();
2272 global_memory_at_last_gc_ = GlobalSizeOfObjects();
2273}
2274
2275void Heap::MinorMarkCompact() {
2276#ifdef ENABLE_MINOR_MC1
2277 DCHECK(FLAG_minor_mc)((void) 0);
2278
2279 PauseAllocationObserversScope pause_observers(this);
2280 SetGCState(MINOR_MARK_COMPACT);
2281 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("MinorMarkCompact", "begin"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("MinorMarkCompact"
, "begin"); } while (false);
2282
2283 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MINOR_MC)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
MINOR_MC); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id
); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic2283 =
0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2283
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2283
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer2283
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer2283
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2283, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
2284 AlwaysAllocateScope always_allocate(this);
2285 IncrementalMarking::PauseBlackAllocationScope pause_black_allocation(
2286 incremental_marking());
2287 ConcurrentMarking::PauseScope pause_scope(concurrent_marking());
2288
2289 minor_mark_compact_collector()->CollectGarbage();
2290
2291 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("MinorMarkCompact", "end"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("MinorMarkCompact"
, "end"); } while (false);
2292 SetGCState(NOT_IN_GC);
2293#else
2294 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
2295#endif // ENABLE_MINOR_MC
2296}
2297
2298void Heap::MarkCompactEpilogue() {
2299 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_EPILOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
MC_EPILOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id
); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic2299 =
0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2299
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2299
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer2299
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer2299
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2299, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
2300 SetGCState(NOT_IN_GC);
2301
2302 isolate_->counters()->objs_since_last_full()->Set(0);
2303
2304 incremental_marking()->Epilogue();
2305
2306 DCHECK(incremental_marking()->IsStopped())((void) 0);
2307}
2308
2309
2310void Heap::MarkCompactPrologue() {
2311 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_PROLOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
MC_PROLOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id
); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic2311 =
0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2311
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2311
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer2311
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer2311
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2311, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
2312 isolate_->descriptor_lookup_cache()->Clear();
2313 RegExpResultsCache::Clear(string_split_cache());
2314 RegExpResultsCache::Clear(regexp_multiple_cache());
2315
2316 isolate_->compilation_cache()->MarkCompactPrologue();
2317
2318 FlushNumberStringCache();
2319}
2320
2321
2322void Heap::CheckNewSpaceExpansionCriteria() {
2323 if (new_space_->TotalCapacity() < new_space_->MaximumCapacity() &&
2324 survived_since_last_expansion_ > new_space_->TotalCapacity()) {
2325 // Grow the size of new space if there is room to grow, and enough data
2326 // has survived scavenge since the last expansion.
2327 new_space_->Grow();
2328 survived_since_last_expansion_ = 0;
2329 }
2330 new_lo_space()->SetCapacity(new_space()->Capacity());
2331}
2332
2333void Heap::EvacuateYoungGeneration() {
2334 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::SCAVENGER_FAST_PROMOTE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
SCAVENGER_FAST_PROMOTE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer
(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic2334
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2334
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2334
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer2334
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer2334
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2334, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
2335 base::MutexGuard guard(relocation_mutex());
2336 ConcurrentMarking::PauseScope pause_scope(concurrent_marking());
2337 if (!FLAG_concurrent_marking) {
2338 DCHECK(fast_promotion_mode_)((void) 0);
2339 DCHECK(((void) 0)
2340 CanExpandOldGeneration(new_space()->Size() + new_lo_space()->Size()))((void) 0);
2341 }
2342
2343 mark_compact_collector()->sweeper()->EnsureIterabilityCompleted();
2344
2345 SetGCState(SCAVENGE);
2346 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("scavenge", "begin"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("scavenge", "begin"
); } while (false);
2347
2348 // Move pages from new->old generation.
2349 PageRange range(new_space()->first_allocatable_address(), new_space()->top());
2350 for (auto it = range.begin(); it != range.end();) {
2351 Page* p = (*++it)->prev_page();
2352 new_space()->from_space().RemovePage(p);
2353 Page::ConvertNewToOld(p);
2354 if (incremental_marking()->IsMarking())
2355 mark_compact_collector()->RecordLiveSlotsOnPage(p);
2356 }
2357
2358 // Reset new space.
2359 if (!new_space()->Rebalance()) {
2360 FatalProcessOutOfMemory("NewSpace::Rebalance");
2361 }
2362 new_space()->ResetLinearAllocationArea();
2363 new_space()->set_age_mark(new_space()->top());
2364
2365 for (auto it = new_lo_space()->begin(); it != new_lo_space()->end();) {
2366 LargePage* page = *it;
2367 // Increment has to happen after we save the page, because it is going to
2368 // be removed below.
2369 it++;
2370 lo_space()->PromoteNewLargeObject(page);
2371 }
2372
2373 // Fix up special trackers.
2374 external_string_table_.PromoteYoung();
2375 // GlobalHandles are updated in PostGarbageCollectonProcessing
2376
2377 size_t promoted = new_space()->Size() + new_lo_space()->Size();
2378 IncrementYoungSurvivorsCounter(promoted);
2379 IncrementPromotedObjectsSize(promoted);
2380 IncrementSemiSpaceCopiedObjectSize(0);
2381
2382 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("scavenge", "end"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("scavenge", "end"
); } while (false);
2383 SetGCState(NOT_IN_GC);
2384}
2385
2386void Heap::Scavenge() {
2387 if ((fast_promotion_mode_ &&
2388 CanExpandOldGeneration(new_space()->Size() + new_lo_space()->Size()))) {
2389 tracer()->NotifyYoungGenerationHandling(
2390 YoungGenerationHandling::kFastPromotionDuringScavenge);
2391 EvacuateYoungGeneration();
2392 return;
2393 }
2394 tracer()->NotifyYoungGenerationHandling(
2395 YoungGenerationHandling::kRegularScavenge);
2396
2397 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::SCAVENGER_SCAVENGE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
SCAVENGER_SCAVENGE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope(tracer()
, gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic2397
= 0; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2397
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline," "disabled-by-default-"
"v8.gc"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic2397
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer2397
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397, GCTracer::Scope
::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope
, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId,
(static_cast<unsigned int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer2397
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled2397, GCTracer
::Scope::Name(gc_tracer_scope_id), h); };
2398 base::MutexGuard guard(relocation_mutex());
2399 ConcurrentMarking::PauseScope pause_scope(concurrent_marking());
2400 // There are soft limits in the allocation code, designed to trigger a mark
2401 // sweep collection by failing allocations. There is no sense in trying to
2402 // trigger one during scavenge: scavenges allocation should always succeed.
2403 AlwaysAllocateScope scope(this);
2404
2405 // Bump-pointer allocations done during scavenge are not real allocations.
2406 // Pause the inline allocation steps.
2407 PauseAllocationObserversScope pause_observers(this);
2408 IncrementalMarking::PauseBlackAllocationScope pause_black_allocation(
2409 incremental_marking());
2410
2411
2412 mark_compact_collector()->sweeper()->EnsureIterabilityCompleted();
2413
2414 SetGCState(SCAVENGE);
2415
2416 // Flip the semispaces. After flipping, to space is empty, from space has
2417 // live objects.
2418 new_space()->Flip();
2419 new_space()->ResetLinearAllocationArea();
2420
2421 // We also flip the young generation large object space. All large objects
2422 // will be in the from space.
2423 new_lo_space()->Flip();
2424 new_lo_space()->ResetPendingObject();
2425
2426 // Implements Cheney's copying algorithm
2427 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("scavenge", "begin"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("scavenge", "begin"
); } while (false);
2428
2429 scavenger_collector_->CollectGarbage();
2430
2431 LOG(isolate_, ResourceEvent("scavenge", "end"))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->ResourceEvent("scavenge", "end"
); } while (false);
2432
2433 SetGCState(NOT_IN_GC);
2434}
2435
2436void Heap::ComputeFastPromotionMode() {
2437 const size_t survived_in_new_space =
2438 survived_last_scavenge_ * 100 / new_space_->Capacity();
2439 fast_promotion_mode_ =
2440 !FLAG_optimize_for_size && FLAG_fast_promotion_new_space &&
2441 !ShouldReduceMemory() && new_space_->IsAtMaximumCapacity() &&
2442 survived_in_new_space >= kMinPromotedPercentForFastPromotionMode;
2443 if (FLAG_trace_gc_verbose && !FLAG_trace_gc_ignore_scavenger) {
2444 PrintIsolate(isolate(), "Fast promotion mode: %s survival rate: %zu%%\n",
2445 fast_promotion_mode_ ? "true" : "false",
2446 survived_in_new_space);
2447 }
2448}
2449
2450void Heap::UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(MemoryChunk* chunk) {
2451 if (unprotected_memory_chunks_registry_enabled_) {
2452 base::MutexGuard guard(&unprotected_memory_chunks_mutex_);
2453 if (unprotected_memory_chunks_.insert(chunk).second) {
2454 chunk->SetReadAndWritable();
2455 }
2456 }
2457}
2458
2459void Heap::UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(HeapObject object) {
2460 UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object));
2461}
2462
2463void Heap::UnregisterUnprotectedMemoryChunk(MemoryChunk* chunk) {
2464 unprotected_memory_chunks_.erase(chunk);
2465}
2466
2467void Heap::ProtectUnprotectedMemoryChunks() {
2468 DCHECK(unprotected_memory_chunks_registry_enabled_)((void) 0);
2469 for (auto chunk = unprotected_memory_chunks_.begin();
2470 chunk != unprotected_memory_chunks_.end(); chunk++) {
2471 CHECK(memory_allocator()->IsMemoryChunkExecutable(*chunk))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(memory_allocator()->IsMemoryChunkExecutable
(*chunk))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "memory_allocator()->IsMemoryChunkExecutable(*chunk)"
); } } while (false);
2472 (*chunk)->SetDefaultCodePermissions();
2473 }
2474 unprotected_memory_chunks_.clear();
2475}
2476
2477bool Heap::ExternalStringTable::Contains(String string) {
2478 for (size_t i = 0; i < young_strings_.size(); ++i) {
2479 if (young_strings_[i] == string) return true;
2480 }
2481 for (size_t i = 0; i < old_strings_.size(); ++i) {
2482 if (old_strings_[i] == string) return true;
2483 }
2484 return false;
2485}
2486
2487void Heap::UpdateExternalString(String string, size_t old_payload,
2488 size_t new_payload) {
2489 DCHECK(string.IsExternalString())((void) 0);
2490 Page* page = Page::FromHeapObject(string);
2491
2492 if (old_payload > new_payload) {
2493 page->DecrementExternalBackingStoreBytes(
2494 ExternalBackingStoreType::kExternalString, old_payload - new_payload);
2495 } else {
2496 page->IncrementExternalBackingStoreBytes(
2497 ExternalBackingStoreType::kExternalString, new_payload - old_payload);
2498 }
2499}
2500
2501String Heap::UpdateYoungReferenceInExternalStringTableEntry(Heap* heap,
2502 FullObjectSlot p) {
2503 HeapObject obj = HeapObject::cast(*p);
2504 MapWord first_word = obj.map_word();
2505
2506 String new_string;
2507
2508 if (InFromPage(obj)) {
2509 if (!first_word.IsForwardingAddress()) {
2510 // Unreachable external string can be finalized.
2511 String string = String::cast(obj);
2512 if (!string.IsExternalString()) {
2513 // Original external string has been internalized.
2514 DCHECK(string.IsThinString())((void) 0);
2515 return String();
2516 }
2517 heap->FinalizeExternalString(string);
2518 return String();
2519 }
2520 new_string = String::cast(first_word.ToForwardingAddress());
2521 } else {
2522 new_string = String::cast(obj);
2523 }
2524
2525 // String is still reachable.
2526 if (new_string.IsThinString()) {
2527 // Filtering Thin strings out of the external string table.
2528 return String();
2529 } else if (new_string.IsExternalString()) {
2530 MemoryChunk::MoveExternalBackingStoreBytes(
2531 ExternalBackingStoreType::kExternalString,
2532 Page::FromAddress((*p).ptr()), Page::FromHeapObject(new_string),
2533 ExternalString::cast(new_string).ExternalPayloadSize());
2534 return new_string;
2535 }
2536
2537 // Internalization can replace external strings with non-external strings.
2538 return new_string.IsExternalString() ? new_string : String();
2539}
2540
2541void Heap::ExternalStringTable::VerifyYoung() {
2542#ifdef DEBUG
2543 std::set<String> visited_map;
2544 std::map<MemoryChunk*, size_t> size_map;
2545 ExternalBackingStoreType type = ExternalBackingStoreType::kExternalString;
2546 for (size_t i = 0; i < young_strings_.size(); ++i) {
2547 String obj = String::cast(young_strings_[i]);
2548 MemoryChunk* mc = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj);
2549 DCHECK(mc->InYoungGeneration())((void) 0);
2550 DCHECK(heap_->InYoungGeneration(obj))((void) 0);
2551 DCHECK(!obj.IsTheHole(heap_->isolate()))((void) 0);
2552 DCHECK(obj.IsExternalString())((void) 0);
2553 // Note: we can have repeated elements in the table.
2554 DCHECK_EQ(0, visited_map.count(obj))((void) 0);
2555 visited_map.insert(obj);
2556 size_map[mc] += ExternalString::cast(obj).ExternalPayloadSize();
2557 }
2558 for (std::map<MemoryChunk*, size_t>::iterator it = size_map.begin();
2559 it != size_map.end(); it++)
2560 DCHECK_EQ(it->first->ExternalBackingStoreBytes(type), it->second)((void) 0);
2561#endif
2562}
2563
2564void Heap::ExternalStringTable::Verify() {
2565#ifdef DEBUG
2566 std::set<String> visited_map;
2567 std::map<MemoryChunk*, size_t> size_map;
2568 ExternalBackingStoreType type = ExternalBackingStoreType::kExternalString;
2569 VerifyYoung();
2570 for (size_t i = 0; i < old_strings_.size(); ++i) {
2571 String obj = String::cast(old_strings_[i]);
2572 MemoryChunk* mc = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj);
2573 DCHECK(!mc->InYoungGeneration())((void) 0);
2574 DCHECK(!heap_->InYoungGeneration(obj))((void) 0);
2575 DCHECK(!obj.IsTheHole(heap_->isolate()))((void) 0);
2576 DCHECK(obj.IsExternalString())((void) 0);
2577 // Note: we can have repeated elements in the table.
2578 DCHECK_EQ(0, visited_map.count(obj))((void) 0);
2579 visited_map.insert(obj);
2580 size_map[mc] += ExternalString::cast(obj).ExternalPayloadSize();
2581 }
2582 for (std::map<MemoryChunk*, size_t>::iterator it = size_map.begin();
2583 it != size_map.end(); it++)
2584 DCHECK_EQ(it->first->ExternalBackingStoreBytes(type), it->second)((void) 0);
2585#endif
2586}
2587
2588void Heap::ExternalStringTable::UpdateYoungReferences(
2589 Heap::ExternalStringTableUpdaterCallback updater_func) {
2590 if (young_strings_.empty()) return;
2591
2592 FullObjectSlot start(young_strings_.data());
2593 FullObjectSlot end(young_strings_.data() + young_strings_.size());
2594 FullObjectSlot last = start;
2595
2596 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
2597 String target = updater_func(heap_, p);
2598
2599 if (target.is_null()) continue;
2600
2601 DCHECK(target.IsExternalString())((void) 0);
2602
2603 if (InYoungGeneration(target)) {
2604 // String is still in new space. Update the table entry.
2605 last.store(target);
2606 ++last;
2607 } else {
2608 // String got promoted. Move it to the old string list.
2609 old_strings_.push_back(target);
2610 }
2611 }
2612
2613 DCHECK(last <= end)((void) 0);
2614 young_strings_.resize(last - start);
2615#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
2616 if (FLAG_verify_heap) {
2617 VerifyYoung();
2618 }
2619#endif
2620}
2621
2622void Heap::ExternalStringTable::PromoteYoung() {
2623 old_strings_.reserve(old_strings_.size() + young_strings_.size());
2624 std::move(std::begin(young_strings_), std::end(young_strings_),
2625 std::back_inserter(old_strings_));
2626 young_strings_.clear();
2627}
2628
2629void Heap::ExternalStringTable::IterateYoung(RootVisitor* v) {
2630 if (!young_strings_.empty()) {
2631 v->VisitRootPointers(
2632 Root::kExternalStringsTable, nullptr,
2633 FullObjectSlot(young_strings_.data()),
2634 FullObjectSlot(young_strings_.data() + young_strings_.size()));
2635 }
2636}
2637
2638void Heap::ExternalStringTable::IterateAll(RootVisitor* v) {
2639 IterateYoung(v);
2640 if (!old_strings_.empty()) {
2641 v->VisitRootPointers(
2642 Root::kExternalStringsTable, nullptr,
2643 FullObjectSlot(old_strings_.data()),
2644 FullObjectSlot(old_strings_.data() + old_strings_.size()));
2645 }
2646}
2647
2648void Heap::UpdateYoungReferencesInExternalStringTable(
2649 ExternalStringTableUpdaterCallback updater_func) {
2650 external_string_table_.UpdateYoungReferences(updater_func);
2651}
2652
2653void Heap::ExternalStringTable::UpdateReferences(
2654 Heap::ExternalStringTableUpdaterCallback updater_func) {
2655 if (old_strings_.size() > 0) {
2656 FullObjectSlot start(old_strings_.data());
2657 FullObjectSlot end(old_strings_.data() + old_strings_.size());
2658 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p)
2659 p.store(updater_func(heap_, p));
2660 }
2661
2662 UpdateYoungReferences(updater_func);
2663}
2664
2665void Heap::UpdateReferencesInExternalStringTable(
2666 ExternalStringTableUpdaterCallback updater_func) {
2667 external_string_table_.UpdateReferences(updater_func);
2668}
2669
2670
2671void Heap::ProcessAllWeakReferences(WeakObjectRetainer* retainer) {
2672 ProcessNativeContexts(retainer);
2673 ProcessAllocationSites(retainer);
2674 ProcessDirtyJSFinalizationRegistries(retainer);
2675}
2676
2677
2678void Heap::ProcessYoungWeakReferences(WeakObjectRetainer* retainer) {
2679 ProcessNativeContexts(retainer);
2680}
2681
2682
2683void Heap::ProcessNativeContexts(WeakObjectRetainer* retainer) {
2684 Object head = VisitWeakList<Context>(this, native_contexts_list(), retainer);
2685 // Update the head of the list of contexts.
2686 set_native_contexts_list(head);
2687}
2688
2689
2690void Heap::ProcessAllocationSites(WeakObjectRetainer* retainer) {
2691 Object allocation_site_obj =
2692 VisitWeakList<AllocationSite>(this, allocation_sites_list(), retainer);
2693 set_allocation_sites_list(allocation_site_obj);
2694}
2695
2696void Heap::ProcessDirtyJSFinalizationRegistries(WeakObjectRetainer* retainer) {
2697 Object head = VisitWeakList<JSFinalizationRegistry>(
2698 this, dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(), retainer);
2699 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(head);
2700 // If the list is empty, set the tail to undefined. Otherwise the tail is set
2701 // by WeakListVisitor<JSFinalizationRegistry>::VisitLiveObject.
2702 if (head.IsUndefined(isolate())) {
2703 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail(head);
2704 }
2705}
2706
2707void Heap::ProcessWeakListRoots(WeakObjectRetainer* retainer) {
2708 set_native_contexts_list(retainer->RetainAs(native_contexts_list()));
2709 set_allocation_sites_list(retainer->RetainAs(allocation_sites_list()));
2710 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(
2711 retainer->RetainAs(dirty_js_finalization_registries_list()));
2712 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail(
2713 retainer->RetainAs(dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail()));
2714}
2715
2716void Heap::ForeachAllocationSite(
2717 Object list, const std::function<void(AllocationSite)>& visitor) {
2718 DisallowHeapAllocation disallow_heap_allocation;
2719 Object current = list;
2720 while (current.IsAllocationSite()) {
2721 AllocationSite site = AllocationSite::cast(current);
2722 visitor(site);
2723 Object current_nested = site.nested_site();
2724 while (current_nested.IsAllocationSite()) {
2725 AllocationSite nested_site = AllocationSite::cast(current_nested);
2726 visitor(nested_site);
2727 current_nested = nested_site.nested_site();
2728 }
2729 current = site.weak_next();
2730 }
2731}
2732
2733void Heap::ResetAllAllocationSitesDependentCode(AllocationType allocation) {
2734 DisallowHeapAllocation no_allocation_scope;
2735 bool marked = false;
2736
2737 ForeachAllocationSite(allocation_sites_list(),
2738 [&marked, allocation, this](AllocationSite site) {
2739 if (site.GetAllocationType() == allocation) {
2740 site.ResetPretenureDecision();
2741 site.set_deopt_dependent_code(true);
2742 marked = true;
2743 RemoveAllocationSitePretenuringFeedback(site);
2744 return;
2745 }
2746 });
2747 if (marked) isolate_->stack_guard()->RequestDeoptMarkedAllocationSites();
2748}
2749
2750void Heap::EvaluateOldSpaceLocalPretenuring(
2751 uint64_t size_of_objects_before_gc) {
2752 uint64_t size_of_objects_after_gc = SizeOfObjects();
2753 double old_generation_survival_rate =
2754 (static_cast<double>(size_of_objects_after_gc) * 100) /
2755 static_cast<double>(size_of_objects_before_gc);
2756
2757 if (old_generation_survival_rate < kOldSurvivalRateLowThreshold) {
2758 // Too many objects died in the old generation, pretenuring of wrong
2759 // allocation sites may be the cause for that. We have to deopt all
2760 // dependent code registered in the allocation sites to re-evaluate
2761 // our pretenuring decisions.
2762 ResetAllAllocationSitesDependentCode(AllocationType::kOld);
2763 if (FLAG_trace_pretenuring) {
2764 PrintF(
2765 "Deopt all allocation sites dependent code due to low survival "
2766 "rate in the old generation %f\n",
2767 old_generation_survival_rate);
2768 }
2769 }
2770}
2771
2772
2773void Heap::VisitExternalResources(v8::ExternalResourceVisitor* visitor) {
2774 DisallowHeapAllocation no_allocation;
2775 // All external strings are listed in the external string table.
2776
2777 class ExternalStringTableVisitorAdapter : public RootVisitor {
2778 public:
2779 explicit ExternalStringTableVisitorAdapter(
2780 Isolate* isolate, v8::ExternalResourceVisitor* visitor)
2781 : isolate_(isolate), visitor_(visitor) {}
2782 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
2783 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
2784 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
2785 DCHECK((*p).IsExternalString())((void) 0);
2786 visitor_->VisitExternalString(
2787 Utils::ToLocal(Handle<String>(String::cast(*p), isolate_)));
2788 }
2789 }
2790
2791 private:
2792 Isolate* isolate_;
2793 v8::ExternalResourceVisitor* visitor_;
2794 } external_string_table_visitor(isolate(), visitor);
2795
2796 external_string_table_.IterateAll(&external_string_table_visitor);
2797}
2798
2799STATIC_ASSERT(IsAligned(FixedDoubleArray::kHeaderSize, kDoubleAlignment))static_assert(IsAligned(FixedDoubleArray::kHeaderSize, kDoubleAlignment
), "IsAligned(FixedDoubleArray::kHeaderSize, kDoubleAlignment)"
);
2800
2801#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
2802// TODO(ishell, v8:8875): When pointer compression is enabled the kHeaderSize
2803// is only kTaggedSize aligned but we can keep using unaligned access since
2804// both x64 and arm64 architectures (where pointer compression supported)
2805// allow unaligned access to doubles.
2806STATIC_ASSERT(IsAligned(ByteArray::kHeaderSize, kTaggedSize))static_assert(IsAligned(ByteArray::kHeaderSize, kTaggedSize),
"IsAligned(ByteArray::kHeaderSize, kTaggedSize)");
2807#else
2808STATIC_ASSERT(IsAligned(ByteArray::kHeaderSize, kDoubleAlignment))static_assert(IsAligned(ByteArray::kHeaderSize, kDoubleAlignment
), "IsAligned(ByteArray::kHeaderSize, kDoubleAlignment)");
2809#endif
2810
2811#ifdef V8_HOST_ARCH_32_BIT
2812// NOLINTNEXTLINE(runtime/references) (false positive)
2813STATIC_ASSERT((HeapNumber::kValueOffset & kDoubleAlignmentMask) == kTaggedSize)static_assert((HeapNumber::kValueOffset & kDoubleAlignmentMask
) == kTaggedSize, "(HeapNumber::kValueOffset & kDoubleAlignmentMask) == kTaggedSize"
);
2814#endif
2815
2816
2817int Heap::GetMaximumFillToAlign(AllocationAlignment alignment) {
2818 switch (alignment) {
2819 case kWordAligned:
2820 return 0;
2821 case kDoubleAligned:
2822 case kDoubleUnaligned:
2823 return kDoubleSize - kTaggedSize;
2824 default:
2825 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
2826 }
2827 return 0;
2828}
2829
2830// static
2831int Heap::GetFillToAlign(Address address, AllocationAlignment alignment) {
2832 if (alignment == kDoubleAligned && (address & kDoubleAlignmentMask) != 0)
2833 return kTaggedSize;
2834 if (alignment == kDoubleUnaligned && (address & kDoubleAlignmentMask) == 0)
2835 return kDoubleSize - kTaggedSize; // No fill if double is always aligned.
2836 return 0;
2837}
2838
2839size_t Heap::GetCodeRangeReservedAreaSize() {
2840 return kReservedCodeRangePages * MemoryAllocator::GetCommitPageSize();
2841}
2842
2843// static
2844HeapObject Heap::PrecedeWithFiller(ReadOnlyRoots roots, HeapObject object,
2845 int filler_size) {
2846 CreateFillerObjectAt(roots, object.address(), filler_size,
2847 ClearFreedMemoryMode::kDontClearFreedMemory);
2848 return HeapObject::FromAddress(object.address() + filler_size);
2849}
2850
2851// static
2852HeapObject Heap::AlignWithFiller(ReadOnlyRoots roots, HeapObject object,
2853 int object_size, int allocation_size,
2854 AllocationAlignment alignment) {
2855 int filler_size = allocation_size - object_size;
2856 DCHECK_LT(0, filler_size)((void) 0);
2857 int pre_filler = GetFillToAlign(object.address(), alignment);
2858 if (pre_filler) {
2859 object = PrecedeWithFiller(roots, object, pre_filler);
2860 filler_size -= pre_filler;
2861 }
2862 if (filler_size) {
2863 CreateFillerObjectAt(roots, object.address() + object_size, filler_size,
2864 ClearFreedMemoryMode::kDontClearFreedMemory);
2865 }
2866 return object;
2867}
2868
2869void* Heap::AllocateExternalBackingStore(
2870 const std::function<void*(size_t)>& allocate, size_t byte_length) {
2871 if (!always_allocate()) {
2872 size_t new_space_backing_store_bytes =
2873 new_space()->ExternalBackingStoreBytes();
2874 if (new_space_backing_store_bytes >= 2 * kMaxSemiSpaceSize &&
2875 new_space_backing_store_bytes >= byte_length) {
2876 // Performing a young generation GC amortizes over the allocated backing
2877 // store bytes and may free enough external bytes for this allocation.
2878 CollectGarbage(NEW_SPACE,
2879 GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalMemoryPressure);
2880 }
2881 }
2882 // TODO(ulan): Perform GCs proactively based on the byte_length and
2883 // the current external backing store counters.
2884 void* result = allocate(byte_length);
2885 if (result) return result;
2886 if (!always_allocate()) {
2887 for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
2888 CollectGarbage(OLD_SPACE,
2889 GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalMemoryPressure);
2890 result = allocate(byte_length);
2891 if (result) return result;
2892 }
2893 isolate()->counters()->gc_last_resort_from_handles()->Increment();
2894 CollectAllAvailableGarbage(
2895 GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalMemoryPressure);
2896 }
2897 return allocate(byte_length);
2898}
2899
2900void Heap::ConfigureInitialOldGenerationSize() {
2901 if (!old_generation_size_configured_ && tracer()->SurvivalEventsRecorded()) {
2902 const size_t minimum_growing_step =
2903 MemoryController<V8HeapTrait>::MinimumAllocationLimitGrowingStep(
2904 CurrentHeapGrowingMode());
2905 const size_t new_old_generation_allocation_limit =
2906 Max(OldGenerationSizeOfObjects() + minimum_growing_step,
2907 static_cast<size_t>(
2908 static_cast<double>(old_generation_allocation_limit_) *
2909 (tracer()->AverageSurvivalRatio() / 100)));
2910 if (new_old_generation_allocation_limit <
2911 old_generation_allocation_limit_) {
2912 old_generation_allocation_limit_ = new_old_generation_allocation_limit;
2913 } else {
2914 old_generation_size_configured_ = true;
2915 }
2916 if (UseGlobalMemoryScheduling()) {
2917 const size_t new_global_memory_limit = Max(
2918 GlobalSizeOfObjects() + minimum_growing_step,
2919 static_cast<size_t>(static_cast<double>(global_allocation_limit_) *
2920 (tracer()->AverageSurvivalRatio() / 100)));
2921 if (new_global_memory_limit < global_allocation_limit_) {
2922 global_allocation_limit_ = new_global_memory_limit;
2923 }
2924 }
2925 }
2926}
2927
2928void Heap::FlushNumberStringCache() {
2929 // Flush the number to string cache.
2930 int len = number_string_cache().length();
2931 for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
2932 number_string_cache().set_undefined(i);
2933 }
2934}
2935
2936namespace {
2937
2938HeapObject CreateFillerObjectAtImpl(ReadOnlyRoots roots, Address addr, int size,
2939 ClearFreedMemoryMode clear_memory_mode) {
2940 if (size == 0) return HeapObject();
2941 HeapObject filler = HeapObject::FromAddress(addr);
2942 if (size == kTaggedSize) {
2943 filler.set_map_after_allocation(roots.unchecked_one_pointer_filler_map(),
2944 SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER);
2945 } else if (size == 2 * kTaggedSize) {
2946 filler.set_map_after_allocation(roots.unchecked_two_pointer_filler_map(),
2947 SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER);
2948 if (clear_memory_mode == ClearFreedMemoryMode::kClearFreedMemory) {
2949 AtomicSlot slot(ObjectSlot(addr) + 1);
2950 *slot = static_cast<Tagged_t>(kClearedFreeMemoryValue);
2951 }
2952 } else {
2953 DCHECK_GT(size, 2 * kTaggedSize)((void) 0);
2954 filler.set_map_after_allocation(roots.unchecked_free_space_map(),
2955 SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER);
2956 FreeSpace::cast(filler).relaxed_write_size(size);
2957 if (clear_memory_mode == ClearFreedMemoryMode::kClearFreedMemory) {
2958 MemsetTagged(ObjectSlot(addr) + 2, Object(kClearedFreeMemoryValue),
2959 (size / kTaggedSize) - 2);
2960 }
2961 }
2962
2963 // At this point, we may be deserializing the heap from a snapshot, and
2964 // none of the maps have been created yet and are nullptr.
2965 DCHECK((filler.map_slot().contains_value(kNullAddress) &&((void) 0)
2966 !Heap::FromWritableHeapObject(filler)->deserialization_complete()) ||((void) 0)
2967 filler.map().IsMap())((void) 0);
2968
2969 return filler;
2970}
2971
2972#ifdef DEBUG
2973void VerifyNoNeedToClearSlots(Address start, Address end) {
2974 BasicMemoryChunk* basic_chunk = BasicMemoryChunk::FromAddress(start);
2975 if (basic_chunk->InReadOnlySpace()) return;
2976 MemoryChunk* chunk = static_cast<MemoryChunk*>(basic_chunk);
2977 // TODO(ulan): Support verification of large pages.
2978 if (chunk->InYoungGeneration() || chunk->IsLargePage()) return;
2979 BaseSpace* space = chunk->owner();
2980 space->heap()->VerifySlotRangeHasNoRecordedSlots(start, end);
2981}
2982#else
2983void VerifyNoNeedToClearSlots(Address start, Address end) {}
2984#endif // DEBUG
2985
2986} // namespace
2987
2988// static
2989HeapObject Heap::CreateFillerObjectAt(ReadOnlyRoots roots, Address addr,
2990 int size,
2991 ClearFreedMemoryMode clear_memory_mode) {
2992 // TODO(leszeks): Verify that no slots need to be recorded.
2993 HeapObject filler =
2994 CreateFillerObjectAtImpl(roots, addr, size, clear_memory_mode);
2995 VerifyNoNeedToClearSlots(addr, addr + size);
2996 return filler;
2997}
2998
2999void Heap::CreateFillerObjectAtBackground(
3000 Address addr, int size, ClearFreedMemoryMode clear_memory_mode) {
3001 CreateFillerObjectAtImpl(ReadOnlyRoots(this), addr, size, clear_memory_mode);
3002 // Do not verify whether slots are cleared here: the concurrent sweeper is not
3003 // allowed to access the main thread's remembered set.
3004}
3005
3006HeapObject Heap::CreateFillerObjectAt(Address addr, int size,
3007 ClearRecordedSlots clear_slots_mode) {
3008 if (size == 0) return HeapObject();
3009 HeapObject filler = CreateFillerObjectAtImpl(
3010 ReadOnlyRoots(this), addr, size,
3011 clear_slots_mode == ClearRecordedSlots::kYes
3012 ? ClearFreedMemoryMode::kClearFreedMemory
3013 : ClearFreedMemoryMode::kDontClearFreedMemory);
3014 if (!V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse) {
3015 if (clear_slots_mode == ClearRecordedSlots::kYes) {
3016 ClearRecordedSlotRange(addr, addr + size);
3017 } else {
3018 VerifyNoNeedToClearSlots(addr, addr + size);
3019 }
3020 }
3021 return filler;
3022}
3023
3024bool Heap::CanMoveObjectStart(HeapObject object) {
3025 if (!FLAG_move_object_start) return false;
3026
3027 // Sampling heap profiler may have a reference to the object.
3028 if (isolate()->heap_profiler()->is_sampling_allocations()) return false;
3029
3030 if (IsLargeObject(object)) return false;
3031
3032 // We can move the object start if the page was already swept.
3033 return Page::FromHeapObject(object)->SweepingDone();
3034}
3035
3036bool Heap::IsImmovable(HeapObject object) {
3037 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse) {
3038 // TODO(steveblackburn): For now all objects are immovable.
3039 // Will need to revisit once moving is supported.
3040 return true;
3041 }
3042
3043 BasicMemoryChunk* chunk = BasicMemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
3044 return chunk->NeverEvacuate() || IsLargeObject(object);
3045}
3046
3047bool Heap::IsLargeObject(HeapObject object) {
3048 return BasicMemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object)->IsLargePage();
3049}
3050
3051#ifdef ENABLE_SLOW_DCHECKS
3052namespace {
3053
3054class LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor : public RootVisitor {
3055 public:
3056 explicit LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor(FixedArrayBase to_check)
3057 : to_check_(to_check) {}
3058
3059 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
3060 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
3061 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
3062 DCHECK_NE(*p, to_check_)((void) 0);
3063 }
3064 }
3065
3066 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
3067 OffHeapObjectSlot start,
3068 OffHeapObjectSlot end) override {
3069 DCHECK_EQ(root, Root::kStringTable)((void) 0);
3070 // We can skip iterating the string table, it doesn't point to any fixed
3071 // arrays.
3072 }
3073
3074 private:
3075 FixedArrayBase to_check_;
3076
3077 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor)LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor(const LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor
&) = delete; LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor& operator
=(const LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor&) = delete;
3078};
3079} // namespace
3080#endif // ENABLE_SLOW_DCHECKS
3081
3082namespace {
3083bool MayContainRecordedSlots(HeapObject object) {
3084 // New space object do not have recorded slots.
3085 if (BasicMemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object)->InYoungGeneration())
3086 return false;
3087 // Allowlist objects that definitely do not have pointers.
3088 if (object.IsByteArray() || object.IsFixedDoubleArray()) return false;
3089 // Conservatively return true for other objects.
3090 return true;
3091}
3092} // namespace
3093
3094void Heap::OnMoveEvent(HeapObject target, HeapObject source,
3095 int size_in_bytes) {
3096 HeapProfiler* heap_profiler = isolate_->heap_profiler();
3097 if (heap_profiler->is_tracking_object_moves()) {
3098 heap_profiler->ObjectMoveEvent(source.address(), target.address(),
3099 size_in_bytes);
3100 }
3101 for (auto& tracker : allocation_trackers_) {
3102 tracker->MoveEvent(source.address(), target.address(), size_in_bytes);
3103 }
3104 if (target.IsSharedFunctionInfo()) {
3105 LOG_CODE_EVENT(isolate_, SharedFunctionInfoMoveEvent(source.address(),do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_listening_to_code_events()) logger->SharedFunctionInfoMoveEvent
(source.address(), target.address()); } while (false)
3106 target.address()))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_listening_to_code_events()) logger->SharedFunctionInfoMoveEvent
(source.address(), target.address()); } while (false);
3107 } else if (target.IsNativeContext()) {
3108 PROFILE(isolate_,(isolate_)->code_event_dispatcher()->NativeContextMoveEvent
(source.address(), target.address());
3109 NativeContextMoveEvent(source.address(), target.address()))(isolate_)->code_event_dispatcher()->NativeContextMoveEvent
(source.address(), target.address());;
3110 }
3111
3112 if (FLAG_verify_predictable) {
3113 ++allocations_count_;
3114 // Advance synthetic time by making a time request.
3115 MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
3116
3117 UpdateAllocationsHash(source);
3118 UpdateAllocationsHash(target);
3119 UpdateAllocationsHash(size_in_bytes);
3120
3121 if (allocations_count_ % FLAG_dump_allocations_digest_at_alloc == 0) {
3122 PrintAllocationsHash();
3123 }
3124 } else if (FLAG_fuzzer_gc_analysis) {
3125 ++allocations_count_;
3126 }
3127}
3128
3129FixedArrayBase Heap::LeftTrimFixedArray(FixedArrayBase object,
3130 int elements_to_trim) {
3131 if (elements_to_trim == 0) {
3132 // This simplifies reasoning in the rest of the function.
3133 return object;
3134 }
3135 CHECK(!object.is_null())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!object.is_null())), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "!object.is_null()"); } } while (false);
3136 DCHECK(CanMoveObjectStart(object))((void) 0);
3137 // Add custom visitor to concurrent marker if new left-trimmable type
3138 // is added.
3139 DCHECK(object.IsFixedArray() || object.IsFixedDoubleArray())((void) 0);
3140 const int element_size = object.IsFixedArray() ? kTaggedSize : kDoubleSize;
3141 const int bytes_to_trim = elements_to_trim * element_size;
3142 Map map = object.map();
3143
3144 // For now this trick is only applied to fixed arrays which may be in new
3145 // space or old space. In a large object space the object's start must
3146 // coincide with chunk and thus the trick is just not applicable.
3147 DCHECK(!IsLargeObject(object))((void) 0);
3148 DCHECK(object.map() != ReadOnlyRoots(this).fixed_cow_array_map())((void) 0);
3149
3150 STATIC_ASSERT(FixedArrayBase::kMapOffset == 0)static_assert(FixedArrayBase::kMapOffset == 0, "FixedArrayBase::kMapOffset == 0"
);
3151 STATIC_ASSERT(FixedArrayBase::kLengthOffset == kTaggedSize)static_assert(FixedArrayBase::kLengthOffset == kTaggedSize, "FixedArrayBase::kLengthOffset == kTaggedSize"
);
3152 STATIC_ASSERT(FixedArrayBase::kHeaderSize == 2 * kTaggedSize)static_assert(FixedArrayBase::kHeaderSize == 2 * kTaggedSize,
"FixedArrayBase::kHeaderSize == 2 * kTaggedSize");
3153
3154 const int len = object.length();
3155 DCHECK(elements_to_trim <= len)((void) 0);
3156
3157 // Calculate location of new array start.
3158 Address old_start = object.address();
3159 Address new_start = old_start + bytes_to_trim;
3160
3161 if (incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
3162 incremental_marking()->NotifyLeftTrimming(
3163 object, HeapObject::FromAddress(new_start));
3164 }
3165
3166#ifdef DEBUG
3167 if (MayContainRecordedSlots(object)) {
3168 MemoryChunk* chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
3169 DCHECK(!chunk->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_OLD>(object))((void) 0);
3170 DCHECK(!chunk->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_NEW>(object))((void) 0);
3171 }
3172#endif
3173
3174 // Technically in new space this write might be omitted (except for
3175 // debug mode which iterates through the heap), but to play safer
3176 // we still do it.
3177 CreateFillerObjectAt(old_start, bytes_to_trim,
3178 MayContainRecordedSlots(object)
3179 ? ClearRecordedSlots::kYes
3180 : ClearRecordedSlots::kNo);
3181
3182 // Initialize header of the trimmed array. Since left trimming is only
3183 // performed on pages which are not concurrently swept creating a filler
3184 // object does not require synchronization.
3185 RELAXED_WRITE_FIELD(object, bytes_to_trim, map)TaggedField<Object>::Relaxed_Store(object, bytes_to_trim
, map);
3186 RELAXED_WRITE_FIELD(object, bytes_to_trim + kTaggedSize,TaggedField<Object>::Relaxed_Store(object, bytes_to_trim
+ kTaggedSize, Smi::FromInt(len - elements_to_trim))
3187 Smi::FromInt(len - elements_to_trim))TaggedField<Object>::Relaxed_Store(object, bytes_to_trim
+ kTaggedSize, Smi::FromInt(len - elements_to_trim));
3188
3189 FixedArrayBase new_object =
3190 FixedArrayBase::cast(HeapObject::FromAddress(new_start));
3191
3192 // Notify the heap profiler of change in object layout.
3193 OnMoveEvent(new_object, object, new_object.Size());
3194
3195#ifdef ENABLE_SLOW_DCHECKS
3196 if (FLAG_enable_slow_asserts) {
3197 // Make sure the stack or other roots (e.g., Handles) don't contain pointers
3198 // to the original FixedArray (which is now the filler object).
3199 SafepointScope scope(this);
3200 LeftTrimmerVerifierRootVisitor root_visitor(object);
3201 ReadOnlyRoots(this).Iterate(&root_visitor);
3202 IterateRoots(&root_visitor, {});
3203 }
3204#endif // ENABLE_SLOW_DCHECKS
3205
3206 return new_object;
3207}
3208
3209void Heap::RightTrimFixedArray(FixedArrayBase object, int elements_to_trim) {
3210 const int len = object.length();
3211 DCHECK_LE(elements_to_trim, len)((void) 0);
3212 DCHECK_GE(elements_to_trim, 0)((void) 0);
3213
3214 int bytes_to_trim;
3215 if (object.IsByteArray()) {
3216 int new_size = ByteArray::SizeFor(len - elements_to_trim);
3217 bytes_to_trim = ByteArray::SizeFor(len) - new_size;
3218 DCHECK_GE(bytes_to_trim, 0)((void) 0);
3219 } else if (object.IsFixedArray()) {
3220 CHECK_NE(elements_to_trim, len)do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpNEImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(elements_to_trim)>::type, typename
::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(len)>::type>
((elements_to_trim), (len)); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(
_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "elements_to_trim"
" " "!=" " " "len"); } } while (false); } while (false);
3221 bytes_to_trim = elements_to_trim * kTaggedSize;
3222 } else {
3223 DCHECK(object.IsFixedDoubleArray())((void) 0);
3224 CHECK_NE(elements_to_trim, len)do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpNEImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(elements_to_trim)>::type, typename
::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(len)>::type>
((elements_to_trim), (len)); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(
_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "elements_to_trim"
" " "!=" " " "len"); } } while (false); } while (false);
3225 bytes_to_trim = elements_to_trim * kDoubleSize;
3226 }
3227
3228 CreateFillerForArray<FixedArrayBase>(object, elements_to_trim, bytes_to_trim);
3229}
3230
3231void Heap::RightTrimWeakFixedArray(WeakFixedArray object,
3232 int elements_to_trim) {
3233 // This function is safe to use only at the end of the mark compact
3234 // collection: When marking, we record the weak slots, and shrinking
3235 // invalidates them.
3236 DCHECK_EQ(gc_state(), MARK_COMPACT)((void) 0);
3237 CreateFillerForArray<WeakFixedArray>(object, elements_to_trim,
3238 elements_to_trim * kTaggedSize);
3239}
3240
3241template <typename T>
3242void Heap::CreateFillerForArray(T object, int elements_to_trim,
3243 int bytes_to_trim) {
3244 DCHECK(object.IsFixedArrayBase() || object.IsByteArray() ||((void) 0)
3245 object.IsWeakFixedArray())((void) 0);
3246
3247 // For now this trick is only applied to objects in new and paged space.
3248 DCHECK(object.map() != ReadOnlyRoots(this).fixed_cow_array_map())((void) 0);
3249
3250 if (bytes_to_trim == 0) {
3251 DCHECK_EQ(elements_to_trim, 0)((void) 0);
3252 // No need to create filler and update live bytes counters.
3253 return;
3254 }
3255
3256 // Calculate location of new array end.
3257 int old_size = object.Size();
3258 Address old_end = object.address() + old_size;
3259 Address new_end = old_end - bytes_to_trim;
3260
3261#ifdef DEBUG
3262 if (MayContainRecordedSlots(object)) {
3263 MemoryChunk* chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
3264 DCHECK(!chunk->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_NEW>(object))((void) 0);
3265 DCHECK(!chunk->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_OLD>(object))((void) 0);
3266 }
3267#endif
3268
3269 bool clear_slots = MayContainRecordedSlots(object);
3270
3271 // Technically in new space this write might be omitted (except for
3272 // debug mode which iterates through the heap), but to play safer
3273 // we still do it.
3274 // We do not create a filler for objects in a large object space.
3275 if (!IsLargeObject(object)) {
3276 HeapObject filler = CreateFillerObjectAt(
3277 new_end, bytes_to_trim,
3278 clear_slots ? ClearRecordedSlots::kYes : ClearRecordedSlots::kNo);
3279 DCHECK(!filler.is_null())((void) 0);
3280 // Clear the mark bits of the black area that belongs now to the filler.
3281 // This is an optimization. The sweeper will release black fillers anyway.
3282 if (incremental_marking()->black_allocation() &&
3283 incremental_marking()->marking_state()->IsBlackOrGrey(filler)) {
3284 Page* page = Page::FromAddress(new_end);
3285 incremental_marking()->marking_state()->bitmap(page)->ClearRange(
3286 page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(new_end),
3287 page->AddressToMarkbitIndex(new_end + bytes_to_trim));
3288 }
3289 } else if (clear_slots) {
3290 // Large objects are not swept, so it is not necessary to clear the
3291 // recorded slot.
3292 MemsetTagged(ObjectSlot(new_end), Object(kClearedFreeMemoryValue),
3293 (old_end - new_end) / kTaggedSize);
3294 }
3295
3296 // Initialize header of the trimmed array. We are storing the new length
3297 // using release store after creating a filler for the left-over space to
3298 // avoid races with the sweeper thread.
3299 object.synchronized_set_length(object.length() - elements_to_trim);
3300
3301 // Notify the heap object allocation tracker of change in object layout. The
3302 // array may not be moved during GC, and size has to be adjusted nevertheless.
3303 for (auto& tracker : allocation_trackers_) {
3304 tracker->UpdateObjectSizeEvent(object.address(), object.Size());
3305 }
3306}
3307
3308void Heap::MakeHeapIterable() {
3309 mark_compact_collector()->EnsureSweepingCompleted();
3310
3311 MakeLocalHeapLabsIterable();
3312}
3313
3314void Heap::MakeLocalHeapLabsIterable() {
3315 if (!FLAG_local_heaps) return;
3316 safepoint()->IterateLocalHeaps([](LocalHeap* local_heap) {
3317 local_heap->MakeLinearAllocationAreaIterable();
3318 });
3319}
3320
3321namespace {
3322
3323double ComputeMutatorUtilizationImpl(double mutator_speed, double gc_speed) {
3324 constexpr double kMinMutatorUtilization = 0.0;
3325 constexpr double kConservativeGcSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond = 200000;
3326 if (mutator_speed == 0) return kMinMutatorUtilization;
3327 if (gc_speed == 0) gc_speed = kConservativeGcSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond;
3328 // Derivation:
3329 // mutator_utilization = mutator_time / (mutator_time + gc_time)
3330 // mutator_time = 1 / mutator_speed
3331 // gc_time = 1 / gc_speed
3332 // mutator_utilization = (1 / mutator_speed) /
3333 // (1 / mutator_speed + 1 / gc_speed)
3334 // mutator_utilization = gc_speed / (mutator_speed + gc_speed)
3335 return gc_speed / (mutator_speed + gc_speed);
3336}
3337
3338} // namespace
3339
3340double Heap::ComputeMutatorUtilization(const char* tag, double mutator_speed,
3341 double gc_speed) {
3342 double result = ComputeMutatorUtilizationImpl(mutator_speed, gc_speed);
3343 if (FLAG_trace_mutator_utilization) {
3344 isolate()->PrintWithTimestamp(
3345 "%s mutator utilization = %.3f ("
3346 "mutator_speed=%.f, gc_speed=%.f)\n",
3347 tag, result, mutator_speed, gc_speed);
3348 }
3349 return result;
3350}
3351
3352bool Heap::HasLowYoungGenerationAllocationRate() {
3353 double mu = ComputeMutatorUtilization(
3354 "Young generation",
3355 tracer()->NewSpaceAllocationThroughputInBytesPerMillisecond(),
3356 tracer()->ScavengeSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond(kForSurvivedObjects));
3357 constexpr double kHighMutatorUtilization = 0.993;
3358 return mu > kHighMutatorUtilization;
3359}
3360
3361bool Heap::HasLowOldGenerationAllocationRate() {
3362 double mu = ComputeMutatorUtilization(
3363 "Old generation",
3364 tracer()->OldGenerationAllocationThroughputInBytesPerMillisecond(),
3365 tracer()->CombinedMarkCompactSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond());
3366 const double kHighMutatorUtilization = 0.993;
3367 return mu > kHighMutatorUtilization;
3368}
3369
3370bool Heap::HasLowEmbedderAllocationRate() {
3371 if (!UseGlobalMemoryScheduling()) return true;
3372
3373 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(local_embedder_heap_tracer())((void) 0);
3374 double mu = ComputeMutatorUtilization(
3375 "Embedder",
3376 tracer()->CurrentEmbedderAllocationThroughputInBytesPerMillisecond(),
3377 tracer()->EmbedderSpeedInBytesPerMillisecond());
3378 const double kHighMutatorUtilization = 0.993;
3379 return mu > kHighMutatorUtilization;
3380}
3381
3382bool Heap::HasLowAllocationRate() {
3383 return HasLowYoungGenerationAllocationRate() &&
3384 HasLowOldGenerationAllocationRate() && HasLowEmbedderAllocationRate();
3385}
3386
3387bool Heap::IsIneffectiveMarkCompact(size_t old_generation_size,
3388 double mutator_utilization) {
3389 const double kHighHeapPercentage = 0.8;
3390 const double kLowMutatorUtilization = 0.4;
3391 return old_generation_size >=
3392 kHighHeapPercentage * max_old_generation_size() &&
3393 mutator_utilization < kLowMutatorUtilization;
3394}
3395
3396void Heap::CheckIneffectiveMarkCompact(size_t old_generation_size,
3397 double mutator_utilization) {
3398 const int kMaxConsecutiveIneffectiveMarkCompacts = 4;
3399 if (!FLAG_detect_ineffective_gcs_near_heap_limit) return;
3400 if (!IsIneffectiveMarkCompact(old_generation_size, mutator_utilization)) {
3401 consecutive_ineffective_mark_compacts_ = 0;
3402 return;
3403 }
3404 ++consecutive_ineffective_mark_compacts_;
3405 if (consecutive_ineffective_mark_compacts_ ==
3406 kMaxConsecutiveIneffectiveMarkCompacts) {
3407 if (InvokeNearHeapLimitCallback()) {
3408 // The callback increased the heap limit.
3409 consecutive_ineffective_mark_compacts_ = 0;
3410 return;
3411 }
3412 FatalProcessOutOfMemory("Ineffective mark-compacts near heap limit");
3413 }
3414}
3415
3416bool Heap::HasHighFragmentation() {
3417 size_t used = OldGenerationSizeOfObjects();
3418 size_t committed = CommittedOldGenerationMemory();
3419 return HasHighFragmentation(used, committed);
3420}
3421
3422bool Heap::HasHighFragmentation(size_t used, size_t committed) {
3423 const size_t kSlack = 16 * MB;
3424 // Fragmentation is high if committed > 2 * used + kSlack.
3425 // Rewrite the exression to avoid overflow.
3426 DCHECK_GE(committed, used)((void) 0);
3427 return committed - used > used + kSlack;
3428}
3429
3430bool Heap::ShouldOptimizeForMemoryUsage() {
3431 const size_t kOldGenerationSlack = max_old_generation_size() / 8;
3432 return FLAG_optimize_for_size || isolate()->IsIsolateInBackground() ||
3433 isolate()->IsMemorySavingsModeActive() || HighMemoryPressure() ||
3434 !CanExpandOldGeneration(kOldGenerationSlack);
3435}
3436
3437void Heap::ActivateMemoryReducerIfNeeded() {
3438 // Activate memory reducer when switching to background if
3439 // - there was no mark compact since the start.
3440 // - the committed memory can be potentially reduced.
3441 // 2 pages for the old, code, and map space + 1 page for new space.
3442 const int kMinCommittedMemory = 7 * Page::kPageSize;
3443 if (ms_count_ == 0 && CommittedMemory() > kMinCommittedMemory &&
3444 isolate()->IsIsolateInBackground()) {
3445 MemoryReducer::Event event;
3446 event.type = MemoryReducer::kPossibleGarbage;
3447 event.time_ms = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
3448 memory_reducer_->NotifyPossibleGarbage(event);
3449 }
3450}
3451
3452void Heap::ReduceNewSpaceSize() {
3453 // TODO(ulan): Unify this constant with the similar constant in
3454 // GCIdleTimeHandler once the change is merged to 4.5.
3455 static const size_t kLowAllocationThroughput = 1000;
3456 const double allocation_throughput =
3457 tracer()->CurrentAllocationThroughputInBytesPerMillisecond();
3458
3459 if (FLAG_predictable) return;
3460
3461 if (ShouldReduceMemory() ||
3462 ((allocation_throughput != 0) &&
3463 (allocation_throughput < kLowAllocationThroughput))) {
3464 new_space_->Shrink();
3465 new_lo_space_->SetCapacity(new_space_->Capacity());
3466 UncommitFromSpace();
3467 }
3468}
3469
3470void Heap::FinalizeIncrementalMarkingIfComplete(
3471 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason) {
3472 if (incremental_marking()->IsMarking() &&
3473 (incremental_marking()->IsReadyToOverApproximateWeakClosure() ||
3474 (!incremental_marking()->finalize_marking_completed() &&
3475 mark_compact_collector()->local_marking_worklists()->IsEmpty() &&
3476 local_embedder_heap_tracer()->ShouldFinalizeIncrementalMarking()))) {
3477 FinalizeIncrementalMarkingIncrementally(gc_reason);
