3478 } else if (incremental_marking()->IsComplete() ||
3479 (incremental_marking()->IsMarking() &&
3480 mark_compact_collector()->local_marking_worklists()->IsEmpty() &&
3481 local_embedder_heap_tracer()
3482 ->ShouldFinalizeIncrementalMarking())) {
3483 CollectAllGarbage(current_gc_flags_, gc_reason, current_gc_callback_flags_);
3484 }
3485}
3486
3487void Heap::FinalizeIncrementalMarkingAtomically(
3488 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason) {
3489 DCHECK(!incremental_marking()->IsStopped())((void) 0);
3490 CollectAllGarbage(current_gc_flags_, gc_reason, current_gc_callback_flags_);
3491}
3492
3493void Heap::InvokeIncrementalMarkingPrologueCallbacks() {

3495 if (scope.CheckReenter()) {
3496 AllowHeapAllocation allow_allocation;
3497 TRACE_GC(tracer(), GCTracer::Scope::MC_INCREMENTAL_EXTERNAL_PROLOGUE)GCTracer::Scope::ScopeId gc_tracer_scope_id(GCTracer::Scope::
MC_INCREMENTAL_EXTERNAL_PROLOGUE); GCTracer::Scope gc_tracer_scope
(tracer(), gc_tracer_scope_id); static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3497

3501 }
3502}

3514
3515void Heap::FinalizeIncrementalMarkingIncrementally(
3516 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason) {
3517 if (FLAG_trace_incremental_marking) {
3518 isolate()->PrintWithTimestamp(
3519 "[IncrementalMarking] (%s).\n",
3520 Heap::GarbageCollectionReasonToString(gc_reason));
3521 }
3522
3523 DevToolsTraceEventScope devtools_trace_event_scope(
3524 this, "MajorGC", "incremental finalization step");
3525
3526 HistogramTimerScope incremental_marking_scope(
3527 isolate()->counters()->gc_incremental_marking_finalize());

3530
3531 SafepointScope safepoint(this);
3532 InvokeIncrementalMarkingPrologueCallbacks();
3533 incremental_marking()->FinalizeIncrementally();
3534 InvokeIncrementalMarkingEpilogueCallbacks();
3535}
3536
3537void Heap::RegisterDeserializedObjectsForBlackAllocation(
3538 Reservation* reservations, const std::vector<HeapObject>& large_objects,
3539 const std::vector<Address>& maps) {
3540 // TODO(ulan): pause black allocation during deserialization to avoid
3541 // iterating all these objects in one go.
3542
3543 if (!incremental_marking()->black_allocation()) return;
3544
3545 // Iterate black objects in old space, code space, map space, and large
3546 // object space for side effects.
3547 IncrementalMarking::MarkingState* marking_state =
3548 incremental_marking()->marking_state();
3549 for (int i = OLD_SPACE;
3550 i < static_cast<int>(SnapshotSpace::kNumberOfHeapSpaces); i++) {
3551 const Heap::Reservation& res = reservations[i];
3552 for (auto& chunk : res) {
3553 Address addr = chunk.start;
3554 while (addr < chunk.end) {
3555 HeapObject obj = HeapObject::FromAddress(addr);
3556 // Objects can have any color because incremental marking can
3557 // start in the middle of Heap::ReserveSpace().
3558 if (marking_state->IsBlack(obj)) {
3559 incremental_marking()->ProcessBlackAllocatedObject(obj);
3560 }
3561 addr += obj.Size();
3562 }
3563 }
3564 }
3565
3566 // Large object space doesn't use reservations, so it needs custom handling.
3567 for (HeapObject object : large_objects) {
3568 incremental_marking()->ProcessBlackAllocatedObject(object);
3569 }
3570
3571 // Map space doesn't use reservations, so it needs custom handling.
3572 for (Address addr : maps) {
3573 incremental_marking()->ProcessBlackAllocatedObject(
3574 HeapObject::FromAddress(addr));
3575 }
3576}
3577
3578void Heap::NotifyObjectLayoutChange(
3579 HeapObject object, const DisallowHeapAllocation&,
3580 InvalidateRecordedSlots invalidate_recorded_slots) {
3581 if (incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
3582 incremental_marking()->MarkBlackAndVisitObjectDueToLayoutChange(object);
3583 if (incremental_marking()->IsCompacting() &&
3584 invalidate_recorded_slots == InvalidateRecordedSlots::kYes &&
3585 MayContainRecordedSlots(object)) {
3586 MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object)
3587 ->RegisterObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_OLD>(object);
3588 }
3589 }
3590 if (invalidate_recorded_slots == InvalidateRecordedSlots::kYes &&
3591 MayContainRecordedSlots(object)) {
3592 MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object)
3593 ->RegisterObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_NEW>(object);
3594 }
3595#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
3596 if (FLAG_verify_heap) {
3597 DCHECK(pending_layout_change_object_.is_null())((void) 0);
3598 pending_layout_change_object_ = object;
3599 }
3600#endif
3601}
3602
3603#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
3604// Helper class for collecting slot addresses.
3605class SlotCollectingVisitor final : public ObjectVisitor {
3606 public:
3607 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, ObjectSlot start,
3608 ObjectSlot end) override {
3609 VisitPointers(host, MaybeObjectSlot(start), MaybeObjectSlot(end));
3610 }
3611 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
3612 MaybeObjectSlot end) final {
3613 for (MaybeObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
3614 slots_.push_back(p);
3615 }
3616 }
3617
3618 void VisitCodeTarget(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) final { UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code"); }
3619
3620 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
3621 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
3622 }
3623
3624 int number_of_slots() { return static_cast<int>(slots_.size()); }
3625
3626 MaybeObjectSlot slot(int i) { return slots_[i]; }
3627
3628 private:
3629 std::vector<MaybeObjectSlot> slots_;
3630};
3631
3632void Heap::VerifyObjectLayoutChange(HeapObject object, Map new_map) {
3633 if (!FLAG_verify_heap) return;
3634
3635 // Check that Heap::NotifyObjectLayout was called for object transitions
3636 // that are not safe for concurrent marking.
3637 // If you see this check triggering for a freshly allocated object,
3638 // use object->set_map_after_allocation() to initialize its map.
3639 if (pending_layout_change_object_.is_null()) {
3640 if (object.IsJSObject()) {
3641 DCHECK(!object.map().TransitionRequiresSynchronizationWithGC(new_map))((void) 0);
3642 } else {
3643 // Check that the set of slots before and after the transition match.
3644 SlotCollectingVisitor old_visitor;
3645 object.IterateFast(&old_visitor);
3646 MapWord old_map_word = object.map_word();
3647 // Temporarily set the new map to iterate new slots.
3648 object.set_map_word(MapWord::FromMap(new_map));
3649 SlotCollectingVisitor new_visitor;
3650 object.IterateFast(&new_visitor);
3651 // Restore the old map.
3652 object.set_map_word(old_map_word);
3653 DCHECK_EQ(new_visitor.number_of_slots(), old_visitor.number_of_slots())((void) 0);
3654 for (int i = 0; i < new_visitor.number_of_slots(); i++) {
3655 DCHECK(new_visitor.slot(i) == old_visitor.slot(i))((void) 0);
3656 }
3657 }
3658 } else {
3659 DCHECK_EQ(pending_layout_change_object_, object)((void) 0);
3660 pending_layout_change_object_ = HeapObject();
3661 }
3662}
3663#endif
3664
3665GCIdleTimeHeapState Heap::ComputeHeapState() {
3666 GCIdleTimeHeapState heap_state;
3667 heap_state.contexts_disposed = contexts_disposed_;
3668 heap_state.contexts_disposal_rate =
3669 tracer()->ContextDisposalRateInMilliseconds();
3670 heap_state.size_of_objects = static_cast<size_t>(SizeOfObjects());
3671 heap_state.incremental_marking_stopped = incremental_marking()->IsStopped();
3672 return heap_state;
3673}
3674
3675

3677 GCIdleTimeHeapState heap_state,
3678 double deadline_in_ms) {
3679 bool result = false;
3680 switch (action) {

3687 StepOrigin::kTask);
3688 FinalizeIncrementalMarkingIfComplete(
3689 GarbageCollectionReason::kFinalizeMarkingViaTask);

3691 break;
3692 }
3693 case GCIdleTimeAction::kFullGC: {

3704
3705void Heap::IdleNotificationEpilogue(GCIdleTimeAction action,
3706 GCIdleTimeHeapState heap_state,
3707 double start_ms, double deadline_in_ms) {
3708 double idle_time_in_ms = deadline_in_ms - start_ms;
3709 double current_time = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
3710 last_idle_notification_time_ = current_time;
3711 double deadline_difference = deadline_in_ms - current_time;
3712
3713 contexts_disposed_ = 0;
3714
3715 if (FLAG_trace_idle_notification) {
3716 isolate_->PrintWithTimestamp(
3717 "Idle notification: requested idle time %.2f ms, used idle time %.2f "
3718 "ms, deadline usage %.2f ms [",
3719 idle_time_in_ms, idle_time_in_ms - deadline_difference,
3720 deadline_difference);
3721 switch (action) {
3722 case GCIdleTimeAction::kDone:
3723 PrintF("done");
3724 break;
3725 case GCIdleTimeAction::kIncrementalStep:
3726 PrintF("incremental step");
3727 break;
3728 case GCIdleTimeAction::kFullGC:
3729 PrintF("full GC");
3730 break;
3731 }
3732 PrintF("]");
3733 if (FLAG_trace_idle_notification_verbose) {
3734 PrintF("[");
3735 heap_state.Print();
3736 PrintF("]");
3737 }
3738 PrintF("\n");
3739 }
3740}
3741
3742
3743double Heap::MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs() {
3744 return V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->MonotonicallyIncreasingTime() *
3745 static_cast<double>(base::Time::kMillisecondsPerSecond);
3746}
3747
3748void Heap::VerifyNewSpaceTop() { new_space()->VerifyTop(); }
3749
3750bool Heap::IdleNotification(int idle_time_in_ms) {
3751 return IdleNotification(
1
Calling 'Heap::IdleNotification'
→
3752 V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->MonotonicallyIncreasingTime() +
3753 (static_cast<double>(idle_time_in_ms) /
3754 static_cast<double>(base::Time::kMillisecondsPerSecond)));
3755}
3756
3757
3758bool Heap::IdleNotification(double deadline_in_seconds) {
3759 CHECK(HasBeenSetUp())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(HasBeenSetUp())), 0))) { V8_Fatal

= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("v8"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3765), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3765
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3765
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3765
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3765, "V8.GCIdleNotification"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer3765 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3765
, "V8.GCIdleNotification", h); };
4
←
Assuming 'trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3765' is non-null
→
5
←
Taking false branch
→
6
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
7
←
Taking false branch
→
3766 double start_ms = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
3767 double idle_time_in_ms = deadline_in_ms - start_ms;
3768
3769 tracer()->SampleAllocation(start_ms, NewSpaceAllocationCounter(),
3770 OldGenerationAllocationCounter(),
3771 EmbedderAllocationCounter());
3772
3773 GCIdleTimeHeapState heap_state = ComputeHeapState();
3774
3775 GCIdleTimeAction action =
3776 gc_idle_time_handler_->Compute(idle_time_in_ms, heap_state);
3777
3778 bool result = PerformIdleTimeAction(action, heap_state, deadline_in_ms);
8
←
Calling 'Heap::PerformIdleTimeAction'
→
3779
3780 IdleNotificationEpilogue(action, heap_state, start_ms, deadline_in_ms);
3781 return result;
3782}
3783
3784
3785bool Heap::RecentIdleNotificationHappened() {
3786 return (last_idle_notification_time_ +
3787 GCIdleTimeHandler::kMaxScheduledIdleTime) >
3788 MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
3789}
3790
3791class MemoryPressureInterruptTask : public CancelableTask {
3792 public:
3793 explicit MemoryPressureInterruptTask(Heap* heap)
3794 : CancelableTask(heap->isolate()), heap_(heap) {}
3795
3796 ~MemoryPressureInterruptTask() override = default;
3797
3798 private:
3799 // v8::internal::CancelableTask overrides.
3800 void RunInternal() override { heap_->CheckMemoryPressure(); }
3801
3802 Heap* heap_;
3803 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(MemoryPressureInterruptTask)MemoryPressureInterruptTask(const MemoryPressureInterruptTask
&) = delete; MemoryPressureInterruptTask& operator=(const
MemoryPressureInterruptTask&) = delete;
3804};
3805
3806void Heap::CheckMemoryPressure() {
3807 if (HighMemoryPressure()) {
3808 // The optimizing compiler may be unnecessarily holding on to memory.
3809 isolate()->AbortConcurrentOptimization(BlockingBehavior::kDontBlock);
3810 }
3811 MemoryPressureLevel memory_pressure_level = memory_pressure_level_;
3812 // Reset the memory pressure level to avoid recursive GCs triggered by
3813 // CheckMemoryPressure from AdjustAmountOfExternalMemory called by
3814 // the finalizers.
3815 memory_pressure_level_ = MemoryPressureLevel::kNone;
3816 if (memory_pressure_level == MemoryPressureLevel::kCritical) {
3817 TRACE_EVENT0("devtools.timeline,v8", "V8.CheckMemoryPressure")static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3817 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3817
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::
base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3817), (reinterpret_cast
<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3817
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817, "V8.CheckMemoryPressure"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer3817 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3817
, "V8.CheckMemoryPressure", h); };
3818 CollectGarbageOnMemoryPressure();
3819 } else if (memory_pressure_level == MemoryPressureLevel::kModerate) {
3820 if (FLAG_incremental_marking && incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
3821 TRACE_EVENT0("devtools.timeline,v8", "V8.CheckMemoryPressure")static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3821 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3821
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::
base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3821), (reinterpret_cast
<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3821
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821, "V8.CheckMemoryPressure"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0))); trace_event_unique_tracer3821 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3821
, "V8.CheckMemoryPressure", h); };
3822 StartIncrementalMarking(kReduceMemoryFootprintMask,
3823 GarbageCollectionReason::kMemoryPressure);
3824 }
3825 }
3826}
3827
3828void Heap::CollectGarbageOnMemoryPressure() {
3829 const int kGarbageThresholdInBytes = 8 * MB;
3830 const double kGarbageThresholdAsFractionOfTotalMemory = 0.1;
3831 // This constant is the maximum response time in RAIL performance model.
3832 const double kMaxMemoryPressurePauseMs = 100;
3833
3834 double start = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
3835 CollectAllGarbage(kReduceMemoryFootprintMask,
3836 GarbageCollectionReason::kMemoryPressure,
3837 kGCCallbackFlagCollectAllAvailableGarbage);
3838 EagerlyFreeExternalMemory();
3839 double end = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
3840
3841 // Estimate how much memory we can free.
3842 int64_t potential_garbage =
3843 (CommittedMemory() - SizeOfObjects()) + external_memory_.total();
3844 // If we can potentially free large amount of memory, then start GC right
3845 // away instead of waiting for memory reducer.
3846 if (potential_garbage >= kGarbageThresholdInBytes &&
3847 potential_garbage >=
3848 CommittedMemory() * kGarbageThresholdAsFractionOfTotalMemory) {
3849 // If we spent less than half of the time budget, then perform full GC
3850 // Otherwise, start incremental marking.
3851 if (end - start < kMaxMemoryPressurePauseMs / 2) {
3852 CollectAllGarbage(kReduceMemoryFootprintMask,
3853 GarbageCollectionReason::kMemoryPressure,
3854 kGCCallbackFlagCollectAllAvailableGarbage);
3855 } else {
3856 if (FLAG_incremental_marking && incremental_marking()->IsStopped()) {
3857 StartIncrementalMarking(kReduceMemoryFootprintMask,
3858 GarbageCollectionReason::kMemoryPressure);
3859 }
3860 }
3861 }
3862}
3863
3864void Heap::MemoryPressureNotification(MemoryPressureLevel level,
3865 bool is_isolate_locked) {
3866 TRACE_EVENT1("devtools.timeline,v8", "V8.MemoryPressureNotification", "level",static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3867 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3867
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::
base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3867), (reinterpret_cast
<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3867
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867, "V8.MemoryPressureNotification"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "level", static_cast<int>(level)); trace_event_unique_tracer3867
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867, "V8.MemoryPressureNotification"
, h); }
3867 static_cast<int>(level))static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3867 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3867
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("devtools.timeline,v8"); v8::
base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3867), (reinterpret_cast
<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3867
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867, "V8.MemoryPressureNotification"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "level", static_cast<int>(level)); trace_event_unique_tracer3867
.Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3867, "V8.MemoryPressureNotification"
, h); };
3868 MemoryPressureLevel previous = memory_pressure_level_;
3869 memory_pressure_level_ = level;
3870 if ((previous != MemoryPressureLevel::kCritical &&
3871 level == MemoryPressureLevel::kCritical) ||
3872 (previous == MemoryPressureLevel::kNone &&
3873 level == MemoryPressureLevel::kModerate)) {
3874 if (is_isolate_locked) {
3875 CheckMemoryPressure();
3876 } else {
3877 ExecutionAccess access(isolate());
3878 isolate()->stack_guard()->RequestGC();
3879 auto taskrunner = V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->GetForegroundTaskRunner(
3880 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(isolate()));
3881 taskrunner->PostTask(std::make_unique<MemoryPressureInterruptTask>(this));
3882 }
3883 }
3884}
3885
3886void Heap::EagerlyFreeExternalMemory() {
3887 array_buffer_sweeper()->EnsureFinished();
3888 memory_allocator()->unmapper()->EnsureUnmappingCompleted();
3889}
3890
3891void Heap::AddNearHeapLimitCallback(v8::NearHeapLimitCallback callback,
3892 void* data) {
3893 const size_t kMaxCallbacks = 100;
3894 CHECK_LT(near_heap_limit_callbacks_.size(), kMaxCallbacks)do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpLTImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(near_heap_limit_callbacks_.size
())>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype
(kMaxCallbacks)>::type>((near_heap_limit_callbacks_.size
()), (kMaxCallbacks)); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp))
, 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "near_heap_limit_callbacks_.size()"
" " "<" " " "kMaxCallbacks"); } } while (false); } while (
false);
3895 for (auto callback_data : near_heap_limit_callbacks_) {
3896 CHECK_NE(callback_data.first, callback)do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpNEImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(callback_data.first)>::type
, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(callback
)>::type>((callback_data.first), (callback)); do { if (
(__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "callback_data.first" " " "!=" " " "callback"); } } while (
false); } while (false);
3897 }
3898 near_heap_limit_callbacks_.push_back(std::make_pair(callback, data));
3899}
3900
3901void Heap::RemoveNearHeapLimitCallback(v8::NearHeapLimitCallback callback,
3902 size_t heap_limit) {
3903 for (size_t i = 0; i < near_heap_limit_callbacks_.size(); i++) {
3904 if (near_heap_limit_callbacks_[i].first == callback) {
3905 near_heap_limit_callbacks_.erase(near_heap_limit_callbacks_.begin() + i);
3906 if (heap_limit) {
3907 RestoreHeapLimit(heap_limit);
3908 }
3909 return;
3910 }
3911 }
3912 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
3913}
3914
3915void Heap::AppendArrayBufferExtension(JSArrayBuffer object,
3916 ArrayBufferExtension* extension) {
3917 array_buffer_sweeper_->Append(object, extension);
3918}
3919
3920void Heap::AutomaticallyRestoreInitialHeapLimit(double threshold_percent) {
3921 initial_max_old_generation_size_threshold_ =
3922 initial_max_old_generation_size_ * threshold_percent;
3923}
3924
3925bool Heap::InvokeNearHeapLimitCallback() {
3926 if (near_heap_limit_callbacks_.size() > 0) {
3927 HandleScope scope(isolate());
3928 v8::NearHeapLimitCallback callback =
3929 near_heap_limit_callbacks_.back().first;
3930 void* data = near_heap_limit_callbacks_.back().second;
3931 size_t heap_limit = callback(data, max_old_generation_size(),
3932 initial_max_old_generation_size_);
3933 if (heap_limit > max_old_generation_size()) {
3934 set_max_old_generation_size(
3935 Min(heap_limit, AllocatorLimitOnMaxOldGenerationSize()));
3936 return true;
3937 }
3938 }
3939 return false;
3940}
3941
3942bool Heap::MeasureMemory(std::unique_ptr<v8::MeasureMemoryDelegate> delegate,
3943 v8::MeasureMemoryExecution execution) {
3944 HandleScope handle_scope(isolate());
3945 std::vector<Handle<NativeContext>> contexts = FindAllNativeContexts();
3946 std::vector<Handle<NativeContext>> to_measure;
3947 for (auto& current : contexts) {
3948 if (delegate->ShouldMeasure(
3949 v8::Utils::ToLocal(Handle<Context>::cast(current)))) {
3950 to_measure.push_back(current);
3951 }
3952 }
3953 return memory_measurement_->EnqueueRequest(std::move(delegate), execution,
3954 to_measure);
3955}
3956
3957std::unique_ptr<v8::MeasureMemoryDelegate> Heap::MeasureMemoryDelegate(
3958 Handle<NativeContext> context, Handle<JSPromise> promise,
3959 v8::MeasureMemoryMode mode) {
3960 return i::MemoryMeasurement::DefaultDelegate(isolate_, context, promise,
3961 mode);
3962}
3963
3964void Heap::CollectCodeStatistics() {
3965 TRACE_EVENT0("v8", "Heap::CollectCodeStatistics")static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3965 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3965
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3965 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3965
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3965) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3965
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("v8"); v8::base::Relaxed_Store
(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3965), (reinterpret_cast<v8
::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3965
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3965
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3965
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags

, "Heap::CollectCodeStatistics", h); };
3966 CodeStatistics::ResetCodeAndMetadataStatistics(isolate());
3967 // We do not look for code in new space, or map space. If code
3968 // somehow ends up in those spaces, we would miss it here.
3969 CodeStatistics::CollectCodeStatistics(code_space_, isolate());
3970 CodeStatistics::CollectCodeStatistics(old_space_, isolate());
3971 CodeStatistics::CollectCodeStatistics(code_lo_space_, isolate());
3972}
3973
3974#ifdef DEBUG
3975
3976void Heap::Print() {
3977 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return;
3978 isolate()->PrintStack(stdoutstdout);
3979
3980 for (SpaceIterator it(this); it.HasNext();) {
3981 it.Next()->Print();
3982 }
3983}
3984
3985
3986void Heap::ReportCodeStatistics(const char* title) {
3987 PrintF(">>>>>> Code Stats (%s) >>>>>>\n", title);
3988 CollectCodeStatistics();
3989 CodeStatistics::ReportCodeStatistics(isolate());
3990}
3991
3992#endif // DEBUG
3993
3994const char* Heap::GarbageCollectionReasonToString(
3995 GarbageCollectionReason gc_reason) {
3996 switch (gc_reason) {
3997 case GarbageCollectionReason::kAllocationFailure:
3998 return "allocation failure";
3999 case GarbageCollectionReason::kAllocationLimit:
4000 return "allocation limit";
4001 case GarbageCollectionReason::kContextDisposal:
4002 return "context disposal";
4003 case GarbageCollectionReason::kCountersExtension:
4004 return "counters extension";
4005 case GarbageCollectionReason::kDebugger:
4006 return "debugger";
4007 case GarbageCollectionReason::kDeserializer:
4008 return "deserialize";
4009 case GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalMemoryPressure:
4010 return "external memory pressure";
4011 case GarbageCollectionReason::kFinalizeMarkingViaStackGuard:
4012 return "finalize incremental marking via stack guard";
4013 case GarbageCollectionReason::kFinalizeMarkingViaTask:
4014 return "finalize incremental marking via task";
4015 case GarbageCollectionReason::kFullHashtable:
4016 return "full hash-table";
4017 case GarbageCollectionReason::kHeapProfiler:
4018 return "heap profiler";
4019 case GarbageCollectionReason::kTask:
4020 return "task";
4021 case GarbageCollectionReason::kLastResort:
4022 return "last resort";
4023 case GarbageCollectionReason::kLowMemoryNotification:
4024 return "low memory notification";
4025 case GarbageCollectionReason::kMakeHeapIterable:
4026 return "make heap iterable";
4027 case GarbageCollectionReason::kMemoryPressure:
4028 return "memory pressure";
4029 case GarbageCollectionReason::kMemoryReducer:
4030 return "memory reducer";
4031 case GarbageCollectionReason::kRuntime:
4032 return "runtime";
4033 case GarbageCollectionReason::kSamplingProfiler:
4034 return "sampling profiler";
4035 case GarbageCollectionReason::kSnapshotCreator:
4036 return "snapshot creator";
4037 case GarbageCollectionReason::kTesting:
4038 return "testing";
4039 case GarbageCollectionReason::kExternalFinalize:
4040 return "external finalize";
4041 case GarbageCollectionReason::kGlobalAllocationLimit:
4042 return "global allocation limit";
4043 case GarbageCollectionReason::kMeasureMemory:
4044 return "measure memory";
4045 case GarbageCollectionReason::kUnknown:
4046 return "unknown";
4047 }
4048 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
4049}
4050
4051bool Heap::Contains(HeapObject value) const {
4052 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse) {
4053 return true;
4054 }
4055 if (ReadOnlyHeap::Contains(value)) {
4056 return false;
4057 }
4058 if (memory_allocator()->IsOutsideAllocatedSpace(value.address())) {
4059 return false;
4060 }
4061 return HasBeenSetUp() &&
4062 (new_space_->ToSpaceContains(value) || old_space_->Contains(value) ||
4063 code_space_->Contains(value) || map_space_->Contains(value) ||
4064 lo_space_->Contains(value) || code_lo_space_->Contains(value) ||
4065 new_lo_space_->Contains(value));
4066}
4067
4068bool Heap::InSpace(HeapObject value, AllocationSpace space) const {
4069 if (memory_allocator()->IsOutsideAllocatedSpace(value.address())) {
4070 return false;
4071 }
4072 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return false;
4073
4074 switch (space) {
4075 case NEW_SPACE:
4076 return new_space_->ToSpaceContains(value);
4077 case OLD_SPACE:
4078 return old_space_->Contains(value);
4079 case CODE_SPACE:
4080 return code_space_->Contains(value);
4081 case MAP_SPACE:
4082 return map_space_->Contains(value);
4083 case LO_SPACE:
4084 return lo_space_->Contains(value);
4085 case CODE_LO_SPACE:
4086 return code_lo_space_->Contains(value);
4087 case NEW_LO_SPACE:
4088 return new_lo_space_->Contains(value);
4089 case RO_SPACE:
4090 return ReadOnlyHeap::Contains(value);
4091 }
4092 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
4093}
4094
4095bool Heap::InSpaceSlow(Address addr, AllocationSpace space) const {
4096 if (memory_allocator()->IsOutsideAllocatedSpace(addr)) {
4097 return false;
4098 }
4099 if (!HasBeenSetUp()) return false;
4100
4101 switch (space) {
4102 case NEW_SPACE:
4103 return new_space_->ToSpaceContainsSlow(addr);
4104 case OLD_SPACE:
4105 return old_space_->ContainsSlow(addr);
4106 case CODE_SPACE:
4107 return code_space_->ContainsSlow(addr);
4108 case MAP_SPACE:
4109 return map_space_->ContainsSlow(addr);
4110 case LO_SPACE:
4111 return lo_space_->ContainsSlow(addr);
4112 case CODE_LO_SPACE:
4113 return code_lo_space_->ContainsSlow(addr);
4114 case NEW_LO_SPACE:
4115 return new_lo_space_->ContainsSlow(addr);
4116 case RO_SPACE:
4117 return read_only_space_->ContainsSlow(addr);
4118 }
4119 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
4120}
4121
4122bool Heap::IsValidAllocationSpace(AllocationSpace space) {
4123 switch (space) {
4124 case NEW_SPACE:
4125 case OLD_SPACE:
4126 case CODE_SPACE:
4127 case MAP_SPACE:
4128 case LO_SPACE:
4129 case NEW_LO_SPACE:
4130 case CODE_LO_SPACE:
4131 case RO_SPACE:
4132 return true;
4133 default:
4134 return false;
4135 }
4136}
4137
4138#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
4139void Heap::Verify() {
4140 CHECK(HasBeenSetUp())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(HasBeenSetUp())), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "HasBeenSetUp()"); } } while (false);
4141 SafepointScope safepoint_scope(this);
4142 HandleScope scope(isolate());
4143
4144 MakeLocalHeapLabsIterable();
4145
4146 // We have to wait here for the sweeper threads to have an iterable heap.
4147 mark_compact_collector()->EnsureSweepingCompleted();
4148 array_buffer_sweeper()->EnsureFinished();
4149
4150 VerifyPointersVisitor visitor(this);
4151 IterateRoots(&visitor, {});
4152
4153 if (!isolate()->context().is_null() &&
4154 !isolate()->normalized_map_cache()->IsUndefined(isolate())) {
4155 NormalizedMapCache::cast(*isolate()->normalized_map_cache())
4156 .NormalizedMapCacheVerify(isolate());
4157 }
4158
4159 VerifySmisVisitor smis_visitor;
4160 IterateSmiRoots(&smis_visitor);
4161
4162 new_space_->Verify(isolate());
4163
4164 old_space_->Verify(isolate(), &visitor);
4165 map_space_->Verify(isolate(), &visitor);
4166
4167 VerifyPointersVisitor no_dirty_regions_visitor(this);
4168 code_space_->Verify(isolate(), &no_dirty_regions_visitor);
4169
4170 lo_space_->Verify(isolate());
4171 code_lo_space_->Verify(isolate());
4172 new_lo_space_->Verify(isolate());
4173 VerifyStringTable(isolate());
4174}
4175
4176void Heap::VerifyReadOnlyHeap() {
4177 CHECK(!read_only_space_->writable())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!read_only_space_->writable
())), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "!read_only_space_->writable()"
); } } while (false);
4178 read_only_space_->Verify(isolate());
4179}
4180
4181class SlotVerifyingVisitor : public ObjectVisitor {
4182 public:
4183 SlotVerifyingVisitor(std::set<Address>* untyped,
4184 std::set<std::pair<SlotType, Address> >* typed)
4185 : untyped_(untyped), typed_(typed) {}
4186
4187 virtual bool ShouldHaveBeenRecorded(HeapObject host, MaybeObject target) = 0;
4188
4189 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, ObjectSlot start,
4190 ObjectSlot end) override {
4191#ifdef DEBUG
4192 for (ObjectSlot slot = start; slot < end; ++slot) {
4193 DCHECK(!HasWeakHeapObjectTag(*slot))((void) 0);
4194 }
4195#endif // DEBUG
4196 VisitPointers(host, MaybeObjectSlot(start), MaybeObjectSlot(end));
4197 }
4198
4199 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
4200 MaybeObjectSlot end) final {
4201 for (MaybeObjectSlot slot = start; slot < end; ++slot) {
4202 if (ShouldHaveBeenRecorded(host, *slot)) {
4203 CHECK_GT(untyped_->count(slot.address()), 0)do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpGTImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(untyped_->count(slot.address
()))>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype
(0)>::type>((untyped_->count(slot.address())), (0));
do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "untyped_->count(slot.address())" " " ">" " " "0"); }
} while (false); } while (false);
4204 }
4205 }
4206 }
4207
4208 void VisitCodeTarget(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
4209 Object target = Code::GetCodeFromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
4210 if (ShouldHaveBeenRecorded(host, MaybeObject::FromObject(target))) {
4211 CHECK(do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo
->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet
(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))))
, 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4212 InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) ||do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo
->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet
(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))))
, 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4213 (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo
->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet
(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))))
, 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4214 InTypedSet(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo
->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet
(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))))
, 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(CODE_TARGET_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(CODE_ENTRY_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false);
4215 }
4216 }
4217
4218 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) override {
4219 Object target = rinfo->target_object();
4220 if (ShouldHaveBeenRecorded(host, MaybeObject::FromObject(target))) {
4221 CHECK(do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4222 InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) ||do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4223 InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) ||do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4224 (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4225 InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT,do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4226 rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) ||do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4227 (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false)
4228 InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() &&
InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address
())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT
, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "InTypedSet(FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_EMBEDDED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->pc()) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address())) || (rinfo->IsInConstantPool() && InTypedSet(FULL_OBJECT_SLOT, rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address()))"
); } } while (false);
4229 }
4230 }
4231
4232 protected:
4233 bool InUntypedSet(ObjectSlot slot) {
4234 return untyped_->count(slot.address()) > 0;
4235 }
4236
4237 private:
4238 bool InTypedSet(SlotType type, Address slot) {
4239 return typed_->count(std::make_pair(type, slot)) > 0;
4240 }
4241 std::set<Address>* untyped_;
4242 std::set<std::pair<SlotType, Address> >* typed_;
4243};
4244
4245class OldToNewSlotVerifyingVisitor : public SlotVerifyingVisitor {
4246 public:
4247 OldToNewSlotVerifyingVisitor(std::set<Address>* untyped,
4248 std::set<std::pair<SlotType, Address>>* typed,
4249 EphemeronRememberedSet* ephemeron_remembered_set)
4250 : SlotVerifyingVisitor(untyped, typed),
4251 ephemeron_remembered_set_(ephemeron_remembered_set) {}
4252
4253 bool ShouldHaveBeenRecorded(HeapObject host, MaybeObject target) override {
4254 DCHECK_IMPLIES(target->IsStrongOrWeak() && Heap::InYoungGeneration(target),((void) 0)
4255 Heap::InToPage(target))((void) 0);
4256 return target->IsStrongOrWeak() && Heap::InYoungGeneration(target) &&
4257 !Heap::InYoungGeneration(host);
4258 }
4259
4260 void VisitEphemeron(HeapObject host, int index, ObjectSlot key,
4261 ObjectSlot target) override {
4262 VisitPointer(host, target);
4263#ifdef ENABLE_MINOR_MC1
4264 if (FLAG_minor_mc) return VisitPointer(host, target);
4265#endif
4266 // Keys are handled separately and should never appear in this set.
4267 CHECK(!InUntypedSet(key))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!InUntypedSet(key))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "!InUntypedSet(key)"); } } while (false
);
4268 Object k = *key;
4269 if (!ObjectInYoungGeneration(host) && ObjectInYoungGeneration(k)) {
4270 EphemeronHashTable table = EphemeronHashTable::cast(host);
4271 auto it = ephemeron_remembered_set_->find(table);
4272 CHECK(it != ephemeron_remembered_set_->end())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(it != ephemeron_remembered_set_
->end())), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "it != ephemeron_remembered_set_->end()"
); } } while (false);
4273 int slot_index =
4274 EphemeronHashTable::SlotToIndex(table.address(), key.address());
4275 InternalIndex entry = EphemeronHashTable::IndexToEntry(slot_index);
4276 CHECK(it->second.find(entry.as_int()) != it->second.end())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(it->second.find(entry.as_int
()) != it->second.end())), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "it->second.find(entry.as_int()) != it->second.end()"
); } } while (false);
4277 }
4278 }
4279
4280 private:
4281 EphemeronRememberedSet* ephemeron_remembered_set_;
4282};
4283
4284template <RememberedSetType direction>
4285void CollectSlots(MemoryChunk* chunk, Address start, Address end,
4286 std::set<Address>* untyped,
4287 std::set<std::pair<SlotType, Address> >* typed) {
4288 RememberedSet<direction>::Iterate(
4289 chunk,
4290 [start, end, untyped](MaybeObjectSlot slot) {
4291 if (start <= slot.address() && slot.address() < end) {
4292 untyped->insert(slot.address());
4293 }
4294 return KEEP_SLOT;
4295 },
4296 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
4297 if (direction == OLD_TO_NEW) {
4298 CHECK(chunk->SweepingDone())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(chunk->SweepingDone())), 0
))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "chunk->SweepingDone()"
); } } while (false);
4299 RememberedSetSweeping::Iterate(
4300 chunk,
4301 [start, end, untyped](MaybeObjectSlot slot) {
4302 if (start <= slot.address() && slot.address() < end) {
4303 untyped->insert(slot.address());
4304 }
4305 return KEEP_SLOT;
4306 },
4307 SlotSet::FREE_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
4308 }
4309 RememberedSet<direction>::IterateTyped(
4310 chunk, [=](SlotType type, Address slot) {
4311 if (start <= slot && slot < end) {
4312 typed->insert(std::make_pair(type, slot));
4313 }
4314 return KEEP_SLOT;
4315 });
4316}
4317
4318void Heap::VerifyRememberedSetFor(HeapObject object) {
4319 MemoryChunk* chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
4320 DCHECK_IMPLIES(chunk->mutex() == nullptr, ReadOnlyHeap::Contains(object))((void) 0);
4321 // In RO_SPACE chunk->mutex() may be nullptr, so just ignore it.
4322 base::LockGuard<base::Mutex, base::NullBehavior::kIgnoreIfNull> lock_guard(
4323 chunk->mutex());
4324 Address start = object.address();
4325 Address end = start + object.Size();
4326 std::set<Address> old_to_new;
4327 std::set<std::pair<SlotType, Address> > typed_old_to_new;
4328 if (!InYoungGeneration(object)) {
4329 CollectSlots<OLD_TO_NEW>(chunk, start, end, &old_to_new, &typed_old_to_new);
4330 OldToNewSlotVerifyingVisitor visitor(&old_to_new, &typed_old_to_new,
4331 &this->ephemeron_remembered_set_);
4332 object.IterateBody(&visitor);
4333 }
4334 // TODO(ulan): Add old to old slot set verification once all weak objects
4335 // have their own instance types and slots are recorded for all weal fields.
4336}
4337#endif
4338
4339#ifdef DEBUG
4340void Heap::VerifyCountersAfterSweeping() {
4341 MakeLocalHeapLabsIterable();
4342
4343 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
4344 for (PagedSpace* space = spaces.Next(); space != nullptr;
4345 space = spaces.Next()) {
4346 space->VerifyCountersAfterSweeping(this);
4347 }
4348}
4349
4350void Heap::VerifyCountersBeforeConcurrentSweeping() {
4351 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
4352 for (PagedSpace* space = spaces.Next(); space != nullptr;
4353 space = spaces.Next()) {
4354 space->VerifyCountersBeforeConcurrentSweeping();
4355 }
4356}
4357#endif
4358
4359void Heap::ZapFromSpace() {
4360 if (!new_space_->IsFromSpaceCommitted()) return;
4361 for (Page* page : PageRange(new_space_->from_space().first_page(), nullptr)) {
4362 memory_allocator()->ZapBlock(page->area_start(),
4363 page->HighWaterMark() - page->area_start(),
4364 ZapValue());
4365 }
4366}
4367
4368void Heap::ZapCodeObject(Address start_address, int size_in_bytes) {
4369#ifdef DEBUG
4370 DCHECK(IsAligned(start_address, kIntSize))((void) 0);
4371 for (int i = 0; i < size_in_bytes / kIntSize; i++) {
4372 Memory<int>(start_address + i * kIntSize) = kCodeZapValue;
4373 }
4374#endif
4375}
4376
4377// TODO(ishell): move builtin accessors out from Heap.
4378Code Heap::builtin(int index) {
4379 DCHECK(Builtins::IsBuiltinId(index))((void) 0);
4380 return Code::cast(Object(isolate()->builtins_table()[index]));
4381}
4382
4383Address Heap::builtin_address(int index) {
4384 DCHECK(Builtins::IsBuiltinId(index) || index == Builtins::builtin_count)((void) 0);
4385 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(&isolate()->builtins_table()[index]);
4386}
4387
4388void Heap::set_builtin(int index, Code builtin) {
4389 DCHECK(Builtins::IsBuiltinId(index))((void) 0);
4390 DCHECK(Internals::HasHeapObjectTag(builtin.ptr()))((void) 0);
4391 // The given builtin may be completely uninitialized thus we cannot check its
4392 // type here.
4393 isolate()->builtins_table()[index] = builtin.ptr();
4394}
4395
4396void Heap::IterateWeakRoots(RootVisitor* v, base::EnumSet<SkipRoot> options) {
4397 DCHECK(!options.contains(SkipRoot::kWeak))((void) 0);
4398
4399 if (!options.contains(SkipRoot::kOldGeneration) &&
4400 !options.contains(SkipRoot::kUnserializable)) {
4401 // Do not visit for serialization, since the string table is custom
4402 // serialized. Also do not visit if we are skipping old generation.
4403 isolate()->string_table()->IterateElements(v);
4404 }
4405 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kStringTable);
4406 if (!options.contains(SkipRoot::kExternalStringTable) &&
4407 !options.contains(SkipRoot::kUnserializable)) {
4408 // Scavenge collections have special processing for this.
4409 // Do not visit for serialization, since the external string table will
4410 // be populated from scratch upon deserialization.
4411 external_string_table_.IterateAll(v);
4412 }
4413 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kExternalStringsTable);
4414}
4415
4416void Heap::IterateSmiRoots(RootVisitor* v) {
4417 // Acquire execution access since we are going to read stack limit values.
4418 ExecutionAccess access(isolate());
4419 v->VisitRootPointers(Root::kSmiRootList, nullptr,
4420 roots_table().smi_roots_begin(),
4421 roots_table().smi_roots_end());
4422 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kSmiRootList);
4423}
4424
4425// We cannot avoid stale handles to left-trimmed objects, but can only make
4426// sure all handles still needed are updated. Filter out a stale pointer
4427// and clear the slot to allow post processing of handles (needed because
4428// the sweeper might actually free the underlying page).
4429class FixStaleLeftTrimmedHandlesVisitor : public RootVisitor {
4430 public:
4431 explicit FixStaleLeftTrimmedHandlesVisitor(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {
4432 USE(heap_)do { ::v8::base::Use unused_tmp_array_for_use_macro[]{heap_};
(void)unused_tmp_array_for_use_macro; } while (false);
4433 }
4434
4435 void VisitRootPointer(Root root, const char* description,
4436 FullObjectSlot p) override {
4437 FixHandle(p);
4438 }
4439
4440 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
4441 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
4442 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) FixHandle(p);
4443 }
4444
4445 private:
4446 inline void FixHandle(FullObjectSlot p) {
4447 if (!(*p).IsHeapObject()) return;
4448 HeapObject current = HeapObject::cast(*p);
4449 const MapWord map_word = current.map_word();
4450 if (!map_word.IsForwardingAddress() && current.IsFreeSpaceOrFiller()) {
4451#ifdef DEBUG
4452 // We need to find a FixedArrayBase map after walking the fillers.
4453 while (current.IsFreeSpaceOrFiller()) {
4454 Address next = current.ptr();
4455 if (current.map() == ReadOnlyRoots(heap_).one_pointer_filler_map()) {
4456 next += kTaggedSize;
4457 } else if (current.map() ==
4458 ReadOnlyRoots(heap_).two_pointer_filler_map()) {
4459 next += 2 * kTaggedSize;
4460 } else {
4461 next += current.Size();
4462 }
4463 current = HeapObject::cast(Object(next));
4464 }
4465 DCHECK(current.IsFixedArrayBase())((void) 0);
4466#endif // DEBUG
4467 p.store(Smi::zero());
4468 }
4469 }
4470
4471 Heap* heap_;
4472};
4473
4474void Heap::IterateRoots(RootVisitor* v, base::EnumSet<SkipRoot> options) {
4475 v->VisitRootPointers(Root::kStrongRootList, nullptr,
4476 roots_table().strong_roots_begin(),
4477 roots_table().strong_roots_end());
4478 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kStrongRootList);
4479
4480 isolate_->bootstrapper()->Iterate(v);
4481 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kBootstrapper);
4482 Relocatable::Iterate(isolate_, v);
4483 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kRelocatable);
4484 isolate_->debug()->Iterate(v);
4485 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kDebug);
4486
4487 isolate_->compilation_cache()->Iterate(v);
4488 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kCompilationCache);
4489
4490 if (!options.contains(SkipRoot::kOldGeneration)) {
4491 IterateBuiltins(v);
4492 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kBuiltins);
4493 }
4494
4495 // Iterate over pointers being held by inactive threads.
4496 isolate_->thread_manager()->Iterate(v);
4497 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kThreadManager);
4498
4499 // Visitors in this block only run when not serializing. These include:
4500 //
4501 // - Thread-local and stack.
4502 // - Handles.
4503 // - Microtasks.
4504 // - The startup object cache.
4505 //
4506 // When creating real startup snapshot, these areas are expected to be empty.
4507 // It is also possible to create a snapshot of a *running* isolate for testing
4508 // purposes. In this case, these areas are likely not empty and will simply be
4509 // skipped.
4510 //
4511 // The general guideline for adding visitors to this section vs. adding them
4512 // above is that non-transient heap state is always visited, transient heap
4513 // state is visited only when not serializing.
4514 if (!options.contains(SkipRoot::kUnserializable)) {
4515 if (!options.contains(SkipRoot::kGlobalHandles)) {
4516 if (options.contains(SkipRoot::kWeak)) {
4517 if (options.contains(SkipRoot::kOldGeneration)) {
4518 // Skip handles that are either weak or old.
4519 isolate_->global_handles()->IterateYoungStrongAndDependentRoots(v);
4520 } else {
4521 // Skip handles that are weak.
4522 isolate_->global_handles()->IterateStrongRoots(v);
4523 }
4524 } else {
4525 // Do not skip weak handles.
4526 if (options.contains(SkipRoot::kOldGeneration)) {
4527 // Skip handles that are old.
4528 isolate_->global_handles()->IterateAllYoungRoots(v);
4529 } else {
4530 // Do not skip any handles.
4531 isolate_->global_handles()->IterateAllRoots(v);
4532 }
4533 }
4534 }
4535 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kGlobalHandles);
4536
4537 if (!options.contains(SkipRoot::kStack)) {
4538 IterateStackRoots(v);
4539 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kTop);
4540 }
4541
4542 // Iterate over local handles in handle scopes.
4543 FixStaleLeftTrimmedHandlesVisitor left_trim_visitor(this);
4544 isolate_->handle_scope_implementer()->Iterate(&left_trim_visitor);
4545 isolate_->handle_scope_implementer()->Iterate(v);
4546
4547 if (FLAG_local_heaps) {
4548 safepoint_->Iterate(&left_trim_visitor);
4549 safepoint_->Iterate(v);
4550 }
4551
4552 isolate_->persistent_handles_list()->Iterate(&left_trim_visitor, isolate_);
4553 isolate_->persistent_handles_list()->Iterate(v, isolate_);
4554
4555 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kHandleScope);
4556
4557 if (options.contains(SkipRoot::kOldGeneration)) {
4558 isolate_->eternal_handles()->IterateYoungRoots(v);
4559 } else {
4560 isolate_->eternal_handles()->IterateAllRoots(v);
4561 }
4562 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kEternalHandles);
4563
4564 // Iterate over pending Microtasks stored in MicrotaskQueues.
4565 MicrotaskQueue* default_microtask_queue =
4566 isolate_->default_microtask_queue();
4567 if (default_microtask_queue) {
4568 MicrotaskQueue* microtask_queue = default_microtask_queue;
4569 do {
4570 microtask_queue->IterateMicrotasks(v);
4571 microtask_queue = microtask_queue->next();
4572 } while (microtask_queue != default_microtask_queue);
4573 }
4574
4575 // Iterate over other strong roots (currently only identity maps and
4576 // deoptimization entries).
4577 for (StrongRootsList* list = strong_roots_list_; list; list = list->next) {
4578 v->VisitRootPointers(Root::kStrongRoots, nullptr, list->start, list->end);
4579 }
4580 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kStrongRoots);
4581
4582 // Iterate over the startup object cache unless serializing or
4583 // deserializing.
4584 SerializerDeserializer::Iterate(isolate_, v);
4585 v->Synchronize(VisitorSynchronization::kStartupObjectCache);
4586 }
4587
4588 if (!options.contains(SkipRoot::kWeak)) {
4589 IterateWeakRoots(v, options);
4590 }
4591}
4592
4593void Heap::IterateWeakGlobalHandles(RootVisitor* v) {
4594 isolate_->global_handles()->IterateWeakRoots(v);
4595}
4596
4597void Heap::IterateBuiltins(RootVisitor* v) {
4598 for (int i = 0; i < Builtins::builtin_count; i++) {
4599 v->VisitRootPointer(Root::kBuiltins, Builtins::name(i),
4600 FullObjectSlot(builtin_address(i)));
4601 }
4602
4603 // The entry table doesn't need to be updated since all builtins are embedded.
4604 STATIC_ASSERT(Builtins::AllBuiltinsAreIsolateIndependent())static_assert(Builtins::AllBuiltinsAreIsolateIndependent(), "Builtins::AllBuiltinsAreIsolateIndependent()"
);
4605}
4606
4607void Heap::IterateStackRoots(RootVisitor* v) {
4608 isolate_->Iterate(v);
4609 isolate_->global_handles()->IterateStrongStackRoots(v);
4610}
4611
4612namespace {
4613size_t GlobalMemorySizeFromV8Size(size_t v8_size) {
4614 const size_t kGlobalMemoryToV8Ratio = 2;
4615 return Min(static_cast<uint64_t>(std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max()),
4616 static_cast<uint64_t>(v8_size) * kGlobalMemoryToV8Ratio);
4617}
4618} // anonymous namespace
4619
4620void Heap::ConfigureHeap(const v8::ResourceConstraints& constraints) {
4621 // Initialize max_semi_space_size_.
4622 {
4623 max_semi_space_size_ = 8 * (kSystemPointerSize / 4) * MB;
4624 if (constraints.max_young_generation_size_in_bytes() > 0) {
4625 max_semi_space_size_ = SemiSpaceSizeFromYoungGenerationSize(
4626 constraints.max_young_generation_size_in_bytes());
4627 }
4628 if (FLAG_max_semi_space_size > 0) {
4629 max_semi_space_size_ = static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_max_semi_space_size) * MB;
4630 } else if (FLAG_max_heap_size > 0) {
4631 size_t max_heap_size = static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_max_heap_size) * MB;
4632 size_t young_generation_size, old_generation_size;
4633 if (FLAG_max_old_space_size > 0) {
4634 old_generation_size = static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_max_old_space_size) * MB;
4635 young_generation_size = max_heap_size > old_generation_size
4636 ? max_heap_size - old_generation_size
4637 : 0;
4638 } else {
4639 GenerationSizesFromHeapSize(max_heap_size, &young_generation_size,
4640 &old_generation_size);
4641 }
4642 max_semi_space_size_ =
4643 SemiSpaceSizeFromYoungGenerationSize(young_generation_size);
4644 }
4645 if (FLAG_stress_compaction) {
4646 // This will cause more frequent GCs when stressing.
4647 max_semi_space_size_ = MB;
4648 }
4649 // TODO(dinfuehr): Rounding to a power of 2 is not longer needed. Remove it.
4650 max_semi_space_size_ =
4651 static_cast<size_t>(base::bits::RoundUpToPowerOfTwo64(
4652 static_cast<uint64_t>(max_semi_space_size_)));
4653 max_semi_space_size_ = Max(max_semi_space_size_, kMinSemiSpaceSize);
4654 max_semi_space_size_ = RoundDown<Page::kPageSize>(max_semi_space_size_);
4655 }
4656
4657 // Initialize max_old_generation_size_ and max_global_memory_.
4658 {
4659 size_t max_old_generation_size = 700ul * (kSystemPointerSize / 4) * MB;
4660 if (constraints.max_old_generation_size_in_bytes() > 0) {
4661 max_old_generation_size = constraints.max_old_generation_size_in_bytes();
4662 }
4663 if (FLAG_max_old_space_size > 0) {
4664 max_old_generation_size =
4665 static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_max_old_space_size) * MB;
4666 } else if (FLAG_max_heap_size > 0) {
4667 size_t max_heap_size = static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_max_heap_size) * MB;
4668 size_t young_generation_size =
4669 YoungGenerationSizeFromSemiSpaceSize(max_semi_space_size_);
4670 max_old_generation_size = max_heap_size > young_generation_size
4671 ? max_heap_size - young_generation_size
4672 : 0;
4673 }
4674 max_old_generation_size =
4675 Max(max_old_generation_size, MinOldGenerationSize());
4676 max_old_generation_size =
4677 Min(max_old_generation_size, AllocatorLimitOnMaxOldGenerationSize());
4678 max_old_generation_size =
4679 RoundDown<Page::kPageSize>(max_old_generation_size);
4680
4681 max_global_memory_size_ =
4682 GlobalMemorySizeFromV8Size(max_old_generation_size);
4683 set_max_old_generation_size(max_old_generation_size);
4684 }
4685
4686 CHECK_IMPLIES(FLAG_max_heap_size > 0,do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(FLAG_max_heap_size > 0) ||
(FLAG_max_semi_space_size == 0 || FLAG_max_old_space_size ==
0))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "FLAG_max_heap_size > 0"
" implies " "FLAG_max_semi_space_size == 0 || FLAG_max_old_space_size == 0"
); } } while (false)
4687 FLAG_max_semi_space_size == 0 || FLAG_max_old_space_size == 0)do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(FLAG_max_heap_size > 0) ||
(FLAG_max_semi_space_size == 0 || FLAG_max_old_space_size ==
0))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "FLAG_max_heap_size > 0"
" implies " "FLAG_max_semi_space_size == 0 || FLAG_max_old_space_size == 0"
); } } while (false);
4688
4689 // Initialize initial_semispace_size_.
4690 {
4691 initial_semispace_size_ = kMinSemiSpaceSize;
4692 if (max_semi_space_size_ == kMaxSemiSpaceSize) {
4693 // Start with at least 1*MB semi-space on machines with a lot of memory.
4694 initial_semispace_size_ =
4695 Max(initial_semispace_size_, static_cast<size_t>(1 * MB));
4696 }
4697 if (constraints.initial_young_generation_size_in_bytes() > 0) {
4698 initial_semispace_size_ = SemiSpaceSizeFromYoungGenerationSize(
4699 constraints.initial_young_generation_size_in_bytes());
4700 }
4701 if (FLAG_initial_heap_size > 0) {
4702 size_t young_generation, old_generation;
4703 Heap::GenerationSizesFromHeapSize(
4704 static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_initial_heap_size) * MB, &young_generation,
4705 &old_generation);
4706 initial_semispace_size_ =
4707 SemiSpaceSizeFromYoungGenerationSize(young_generation);
4708 }
4709 if (FLAG_min_semi_space_size > 0) {
4710 initial_semispace_size_ =
4711 static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_min_semi_space_size) * MB;
4712 }
4713 initial_semispace_size_ =
4714 Min(initial_semispace_size_, max_semi_space_size_);
4715 initial_semispace_size_ =
4716 RoundDown<Page::kPageSize>(initial_semispace_size_);
4717 }
4718
4719 if (FLAG_lazy_new_space_shrinking) {
4720 initial_semispace_size_ = max_semi_space_size_;
4721 }
4722
4723 // Initialize initial_old_space_size_.
4724 {
4725 initial_old_generation_size_ = kMaxInitialOldGenerationSize;
4726 if (constraints.initial_old_generation_size_in_bytes() > 0) {
4727 initial_old_generation_size_ =
4728 constraints.initial_old_generation_size_in_bytes();
4729 old_generation_size_configured_ = true;
4730 }
4731 if (FLAG_initial_heap_size > 0) {
4732 size_t initial_heap_size =
4733 static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_initial_heap_size) * MB;
4734 size_t young_generation_size =
4735 YoungGenerationSizeFromSemiSpaceSize(initial_semispace_size_);
4736 initial_old_generation_size_ =
4737 initial_heap_size > young_generation_size
4738 ? initial_heap_size - young_generation_size
4739 : 0;
4740 old_generation_size_configured_ = true;
4741 }
4742 if (FLAG_initial_old_space_size > 0) {
4743 initial_old_generation_size_ =
4744 static_cast<size_t>(FLAG_initial_old_space_size) * MB;
4745 old_generation_size_configured_ = true;
4746 }
4747 initial_old_generation_size_ =
4748 Min(initial_old_generation_size_, max_old_generation_size() / 2);
4749 initial_old_generation_size_ =
4750 RoundDown<Page::kPageSize>(initial_old_generation_size_);
4751 }
4752
4753 if (old_generation_size_configured_) {
4754 // If the embedder pre-configures the initial old generation size,
4755 // then allow V8 to skip full GCs below that threshold.
4756 min_old_generation_size_ = initial_old_generation_size_;
4757 min_global_memory_size_ =
4758 GlobalMemorySizeFromV8Size(min_old_generation_size_);
4759 }
4760
4761 if (FLAG_semi_space_growth_factor < 2) {
4762 FLAG_semi_space_growth_factor = 2;
4763 }
4764
4765 old_generation_allocation_limit_ = initial_old_generation_size_;
4766 global_allocation_limit_ =
4767 GlobalMemorySizeFromV8Size(old_generation_allocation_limit_);
4768 initial_max_old_generation_size_ = max_old_generation_size();
4769
4770 // We rely on being able to allocate new arrays in paged spaces.
4771 DCHECK(kMaxRegularHeapObjectSize >=((void) 0)
4772 (JSArray::kHeaderSize +((void) 0)
4773 FixedArray::SizeFor(JSArray::kInitialMaxFastElementArray) +((void) 0)
4774 AllocationMemento::kSize))((void) 0);
4775
4776 code_range_size_ = constraints.code_range_size_in_bytes();
4777
4778 configured_ = true;
4779}
4780
4781void Heap::AddToRingBuffer(const char* string) {
4782 size_t first_part =
4783 Min(strlen(string), kTraceRingBufferSize - ring_buffer_end_);
4784 memcpy(trace_ring_buffer_ + ring_buffer_end_, string, first_part);
4785 ring_buffer_end_ += first_part;
4786 if (first_part < strlen(string)) {
4787 ring_buffer_full_ = true;
4788 size_t second_part = strlen(string) - first_part;
4789 memcpy(trace_ring_buffer_, string + first_part, second_part);
4790 ring_buffer_end_ = second_part;
4791 }
4792}
4793
4794
4795void Heap::GetFromRingBuffer(char* buffer) {
4796 size_t copied = 0;
4797 if (ring_buffer_full_) {
4798 copied = kTraceRingBufferSize - ring_buffer_end_;
4799 memcpy(buffer, trace_ring_buffer_ + ring_buffer_end_, copied);
4800 }
4801 memcpy(buffer + copied, trace_ring_buffer_, ring_buffer_end_);
4802}
4803
4804void Heap::ConfigureHeapDefault() {
4805 v8::ResourceConstraints constraints;
4806 ConfigureHeap(constraints);
4807}
4808
4809void Heap::RecordStats(HeapStats* stats, bool take_snapshot) {
4810 *stats->start_marker = HeapStats::kStartMarker;
4811 *stats->end_marker = HeapStats::kEndMarker;
4812 *stats->ro_space_size = read_only_space_->Size();
4813 *stats->ro_space_capacity = read_only_space_->Capacity();
4814 *stats->new_space_size = new_space_->Size();
4815 *stats->new_space_capacity = new_space_->Capacity();
4816 *stats->old_space_size = old_space_->SizeOfObjects();
4817 *stats->old_space_capacity = old_space_->Capacity();
4818 *stats->code_space_size = code_space_->SizeOfObjects();
4819 *stats->code_space_capacity = code_space_->Capacity();
4820 *stats->map_space_size = map_space_->SizeOfObjects();
4821 *stats->map_space_capacity = map_space_->Capacity();
4822 *stats->lo_space_size = lo_space_->Size();
4823 *stats->code_lo_space_size = code_lo_space_->Size();
4824 isolate_->global_handles()->RecordStats(stats);
4825 *stats->memory_allocator_size = memory_allocator()->Size();
4826 *stats->memory_allocator_capacity =
4827 memory_allocator()->Size() + memory_allocator()->Available();
4828 *stats->os_error = base::OS::GetLastError();
4829 // TODO(leszeks): Include the string table in both current and peak usage.
4830 *stats->malloced_memory = isolate_->allocator()->GetCurrentMemoryUsage();
4831 *stats->malloced_peak_memory = isolate_->allocator()->GetMaxMemoryUsage();
4832 if (take_snapshot) {
4833 HeapObjectIterator iterator(this);
4834 for (HeapObject obj = iterator.Next(); !obj.is_null();
4835 obj = iterator.Next()) {
4836 InstanceType type = obj.map().instance_type();
4837 DCHECK(0 <= type && type <= LAST_TYPE)((void) 0);
4838 stats->objects_per_type[type]++;
4839 stats->size_per_type[type] += obj.Size();
4840 }
4841 }
4842 if (stats->last_few_messages != nullptr)
4843 GetFromRingBuffer(stats->last_few_messages);
4844}
4845
4846size_t Heap::OldGenerationSizeOfObjects() {
4847 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
4848 size_t total = 0;
4849 for (PagedSpace* space = spaces.Next(); space != nullptr;
4850 space = spaces.Next()) {
4851 total += space->SizeOfObjects();
4852 }
4853 return total + lo_space_->SizeOfObjects() + code_lo_space_->SizeOfObjects();
4854}
4855
4856size_t Heap::GlobalSizeOfObjects() {
4857 const size_t on_heap_size = OldGenerationSizeOfObjects();
4858 const size_t embedder_size = local_embedder_heap_tracer()
4859 ? local_embedder_heap_tracer()->used_size()
4860 : 0;
4861 return on_heap_size + embedder_size;
4862}
4863
4864uint64_t Heap::AllocatedExternalMemorySinceMarkCompact() {
4865 return external_memory_.AllocatedSinceMarkCompact();
4866}
4867
4868bool Heap::AllocationLimitOvershotByLargeMargin() {
4869 // This guards against too eager finalization in small heaps.
4870 // The number is chosen based on v8.browsing_mobile on Nexus 7v2.
4871 constexpr size_t kMarginForSmallHeaps = 32u * MB;
4872
4873 uint64_t size_now =
4874 OldGenerationSizeOfObjects() + AllocatedExternalMemorySinceMarkCompact();
4875
4876 const size_t v8_overshoot = old_generation_allocation_limit_ < size_now
4877 ? size_now - old_generation_allocation_limit_
4878 : 0;
4879 const size_t global_overshoot =
4880 global_allocation_limit_ < GlobalSizeOfObjects()
4881 ? GlobalSizeOfObjects() - global_allocation_limit_
4882 : 0;
4883
4884 // Bail out if the V8 and global sizes are still below their respective
4885 // limits.
4886 if (v8_overshoot == 0 && global_overshoot == 0) {
4887 return false;
4888 }
4889
4890 // Overshoot margin is 50% of allocation limit or half-way to the max heap
4891 // with special handling of small heaps.
4892 const size_t v8_margin =
4893 Min(Max(old_generation_allocation_limit_ / 2, kMarginForSmallHeaps),
4894 (max_old_generation_size() - old_generation_allocation_limit_) / 2);
4895 const size_t global_margin =
4896 Min(Max(global_allocation_limit_ / 2, kMarginForSmallHeaps),
4897 (max_global_memory_size_ - global_allocation_limit_) / 2);
4898
4899 return v8_overshoot >= v8_margin || global_overshoot >= global_margin;
4900}
4901
4902bool Heap::ShouldOptimizeForLoadTime() {
4903 return isolate()->rail_mode() == PERFORMANCE_LOAD &&
4904 !AllocationLimitOvershotByLargeMargin() &&
4905 MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs() <
4906 isolate()->LoadStartTimeMs() + kMaxLoadTimeMs;
4907}
4908
4909// This predicate is called when an old generation space cannot allocated from
4910// the free list and is about to add a new page. Returning false will cause a
4911// major GC. It happens when the old generation allocation limit is reached and
4912// - either we need to optimize for memory usage,
4913// - or the incremental marking is not in progress and we cannot start it.
4914bool Heap::ShouldExpandOldGenerationOnSlowAllocation(LocalHeap* local_heap) {
4915 if (always_allocate() || OldGenerationSpaceAvailable() > 0) return true;
4916 // We reached the old generation allocation limit.
4917
4918 // Ensure that retry of allocation on background thread succeeds
4919 if (IsRetryOfFailedAllocation(local_heap)) return true;
4920
4921 if (ShouldOptimizeForMemoryUsage()) return false;
4922
4923 if (ShouldOptimizeForLoadTime()) return true;
4924
4925 if (incremental_marking()->NeedsFinalization()) {
4926 return !AllocationLimitOvershotByLargeMargin();
4927 }
4928
4929 if (incremental_marking()->IsStopped() &&
4930 IncrementalMarkingLimitReached() == IncrementalMarkingLimit::kNoLimit) {
4931 // We cannot start incremental marking.
4932 return false;
4933 }
4934 return true;
4935}
4936
4937bool Heap::IsRetryOfFailedAllocation(LocalHeap* local_heap) {
4938 if (!local_heap) return false;
4939 return local_heap->allocation_failed_;
4940}
4941
4942void Heap::AlwaysAllocateAfterTearDownStarted() {
4943 always_allocate_scope_count_++;
4944 collection_barrier_.ShutdownRequested();
4945}
4946
4947Heap::HeapGrowingMode Heap::CurrentHeapGrowingMode() {
4948 if (ShouldReduceMemory() || FLAG_stress_compaction) {
4949 return Heap::HeapGrowingMode::kMinimal;
4950 }
4951
4952 if (ShouldOptimizeForMemoryUsage()) {
4953 return Heap::HeapGrowingMode::kConservative;
4954 }
4955
4956 if (memory_reducer()->ShouldGrowHeapSlowly()) {
4957 return Heap::HeapGrowingMode::kSlow;
4958 }
4959
4960 return Heap::HeapGrowingMode::kDefault;
4961}
4962
4963base::Optional<size_t> Heap::GlobalMemoryAvailable() {
4964 if (!UseGlobalMemoryScheduling()) return {};
4965
4966 size_t global_size = GlobalSizeOfObjects();
4967
4968 if (global_size < global_allocation_limit_)
4969 return global_allocation_limit_ - global_size;
4970
4971 return 0;
4972}
4973
4974double Heap::PercentToOldGenerationLimit() {
4975 double size_at_gc = old_generation_size_at_last_gc_;
4976 double size_now =
4977 OldGenerationSizeOfObjects() + AllocatedExternalMemorySinceMarkCompact();
4978 double current_bytes = size_now - size_at_gc;
4979 double total_bytes = old_generation_allocation_limit_ - size_at_gc;
4980 return total_bytes > 0 ? (current_bytes / total_bytes) * 100.0 : 0;
4981}
4982
4983double Heap::PercentToGlobalMemoryLimit() {
4984 double size_at_gc = old_generation_size_at_last_gc_;
4985 double size_now =
4986 OldGenerationSizeOfObjects() + AllocatedExternalMemorySinceMarkCompact();
4987 double current_bytes = size_now - size_at_gc;
4988 double total_bytes = old_generation_allocation_limit_ - size_at_gc;
4989 return total_bytes > 0 ? (current_bytes / total_bytes) * 100.0 : 0;
4990}
4991
4992// This function returns either kNoLimit, kSoftLimit, or kHardLimit.
4993// The kNoLimit means that either incremental marking is disabled or it is too
4994// early to start incremental marking.
4995// The kSoftLimit means that incremental marking should be started soon.
4996// The kHardLimit means that incremental marking should be started immediately.
4997Heap::IncrementalMarkingLimit Heap::IncrementalMarkingLimitReached() {
4998 // Code using an AlwaysAllocateScope assumes that the GC state does not
4999 // change; that implies that no marking steps must be performed.
5000 if (!incremental_marking()->CanBeActivated() || always_allocate()) {
5001 // Incremental marking is disabled or it is too early to start.
5002 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kNoLimit;
5003 }
5004 if (FLAG_stress_incremental_marking) {
5005 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit;
5006 }
5007 if (incremental_marking()->IsBelowActivationThresholds()) {
5008 // Incremental marking is disabled or it is too early to start.
5009 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kNoLimit;
5010 }
5011 if (ShouldStressCompaction() || HighMemoryPressure()) {
5012 // If there is high memory pressure or stress testing is enabled, then
5013 // start marking immediately.
5014 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit;
5015 }
5016
5017 if (FLAG_stress_marking > 0) {
5018 int current_percent = static_cast<int>(
5019 std::max(PercentToOldGenerationLimit(), PercentToGlobalMemoryLimit()));
5020 if (current_percent > 0) {
5021 if (FLAG_trace_stress_marking) {
5022 isolate()->PrintWithTimestamp(
5023 "[IncrementalMarking] %d%% of the memory limit reached\n",
5024 current_percent);
5025 }
5026 if (FLAG_fuzzer_gc_analysis) {
5027 // Skips values >=100% since they already trigger marking.
5028 if (current_percent < 100) {
5029 max_marking_limit_reached_ =
5030 std::max<double>(max_marking_limit_reached_, current_percent);
5031 }
5032 } else if (current_percent >= stress_marking_percentage_) {
5033 stress_marking_percentage_ = NextStressMarkingLimit();
5034 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit;
5035 }
5036 }
5037 }
5038
5039 if (FLAG_incremental_marking_soft_trigger > 0 ||
5040 FLAG_incremental_marking_hard_trigger > 0) {
5041 int current_percent = static_cast<int>(
5042 std::max(PercentToOldGenerationLimit(), PercentToGlobalMemoryLimit()));
5043 if (current_percent > FLAG_incremental_marking_hard_trigger &&
5044 FLAG_incremental_marking_hard_trigger > 0) {
5045 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit;
5046 }
5047 if (current_percent > FLAG_incremental_marking_soft_trigger &&
5048 FLAG_incremental_marking_soft_trigger > 0) {
5049 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kSoftLimit;
5050 }
5051 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kNoLimit;
5052 }
5053
5054 size_t old_generation_space_available = OldGenerationSpaceAvailable();
5055 const base::Optional<size_t> global_memory_available =
5056 GlobalMemoryAvailable();
5057
5058 if (old_generation_space_available > new_space_->Capacity() &&
5059 (!global_memory_available ||
5060 global_memory_available > new_space_->Capacity())) {
5061 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kNoLimit;
5062 }
5063 if (ShouldOptimizeForMemoryUsage()) {
5064 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit;
5065 }
5066 if (ShouldOptimizeForLoadTime()) {
5067 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kNoLimit;
5068 }
5069 if (old_generation_space_available == 0) {
5070 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit;
5071 }
5072 if (global_memory_available && *global_memory_available == 0) {
5073 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kHardLimit;
5074 }
5075 return IncrementalMarkingLimit::kSoftLimit;
5076}
5077
5078bool Heap::ShouldStressCompaction() const {
5079 return FLAG_stress_compaction && (gc_count_ & 1) != 0;
5080}
5081
5082void Heap::EnableInlineAllocation() {
5083 if (!inline_allocation_disabled_) return;
5084 inline_allocation_disabled_ = false;
5085
5086 // Update inline allocation limit for new space.
5087 new_space()->AdvanceAllocationObservers();
5088 new_space()->UpdateInlineAllocationLimit(0);
5089}
5090
5091
5092void Heap::DisableInlineAllocation() {
5093 if (inline_allocation_disabled_) return;
5094 inline_allocation_disabled_ = true;
5095
5096 // Update inline allocation limit for new space.
5097 new_space()->UpdateInlineAllocationLimit(0);
5098
5099 // Update inline allocation limit for old spaces.
5100 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
5101 CodeSpaceMemoryModificationScope modification_scope(this);
5102 for (PagedSpace* space = spaces.Next(); space != nullptr;
5103 space = spaces.Next()) {
5104 base::MutexGuard guard(space->mutex());
5105 space->FreeLinearAllocationArea();
5106 }
5107}
5108
5109HeapObject Heap::EnsureImmovableCode(HeapObject heap_object, int object_size) {
5110 // Code objects which should stay at a fixed address are allocated either
5111 // in the first page of code space, in large object space, or (during
5112 // snapshot creation) the containing page is marked as immovable.
5113 DCHECK(!heap_object.is_null())((void) 0);
5114#ifndef V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP
5115 DCHECK(code_space_->Contains(heap_object))((void) 0);
5116#endif
5117 DCHECK_GE(object_size, 0)((void) 0);
5118 if (!Heap::IsImmovable(heap_object)) {
5119 if (isolate()->serializer_enabled() ||
5120 code_space_->first_page()->Contains(heap_object.address())) {
5121 BasicMemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(heap_object)->MarkNeverEvacuate();
5122 } else {
5123 // Discard the first code allocation, which was on a page where it could
5124 // be moved.
5125 CreateFillerObjectAt(heap_object.address(), object_size,
5126 ClearRecordedSlots::kNo);
5127 heap_object = AllocateRawCodeInLargeObjectSpace(object_size);
5128 UnprotectAndRegisterMemoryChunk(heap_object);
5129 ZapCodeObject(heap_object.address(), object_size);
5130 OnAllocationEvent(heap_object, object_size);
5131 }
5132 }
5133 return heap_object;
5134}
5135
5136HeapObject Heap::AllocateRawWithLightRetrySlowPath(
5137 int size, AllocationType allocation, AllocationOrigin origin,
5138 AllocationAlignment alignment) {
5139 HeapObject result;
5140 AllocationResult alloc = AllocateRaw(size, allocation, origin, alignment);
5141 if (alloc.To(&result)) {
5142 DCHECK(result != ReadOnlyRoots(this).exception())((void) 0);
5143 return result;
5144 }
5145 // Two GCs before panicking. In newspace will almost always succeed.
5146 for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
5147 CollectGarbage(alloc.RetrySpace(),
5148 GarbageCollectionReason::kAllocationFailure);
