5149 alloc = AllocateRaw(size, allocation, origin, alignment);
5150 if (alloc.To(&result)) {
5151 DCHECK(result != ReadOnlyRoots(this).exception())((void) 0);
5152 return result;
5153 }
5154 }
5155 return HeapObject();
5156}
5157
5158HeapObject Heap::AllocateRawWithRetryOrFailSlowPath(
5159 int size, AllocationType allocation, AllocationOrigin origin,
5160 AllocationAlignment alignment) {
5161 AllocationResult alloc;
5162 HeapObject result =
5163 AllocateRawWithLightRetrySlowPath(size, allocation, origin, alignment);
5164 if (!result.is_null()) return result;
5165
5166 isolate()->counters()->gc_last_resort_from_handles()->Increment();
5167 CollectAllAvailableGarbage(GarbageCollectionReason::kLastResort);
5168 {
5169 AlwaysAllocateScope scope(this);
5170 alloc = AllocateRaw(size, allocation, origin, alignment);
5171 }
5172 if (alloc.To(&result)) {
5173 DCHECK(result != ReadOnlyRoots(this).exception())((void) 0);
5174 return result;
5175 }
5176 // TODO(1181417): Fix this.
5177 FatalProcessOutOfMemory("CALL_AND_RETRY_LAST");
5178 return HeapObject();
5179}
5180
5181// TODO(jkummerow): Refactor this. AllocateRaw should take an "immovability"
5182// parameter and just do what's necessary.
5183HeapObject Heap::AllocateRawCodeInLargeObjectSpace(int size) {
5184 AllocationResult alloc = code_lo_space()->AllocateRaw(size);
5185 HeapObject result;
5186 if (alloc.To(&result)) {
5187 DCHECK(result != ReadOnlyRoots(this).exception())((void) 0);
5188 return result;
5189 }
5190 // Two GCs before panicking.
5191 for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
5192 CollectGarbage(alloc.RetrySpace(),
5193 GarbageCollectionReason::kAllocationFailure);
5194 alloc = code_lo_space()->AllocateRaw(size);
5195 if (alloc.To(&result)) {
5196 DCHECK(result != ReadOnlyRoots(this).exception())((void) 0);
5197 return result;
5198 }
5199 }
5200 isolate()->counters()->gc_last_resort_from_handles()->Increment();
5201 CollectAllAvailableGarbage(GarbageCollectionReason::kLastResort);
5202 {
5203 AlwaysAllocateScope scope(this);
5204 alloc = code_lo_space()->AllocateRaw(size);
5205 }
5206 if (alloc.To(&result)) {
5207 DCHECK(result != ReadOnlyRoots(this).exception())((void) 0);
5208 return result;
5209 }
5210 // TODO(1181417): Fix this.
5211 FatalProcessOutOfMemory("CALL_AND_RETRY_LAST");
5212 return HeapObject();
5213}
5214
5215void Heap::SetUp() {
5216#ifdef V8_ENABLE_ALLOCATION_TIMEOUT
5217 allocation_timeout_ = NextAllocationTimeout();
5218#endif
5219
5220#ifdef V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP
5221 tp_heap_ = third_party_heap::Heap::New(isolate());
5222#endif
5223
5224 // Initialize heap spaces and initial maps and objects.
5225 //
5226 // If the heap is not yet configured (e.g. through the API), configure it.
5227 // Configuration is based on the flags new-space-size (really the semispace
5228 // size) and old-space-size if set or the initial values of semispace_size_
5229 // and old_generation_size_ otherwise.
5230 if (!configured_) ConfigureHeapDefault();
5231
5232 mmap_region_base_ =
5233 reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(v8::internal::GetRandomMmapAddr()) &
5234 ~kMmapRegionMask;
5235
5236 // Set up memory allocator.
5237 memory_allocator_.reset(
5238 new MemoryAllocator(isolate_, MaxReserved(), code_range_size_));
5239
5240 mark_compact_collector_.reset(new MarkCompactCollector(this));
5241
5242 scavenger_collector_.reset(new ScavengerCollector(this));
5243
5244 incremental_marking_.reset(
5245 new IncrementalMarking(this, mark_compact_collector_->weak_objects()));
5246
5247 if (FLAG_concurrent_marking || FLAG_parallel_marking) {
5248 concurrent_marking_.reset(new ConcurrentMarking(
5249 this, mark_compact_collector_->marking_worklists(),
5250 mark_compact_collector_->weak_objects()));
5251 } else {
5252 concurrent_marking_.reset(new ConcurrentMarking(this, nullptr, nullptr));
5253 }
5254
5255 marking_barrier_.reset(new MarkingBarrier(this, mark_compact_collector(),
5256 incremental_marking()));
5257
5258 for (int i = FIRST_SPACE; i <= LAST_SPACE; i++) {
5259 space_[i] = nullptr;
5260 }
5261}
5262
5263void Heap::SetUpFromReadOnlyHeap(ReadOnlyHeap* ro_heap) {
5264 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(ro_heap)((void) 0);
5265 DCHECK_IMPLIES(read_only_space_ != nullptr,((void) 0)
5266 read_only_space_ == ro_heap->read_only_space())((void) 0);
5267 space_[RO_SPACE] = nullptr;
5268 read_only_space_ = ro_heap->read_only_space();
5269}
5270
5271void Heap::ReplaceReadOnlySpace(SharedReadOnlySpace* space) {
5272 CHECK(V8_SHARED_RO_HEAP_BOOL)do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(false)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "V8_SHARED_RO_HEAP_BOOL"); } } while (false);
5273 if (read_only_space_) {
5274 read_only_space_->TearDown(memory_allocator());
5275 delete read_only_space_;
5276 }
5277
5278 read_only_space_ = space;
5279}
5280
5281class StressConcurrentAllocationObserver : public AllocationObserver {
5282 public:
5283 explicit StressConcurrentAllocationObserver(Heap* heap)
5284 : AllocationObserver(1024), heap_(heap) {}
5285
5286 void Step(int bytes_allocated, Address, size_t) override {
5287 DCHECK(heap_->deserialization_complete())((void) 0);
5288 StressConcurrentAllocatorTask::Schedule(heap_->isolate());
5289 heap_->RemoveAllocationObserversFromAllSpaces(this, this);
5290 heap_->need_to_remove_stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_ = false;
5291 }
5292
5293 private:
5294 Heap* heap_;
5295};
5296
5297void Heap::SetUpSpaces() {
5298 // Ensure SetUpFromReadOnlySpace has been ran.
5299 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(read_only_space_)((void) 0);
5300 space_[NEW_SPACE] = new_space_ =
5301 new NewSpace(this, memory_allocator_->data_page_allocator(),
5302 initial_semispace_size_, max_semi_space_size_);
5303 space_[OLD_SPACE] = old_space_ = new OldSpace(this);
5304 space_[CODE_SPACE] = code_space_ = new CodeSpace(this);
5305 space_[MAP_SPACE] = map_space_ = new MapSpace(this);
5306 space_[LO_SPACE] = lo_space_ = new OldLargeObjectSpace(this);
5307 space_[NEW_LO_SPACE] = new_lo_space_ =
5308 new NewLargeObjectSpace(this, new_space_->Capacity());
5309 space_[CODE_LO_SPACE] = code_lo_space_ = new CodeLargeObjectSpace(this);
5310
5311 for (int i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(v8::Isolate::kUseCounterFeatureCount);
5312 i++) {
5313 deferred_counters_[i] = 0;
5314 }
5315
5316 tracer_.reset(new GCTracer(this));
5317#ifdef ENABLE_MINOR_MC1
5318 minor_mark_compact_collector_ = new MinorMarkCompactCollector(this);
5319#else
5320 minor_mark_compact_collector_ = nullptr;
5321#endif // ENABLE_MINOR_MC
5322 array_buffer_sweeper_.reset(new ArrayBufferSweeper(this));
5323 gc_idle_time_handler_.reset(new GCIdleTimeHandler());
5324 memory_measurement_.reset(new MemoryMeasurement(isolate()));
5325 memory_reducer_.reset(new MemoryReducer(this));
5326 if (V8_UNLIKELY(TracingFlags::is_gc_stats_enabled())(__builtin_expect(!!(TracingFlags::is_gc_stats_enabled()), 0)
)) {
5327 live_object_stats_.reset(new ObjectStats(this));
5328 dead_object_stats_.reset(new ObjectStats(this));
5329 }
5330 local_embedder_heap_tracer_.reset(new LocalEmbedderHeapTracer(isolate()));
5331
5332 LOG(isolate_, IntPtrTEvent("heap-capacity", Capacity()))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->IntPtrTEvent("heap-capacity", Capacity
()); } while (false);
5333 LOG(isolate_, IntPtrTEvent("heap-available", Available()))do { auto&& logger = (isolate_)->logger(); if (logger
->is_logging()) logger->IntPtrTEvent("heap-available", Available
()); } while (false);
5334
5335 mark_compact_collector()->SetUp();
5336#ifdef ENABLE_MINOR_MC1
5337 if (minor_mark_compact_collector() != nullptr) {
5338 minor_mark_compact_collector()->SetUp();
5339 }
5340#endif // ENABLE_MINOR_MC
5341
5342 scavenge_job_.reset(new ScavengeJob());
5343 scavenge_task_observer_.reset(new ScavengeTaskObserver(
5344 this, ScavengeJob::YoungGenerationTaskTriggerSize(this)));
5345 new_space()->AddAllocationObserver(scavenge_task_observer_.get());
5346
5347 SetGetExternallyAllocatedMemoryInBytesCallback(
5348 DefaultGetExternallyAllocatedMemoryInBytesCallback);
5349
5350 if (FLAG_stress_marking > 0) {
5351 stress_marking_percentage_ = NextStressMarkingLimit();
5352 stress_marking_observer_ = new StressMarkingObserver(this);
5353 AddAllocationObserversToAllSpaces(stress_marking_observer_,
5354 stress_marking_observer_);
5355 }
5356 if (FLAG_stress_scavenge > 0) {
5357 stress_scavenge_observer_ = new StressScavengeObserver(this);
5358 new_space()->AddAllocationObserver(stress_scavenge_observer_);
5359 }
5360
5361 write_protect_code_memory_ = FLAG_write_protect_code_memory;
5362}
5363
5364void Heap::InitializeHashSeed() {
5365 DCHECK(!deserialization_complete_)((void) 0);
5366 uint64_t new_hash_seed;
5367 if (FLAG_hash_seed == 0) {
5368 int64_t rnd = isolate()->random_number_generator()->NextInt64();
5369 new_hash_seed = static_cast<uint64_t>(rnd);
5370 } else {
5371 new_hash_seed = static_cast<uint64_t>(FLAG_hash_seed);
5372 }
5373 ReadOnlyRoots(this).hash_seed().copy_in(
5374 0, reinterpret_cast<byte*>(&new_hash_seed), kInt64Size);
5375}
5376
5377int Heap::NextAllocationTimeout(int current_timeout) {
5378 if (FLAG_random_gc_interval > 0) {
5379 // If current timeout hasn't reached 0 the GC was caused by something
5380 // different than --stress-atomic-gc flag and we don't update the timeout.
5381 if (current_timeout <= 0) {
5382 return isolate()->fuzzer_rng()->NextInt(FLAG_random_gc_interval + 1);
5383 } else {
5384 return current_timeout;
5385 }
5386 }
5387 return FLAG_gc_interval;
5388}
5389
5390void Heap::PrintAllocationsHash() {
5391 uint32_t hash = StringHasher::GetHashCore(raw_allocations_hash_);
5392 PrintF("\n### Allocations = %u, hash = 0x%08x\n", allocations_count(), hash);
5393}
5394
5395void Heap::PrintMaxMarkingLimitReached() {
5396 PrintF("\n### Maximum marking limit reached = %.02lf\n",
5397 max_marking_limit_reached_);
5398}
5399
5400void Heap::PrintMaxNewSpaceSizeReached() {
5401 PrintF("\n### Maximum new space size reached = %.02lf\n",
5402 stress_scavenge_observer_->MaxNewSpaceSizeReached());
5403}
5404
5405int Heap::NextStressMarkingLimit() {
5406 return isolate()->fuzzer_rng()->NextInt(FLAG_stress_marking + 1);
5407}
5408
5409void Heap::NotifyDeserializationComplete() {
5410 PagedSpaceIterator spaces(this);
5411 for (PagedSpace* s = spaces.Next(); s != nullptr; s = spaces.Next()) {
5412 if (isolate()->snapshot_available()) s->ShrinkImmortalImmovablePages();
5413#ifdef DEBUG
5414 // All pages right after bootstrapping must be marked as never-evacuate.
5415 for (Page* p : *s) {
5416 DCHECK(p->NeverEvacuate())((void) 0);
5417 }
5418#endif // DEBUG
5419 }
5420
5421 if (FLAG_stress_concurrent_allocation) {
5422 stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_.reset(
5423 new StressConcurrentAllocationObserver(this));
5424 AddAllocationObserversToAllSpaces(
5425 stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_.get(),
5426 stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_.get());
5427 need_to_remove_stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_ = true;
5428 }
5429
5430 deserialization_complete_ = true;
5431}
5432
5433void Heap::NotifyBootstrapComplete() {
5434 // This function is invoked for each native context creation. We are
5435 // interested only in the first native context.
5436 if (old_generation_capacity_after_bootstrap_ == 0) {
5437 old_generation_capacity_after_bootstrap_ = OldGenerationCapacity();
5438 }
5439}
5440
5441void Heap::NotifyOldGenerationExpansion(AllocationSpace space,
5442 MemoryChunk* chunk) {
5443 // Pages created during bootstrapping may contain immortal immovable objects.
5444 if (!deserialization_complete()) {
5445 chunk->MarkNeverEvacuate();
5446 }
5447 if (space == CODE_SPACE || space == CODE_LO_SPACE) {
5448 isolate()->AddCodeMemoryChunk(chunk);
5449 }
5450 const size_t kMemoryReducerActivationThreshold = 1 * MB;
5451 if (old_generation_capacity_after_bootstrap_ && ms_count_ == 0 &&
5452 OldGenerationCapacity() >= old_generation_capacity_after_bootstrap_ +
5453 kMemoryReducerActivationThreshold &&
5454 FLAG_memory_reducer_for_small_heaps) {
5455 MemoryReducer::Event event;
5456 event.type = MemoryReducer::kPossibleGarbage;
5457 event.time_ms = MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
5458 memory_reducer()->NotifyPossibleGarbage(event);
5459 }
5460}
5461
5462void Heap::SetEmbedderHeapTracer(EmbedderHeapTracer* tracer) {
5463 DCHECK_EQ(gc_state(), HeapState::NOT_IN_GC)((void) 0);
5464 local_embedder_heap_tracer()->SetRemoteTracer(tracer);
5465}
5466
5467EmbedderHeapTracer* Heap::GetEmbedderHeapTracer() const {
5468 return local_embedder_heap_tracer()->remote_tracer();
5469}
5470
5471EmbedderHeapTracer::TraceFlags Heap::flags_for_embedder_tracer() const {
5472 if (is_current_gc_forced()) {
5473 return EmbedderHeapTracer::TraceFlags::kForced;
5474 } else if (ShouldReduceMemory()) {
5475 return EmbedderHeapTracer::TraceFlags::kReduceMemory;
5476 }
5477 return EmbedderHeapTracer::TraceFlags::kNoFlags;
5478}
5479
5480void Heap::RegisterExternallyReferencedObject(Address* location) {
5481 GlobalHandles::MarkTraced(location);
5482 Object object(*location);
5483 if (!object.IsHeapObject()) {
5484 // The embedder is not aware of whether numbers are materialized as heap
5485 // objects are just passed around as Smis.
5486 return;
5487 }
5488 HeapObject heap_object = HeapObject::cast(object);
5489 DCHECK(IsValidHeapObject(this, heap_object))((void) 0);
5490 if (FLAG_incremental_marking_wrappers && incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
5491 incremental_marking()->WhiteToGreyAndPush(heap_object);
5492 } else {
5493 DCHECK(mark_compact_collector()->in_use())((void) 0);
5494 mark_compact_collector()->MarkExternallyReferencedObject(heap_object);
5495 }
5496}
5497
5498void Heap::StartTearDown() {
5499 SetGCState(TEAR_DOWN);
5500
5501 // Background threads may allocate and block until GC is performed. However
5502 // this might never happen when the main thread tries to quit and doesn't
5503 // process the event queue anymore. Avoid this deadlock by allowing all
5504 // allocations after tear down was requested to make sure all background
5505 // threads finish.
5506 AlwaysAllocateAfterTearDownStarted();
5507
5508#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
5509 // {StartTearDown} is called fairly early during Isolate teardown, so it's
5510 // a good time to run heap verification (if requested), before starting to
5511 // tear down parts of the Isolate.
5512 if (FLAG_verify_heap) {
5513 SafepointScope scope(this);
5514 Verify();
5515 }
5516#endif
5517}
5518
5519void Heap::TearDown() {
5520 DCHECK_EQ(gc_state(), TEAR_DOWN)((void) 0);
5521
5522 // It's too late for Heap::Verify() here, as parts of the Isolate are
5523 // already gone by the time this is called.
5524
5525 UpdateMaximumCommitted();
5526
5527 if (FLAG_verify_predictable || FLAG_fuzzer_gc_analysis) {
5528 PrintAllocationsHash();
5529 }
5530
5531 if (FLAG_fuzzer_gc_analysis) {
5532 if (FLAG_stress_marking > 0) {
5533 PrintMaxMarkingLimitReached();
5534 }
5535 if (FLAG_stress_scavenge > 0) {
5536 PrintMaxNewSpaceSizeReached();
5537 }
5538 }
5539
5540 new_space()->RemoveAllocationObserver(scavenge_task_observer_.get());
5541 scavenge_task_observer_.reset();
5542 scavenge_job_.reset();
5543
5544 if (need_to_remove_stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_) {
5545 RemoveAllocationObserversFromAllSpaces(
5546 stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_.get(),
5547 stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_.get());
5548 }
5549 stress_concurrent_allocation_observer_.reset();
5550
5551 if (FLAG_stress_marking > 0) {
5552 RemoveAllocationObserversFromAllSpaces(stress_marking_observer_,
5553 stress_marking_observer_);
5554 delete stress_marking_observer_;
5555 stress_marking_observer_ = nullptr;
5556 }
5557 if (FLAG_stress_scavenge > 0) {
5558 new_space()->RemoveAllocationObserver(stress_scavenge_observer_);
5559 delete stress_scavenge_observer_;
5560 stress_scavenge_observer_ = nullptr;
5561 }
5562
5563 if (mark_compact_collector_) {
5564 mark_compact_collector_->TearDown();
5565 mark_compact_collector_.reset();
5566 }
5567
5568#ifdef ENABLE_MINOR_MC1
5569 if (minor_mark_compact_collector_ != nullptr) {
5570 minor_mark_compact_collector_->TearDown();
5571 delete minor_mark_compact_collector_;
5572 minor_mark_compact_collector_ = nullptr;
5573 }
5574#endif // ENABLE_MINOR_MC
5575
5576 scavenger_collector_.reset();
5577 array_buffer_sweeper_.reset();
5578 incremental_marking_.reset();
5579 concurrent_marking_.reset();
5580
5581 gc_idle_time_handler_.reset();
5582
5583 memory_measurement_.reset();
5584
5585 if (memory_reducer_ != nullptr) {
5586 memory_reducer_->TearDown();
5587 memory_reducer_.reset();
5588 }
5589
5590 live_object_stats_.reset();
5591 dead_object_stats_.reset();
5592
5593 local_embedder_heap_tracer_.reset();
5594
5595 external_string_table_.TearDown();
5596
5597 tracer_.reset();
5598
5599 for (int i = FIRST_MUTABLE_SPACE; i <= LAST_MUTABLE_SPACE; i++) {
5600 delete space_[i];
5601 space_[i] = nullptr;
5602 }
5603
5604 isolate()->read_only_heap()->OnHeapTearDown(this);
5605 read_only_space_ = nullptr;
5606
5607 memory_allocator()->TearDown();
5608
5609 StrongRootsList* next = nullptr;
5610 for (StrongRootsList* list = strong_roots_list_; list; list = next) {
5611 next = list->next;
5612 delete list;
5613 }
5614 strong_roots_list_ = nullptr;
5615
5616 memory_allocator_.reset();
5617}
5618
5619void Heap::AddGCPrologueCallback(v8::Isolate::GCCallbackWithData callback,
5620 GCType gc_type, void* data) {
5621 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(callback)((void) 0);
5622 DCHECK(gc_prologue_callbacks_.end() ==((void) 0)
5623 std::find(gc_prologue_callbacks_.begin(), gc_prologue_callbacks_.end(),((void) 0)
5624 GCCallbackTuple(callback, gc_type, data)))((void) 0);
5625 gc_prologue_callbacks_.emplace_back(callback, gc_type, data);
5626}
5627
5628void Heap::RemoveGCPrologueCallback(v8::Isolate::GCCallbackWithData callback,
5629 void* data) {
5630 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(callback)((void) 0);
5631 for (size_t i = 0; i < gc_prologue_callbacks_.size(); i++) {
5632 if (gc_prologue_callbacks_[i].callback == callback &&
5633 gc_prologue_callbacks_[i].data == data) {
5634 gc_prologue_callbacks_[i] = gc_prologue_callbacks_.back();
5635 gc_prologue_callbacks_.pop_back();
5636 return;
5637 }
5638 }
5639 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
5640}
5641
5642void Heap::AddGCEpilogueCallback(v8::Isolate::GCCallbackWithData callback,
5643 GCType gc_type, void* data) {
5644 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(callback)((void) 0);
5645 DCHECK(gc_epilogue_callbacks_.end() ==((void) 0)
5646 std::find(gc_epilogue_callbacks_.begin(), gc_epilogue_callbacks_.end(),((void) 0)
5647 GCCallbackTuple(callback, gc_type, data)))((void) 0);
5648 gc_epilogue_callbacks_.emplace_back(callback, gc_type, data);
5649}
5650
5651void Heap::RemoveGCEpilogueCallback(v8::Isolate::GCCallbackWithData callback,
5652 void* data) {
5653 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(callback)((void) 0);
5654 for (size_t i = 0; i < gc_epilogue_callbacks_.size(); i++) {
5655 if (gc_epilogue_callbacks_[i].callback == callback &&
5656 gc_epilogue_callbacks_[i].data == data) {
5657 gc_epilogue_callbacks_[i] = gc_epilogue_callbacks_.back();
5658 gc_epilogue_callbacks_.pop_back();
5659 return;
5660 }
5661 }
5662 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
5663}
5664
5665namespace {
5666Handle<WeakArrayList> CompactWeakArrayList(Heap* heap,
5667 Handle<WeakArrayList> array,
5668 AllocationType allocation) {
5669 if (array->length() == 0) {
5670 return array;
5671 }
5672 int new_length = array->CountLiveWeakReferences();
5673 if (new_length == array->length()) {
5674 return array;
5675 }
5676
5677 Handle<WeakArrayList> new_array = WeakArrayList::EnsureSpace(
5678 heap->isolate(),
5679 handle(ReadOnlyRoots(heap).empty_weak_array_list(), heap->isolate()),
5680 new_length, allocation);
5681 // Allocation might have caused GC and turned some of the elements into
5682 // cleared weak heap objects. Count the number of live references again and
5683 // fill in the new array.
5684 int copy_to = 0;
5685 for (int i = 0; i < array->length(); i++) {
5686 MaybeObject element = array->Get(i);
5687 if (element->IsCleared()) continue;
5688 new_array->Set(copy_to++, element);
5689 }
5690 new_array->set_length(copy_to);
5691 return new_array;
5692}
5693
5694} // anonymous namespace
5695
5696void Heap::CompactWeakArrayLists(AllocationType allocation) {
5697 // Find known PrototypeUsers and compact them.
5698 std::vector<Handle<PrototypeInfo>> prototype_infos;
5699 {
5700 HeapObjectIterator iterator(this);
5701 for (HeapObject o = iterator.Next(); !o.is_null(); o = iterator.Next()) {
5702 if (o.IsPrototypeInfo()) {
5703 PrototypeInfo prototype_info = PrototypeInfo::cast(o);
5704 if (prototype_info.prototype_users().IsWeakArrayList()) {
5705 prototype_infos.emplace_back(handle(prototype_info, isolate()));
5706 }
5707 }
5708 }
5709 }
5710 for (auto& prototype_info : prototype_infos) {
5711 Handle<WeakArrayList> array(
5712 WeakArrayList::cast(prototype_info->prototype_users()), isolate());
5713 DCHECK_IMPLIES(allocation == AllocationType::kOld,((void) 0)
5714 InOldSpace(*array) ||((void) 0)
5715 *array == ReadOnlyRoots(this).empty_weak_array_list())((void) 0);
5716 WeakArrayList new_array = PrototypeUsers::Compact(
5717 array, this, JSObject::PrototypeRegistryCompactionCallback, allocation);
5718 prototype_info->set_prototype_users(new_array);
5719 }
5720
5721 // Find known WeakArrayLists and compact them.
5722 Handle<WeakArrayList> scripts(script_list(), isolate());
5723 DCHECK_IMPLIES(((void) 0)
5724 !V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOL && allocation == AllocationType::kOld,((void) 0)
5725 InOldSpace(*scripts))((void) 0);
5726 scripts = CompactWeakArrayList(this, scripts, allocation);
5727 set_script_list(*scripts);
5728}
5729
5730void Heap::AddRetainedMap(Handle<NativeContext> context, Handle<Map> map) {
5731 if (map->is_in_retained_map_list()) {
5732 return;
5733 }
5734 Handle<WeakArrayList> array(context->retained_maps(), isolate());
5735 if (array->IsFull()) {
5736 CompactRetainedMaps(*array);
5737 }
5738 array =
5739 WeakArrayList::AddToEnd(isolate(), array, MaybeObjectHandle::Weak(map));
5740 array = WeakArrayList::AddToEnd(
5741 isolate(), array,
5742 MaybeObjectHandle(Smi::FromInt(FLAG_retain_maps_for_n_gc), isolate()));
5743 if (*array != context->retained_maps()) {
5744 context->set_retained_maps(*array);
5745 }
5746 map->set_is_in_retained_map_list(true);
5747}
5748
5749void Heap::CompactRetainedMaps(WeakArrayList retained_maps) {
5750 int length = retained_maps.length();
5751 int new_length = 0;
5752 // This loop compacts the array by removing cleared weak cells.
5753 for (int i = 0; i < length; i += 2) {
5754 MaybeObject maybe_object = retained_maps.Get(i);
5755 if (maybe_object->IsCleared()) {
5756 continue;
5757 }
5758
5759 DCHECK(maybe_object->IsWeak())((void) 0);
5760
5761 MaybeObject age = retained_maps.Get(i + 1);
5762 DCHECK(age->IsSmi())((void) 0);
5763 if (i != new_length) {
5764 retained_maps.Set(new_length, maybe_object);
5765 retained_maps.Set(new_length + 1, age);
5766 }
5767 new_length += 2;
5768 }
5769 HeapObject undefined = ReadOnlyRoots(this).undefined_value();
5770 for (int i = new_length; i < length; i++) {
5771 retained_maps.Set(i, HeapObjectReference::Strong(undefined));
5772 }
5773 if (new_length != length) retained_maps.set_length(new_length);
5774}
5775
5776void Heap::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(const char* location) {
5777 v8::internal::V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(isolate(), location, true);
5778}
5779
5780#ifdef DEBUG
5781
5782class PrintHandleVisitor : public RootVisitor {
5783 public:
5784 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
5785 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
5786 for (FullObjectSlot p = start; p < end; ++p)
5787 PrintF(" handle %p to %p\n", p.ToVoidPtr(),
5788 reinterpret_cast<void*>((*p).ptr()));
5789 }
5790};
5791
5792
5793void Heap::PrintHandles() {
5794 PrintF("Handles:\n");
5795 PrintHandleVisitor v;
5796 isolate_->handle_scope_implementer()->Iterate(&v);
5797}
5798
5799#endif
5800
5801class CheckHandleCountVisitor : public RootVisitor {
5802 public:
5803 CheckHandleCountVisitor() : handle_count_(0) {}
5804 ~CheckHandleCountVisitor() override {
5805 CHECK_GT(HandleScope::kCheckHandleThreshold, handle_count_)do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpGTImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(HandleScope::kCheckHandleThreshold
)>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype
(handle_count_)>::type>((HandleScope::kCheckHandleThreshold
), (handle_count_)); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0
))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "HandleScope::kCheckHandleThreshold"
" " ">" " " "handle_count_"); } } while (false); } while (
false);
5806 }
5807 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
5808 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
5809 handle_count_ += end - start;
5810 }
5811
5812 private:
5813 ptrdiff_t handle_count_;
5814};
5815
5816
5817void Heap::CheckHandleCount() {
5818 CheckHandleCountVisitor v;
5819 isolate_->handle_scope_implementer()->Iterate(&v);
5820}
5821
5822void Heap::ClearRecordedSlot(HeapObject object, ObjectSlot slot) {
5823#ifndef V8_DISABLE_WRITE_BARRIERS
5824 DCHECK(!IsLargeObject(object))((void) 0);
5825 Page* page = Page::FromAddress(slot.address());
5826 if (!page->InYoungGeneration()) {
5827 DCHECK_EQ(page->owner_identity(), OLD_SPACE)((void) 0);
5828
5829 if (!page->SweepingDone()) {
5830 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Remove(page, slot.address());
5831 }
5832 }
5833#endif
5834}
5835
5836// static
5837int Heap::InsertIntoRememberedSetFromCode(MemoryChunk* chunk, Address slot) {
5838 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(chunk, slot);
5839 return 0;
5840}
5841
5842#ifdef DEBUG
5843void Heap::VerifyClearedSlot(HeapObject object, ObjectSlot slot) {
5844#ifndef V8_DISABLE_WRITE_BARRIERS
5845 DCHECK(!IsLargeObject(object))((void) 0);
5846 if (InYoungGeneration(object)) return;
5847 Page* page = Page::FromAddress(slot.address());
5848 DCHECK_EQ(page->owner_identity(), OLD_SPACE)((void) 0);
5849 // Slots are filtered with invalidated slots.
5850 CHECK_IMPLIES(RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Contains(page, slot.address()),do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW
>::Contains(page, slot.address())) || (page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots
<OLD_TO_NEW>(object)))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Contains(page, slot.address())"
" implies " "page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_NEW>(object)"
); } } while (false)
5851 page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_NEW>(object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW
>::Contains(page, slot.address())) || (page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots
<OLD_TO_NEW>(object)))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Contains(page, slot.address())"
" implies " "page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_NEW>(object)"
); } } while (false);
5852 CHECK_IMPLIES(RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD>::Contains(page, slot.address()),do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD
>::Contains(page, slot.address())) || (page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots
<OLD_TO_OLD>(object)))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD>::Contains(page, slot.address())"
" implies " "page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_OLD>(object)"
); } } while (false)
5853 page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_OLD>(object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!(RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD
>::Contains(page, slot.address())) || (page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots
<OLD_TO_OLD>(object)))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "RememberedSet<OLD_TO_OLD>::Contains(page, slot.address())"
" implies " "page->RegisteredObjectWithInvalidatedSlots<OLD_TO_OLD>(object)"
); } } while (false);
5854#endif
5855}
5856
5857void Heap::VerifySlotRangeHasNoRecordedSlots(Address start, Address end) {
5858#ifndef V8_DISABLE_WRITE_BARRIERS
5859 Page* page = Page::FromAddress(start);
5860 DCHECK(!page->IsLargePage())((void) 0);
5861 DCHECK(!page->InYoungGeneration())((void) 0);
5862 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::CheckNoneInRange(page, start, end);
5863#endif
5864}
5865#endif
5866
5867void Heap::ClearRecordedSlotRange(Address start, Address end) {
5868#ifndef V8_DISABLE_WRITE_BARRIERS
5869 Page* page = Page::FromAddress(start);
5870 DCHECK(!page->IsLargePage())((void) 0);
5871 if (!page->InYoungGeneration()) {
5872 DCHECK_EQ(page->owner_identity(), OLD_SPACE)((void) 0);
5873
5874 if (!page->SweepingDone()) {
5875 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::RemoveRange(page, start, end,
5876 SlotSet::KEEP_EMPTY_BUCKETS);
5877 }
5878 }
5879#endif
5880}
5881
5882PagedSpace* PagedSpaceIterator::Next() {
5883 switch (counter_++) {
5884 case RO_SPACE:
5885 case NEW_SPACE:
5886 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
5887 case OLD_SPACE:
5888 return heap_->old_space();
5889 case CODE_SPACE:
5890 return heap_->code_space();
5891 case MAP_SPACE:
5892 return heap_->map_space();
5893 default:
5894 return nullptr;
5895 }
5896}
5897
5898SpaceIterator::SpaceIterator(Heap* heap)
5899 : heap_(heap), current_space_(FIRST_MUTABLE_SPACE - 1) {}
5900
5901SpaceIterator::~SpaceIterator() = default;
5902
5903bool SpaceIterator::HasNext() {
5904 // Iterate until no more spaces.
5905 return current_space_ != LAST_SPACE;
5906}
5907
5908Space* SpaceIterator::Next() {
5909 DCHECK(HasNext())((void) 0);
5910 return heap_->space(++current_space_);
5911}
5912
5913class HeapObjectsFilter {
5914 public:
5915 virtual ~HeapObjectsFilter() = default;
5916 virtual bool SkipObject(HeapObject object) = 0;
5917};
5918
5919
5920class UnreachableObjectsFilter : public HeapObjectsFilter {
5921 public:
5922 explicit UnreachableObjectsFilter(Heap* heap) : heap_(heap) {
5923 MarkReachableObjects();
5924 }
5925
5926 ~UnreachableObjectsFilter() override {
5927 for (auto it : reachable_) {
5928 delete it.second;
5929 it.second = nullptr;
5930 }
5931 }
5932
5933 bool SkipObject(HeapObject object) override {
5934 if (object.IsFreeSpaceOrFiller()) return true;
5935 BasicMemoryChunk* chunk = BasicMemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
5936 if (reachable_.count(chunk) == 0) return true;
5937 return reachable_[chunk]->count(object) == 0;
5938 }
5939
5940 private:
5941 bool MarkAsReachable(HeapObject object) {
5942 BasicMemoryChunk* chunk = BasicMemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
5943 if (reachable_.count(chunk) == 0) {
5944 reachable_[chunk] = new std::unordered_set<HeapObject, Object::Hasher>();
5945 }
5946 if (reachable_[chunk]->count(object)) return false;
5947 reachable_[chunk]->insert(object);
5948 return true;
5949 }
5950
5951 class MarkingVisitor : public ObjectVisitor, public RootVisitor {
5952 public:
5953 explicit MarkingVisitor(UnreachableObjectsFilter* filter)
5954 : filter_(filter) {}
5955
5956 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, ObjectSlot start,
5957 ObjectSlot end) override {
5958 MarkPointers(MaybeObjectSlot(start), MaybeObjectSlot(end));
5959 }
5960
5961 void VisitPointers(HeapObject host, MaybeObjectSlot start,
5962 MaybeObjectSlot end) final {
5963 MarkPointers(start, end);
5964 }
5965
5966 void VisitCodeTarget(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) final {
5967 Code target = Code::GetCodeFromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
5968 MarkHeapObject(target);
5969 }
5970 void VisitEmbeddedPointer(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) final {
5971 MarkHeapObject(rinfo->target_object());
5972 }
5973
5974 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
5975 FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) override {
5976 MarkPointersImpl(start, end);
5977 }
5978 void VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
5979 OffHeapObjectSlot start,
5980 OffHeapObjectSlot end) override {
5981 MarkPointersImpl(start, end);
5982 }
5983
5984 void TransitiveClosure() {
5985 while (!marking_stack_.empty()) {
5986 HeapObject obj = marking_stack_.back();
5987 marking_stack_.pop_back();
5988 obj.Iterate(this);
5989 }
5990 }
5991
5992 private:
5993 void MarkPointers(MaybeObjectSlot start, MaybeObjectSlot end) {
5994 MarkPointersImpl(start, end);
5995 }
5996
5997 template <typename TSlot>
5998 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void MarkPointersImpl(TSlot start, TSlot end) {
5999 // Treat weak references as strong.
6000 Isolate* isolate = filter_->heap_->isolate();
6001 for (TSlot p = start; p < end; ++p) {
6002 typename TSlot::TObject object = p.load(isolate);
6003 HeapObject heap_object;
6004 if (object.GetHeapObject(&heap_object)) {
6005 MarkHeapObject(heap_object);
6006 }
6007 }
6008 }
6009
6010 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void MarkHeapObject(HeapObject heap_object) {
6011 if (filter_->MarkAsReachable(heap_object)) {
6012 marking_stack_.push_back(heap_object);
6013 }
6014 }
6015
6016 UnreachableObjectsFilter* filter_;
6017 std::vector<HeapObject> marking_stack_;
6018 };
6019
6020 friend class MarkingVisitor;
6021
6022 void MarkReachableObjects() {
6023 MarkingVisitor visitor(this);
6024 heap_->IterateRoots(&visitor, {});
6025 visitor.TransitiveClosure();
6026 }
6027
6028 Heap* heap_;
6029 DisallowHeapAllocation no_allocation_;
6030 std::unordered_map<BasicMemoryChunk*,
6031 std::unordered_set<HeapObject, Object::Hasher>*>
6032 reachable_;
6033};
6034
6035HeapObjectIterator::HeapObjectIterator(
6036 Heap* heap, HeapObjectIterator::HeapObjectsFiltering filtering)
6037 : heap_(heap),
6038 safepoint_scope_(std::make_unique<SafepointScope>(heap)),
6039 filtering_(filtering),
6040 filter_(nullptr),
6041 space_iterator_(nullptr),
6042 object_iterator_(nullptr) {
6043 heap_->MakeHeapIterable();
6044 // Start the iteration.
6045 space_iterator_ = new SpaceIterator(heap_);
6046 switch (filtering_) {
6047 case kFilterUnreachable:
6048 filter_ = new UnreachableObjectsFilter(heap_);
6049 break;
6050 default:
6051 break;
6052 }
6053 object_iterator_ = space_iterator_->Next()->GetObjectIterator(heap_);
6054}
6055
6056HeapObjectIterator::~HeapObjectIterator() {
6057#ifdef DEBUG
6058 // Assert that in filtering mode we have iterated through all
6059 // objects. Otherwise, heap will be left in an inconsistent state.
6060 if (filtering_ != kNoFiltering) {
6061 DCHECK_NULL(object_iterator_)((void) 0);
6062 }
6063#endif
6064 delete space_iterator_;
6065 delete filter_;
6066}
6067
6068HeapObject HeapObjectIterator::Next() {
6069 if (filter_ == nullptr) return NextObject();
6070
6071 HeapObject obj = NextObject();
6072 while (!obj.is_null() && (filter_->SkipObject(obj))) obj = NextObject();
6073 return obj;
6074}
6075
6076HeapObject HeapObjectIterator::NextObject() {
6077 // No iterator means we are done.
6078 if (object_iterator_.get() == nullptr) return HeapObject();
6079
6080 HeapObject obj = object_iterator_.get()->Next();
6081 if (!obj.is_null()) {
6082 // If the current iterator has more objects we are fine.
6083 return obj;
6084 } else {
6085 // Go though the spaces looking for one that has objects.
6086 while (space_iterator_->HasNext()) {
6087 object_iterator_ = space_iterator_->Next()->GetObjectIterator(heap_);
6088 obj = object_iterator_.get()->Next();
6089 if (!obj.is_null()) {
6090 return obj;
6091 }
6092 }
6093 }
6094 // Done with the last space.
6095 object_iterator_.reset(nullptr);
6096 return HeapObject();
6097}
6098
6099void Heap::UpdateTotalGCTime(double duration) {
6100 if (FLAG_trace_gc_verbose) {
6101 total_gc_time_ms_ += duration;
6102 }
6103}
6104
6105void Heap::ExternalStringTable::CleanUpYoung() {
6106 int last = 0;
6107 Isolate* isolate = heap_->isolate();
6108 for (size_t i = 0; i < young_strings_.size(); ++i) {
6109 Object o = young_strings_[i];
6110 if (o.IsTheHole(isolate)) {
6111 continue;
6112 }
6113 // The real external string is already in one of these vectors and was or
6114 // will be processed. Re-processing it will add a duplicate to the vector.
6115 if (o.IsThinString()) continue;
6116 DCHECK(o.IsExternalString())((void) 0);
6117 if (InYoungGeneration(o)) {
6118 young_strings_[last++] = o;
6119 } else {
6120 old_strings_.push_back(o);
6121 }
6122 }
6123 young_strings_.resize(last);
6124}
6125
6126void Heap::ExternalStringTable::CleanUpAll() {
6127 CleanUpYoung();
6128 int last = 0;
6129 Isolate* isolate = heap_->isolate();
6130 for (size_t i = 0; i < old_strings_.size(); ++i) {
6131 Object o = old_strings_[i];
6132 if (o.IsTheHole(isolate)) {
6133 continue;
6134 }
6135 // The real external string is already in one of these vectors and was or
6136 // will be processed. Re-processing it will add a duplicate to the vector.
6137 if (o.IsThinString()) continue;
6138 DCHECK(o.IsExternalString())((void) 0);
6139 DCHECK(!InYoungGeneration(o))((void) 0);
6140 old_strings_[last++] = o;
6141 }
6142 old_strings_.resize(last);
6143#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
6144 if (FLAG_verify_heap) {
6145 Verify();
6146 }
6147#endif
6148}
6149
6150void Heap::ExternalStringTable::TearDown() {
6151 for (size_t i = 0; i < young_strings_.size(); ++i) {
6152 Object o = young_strings_[i];
6153 // Dont finalize thin strings.
6154 if (o.IsThinString()) continue;
6155 heap_->FinalizeExternalString(ExternalString::cast(o));
6156 }
6157 young_strings_.clear();
6158 for (size_t i = 0; i < old_strings_.size(); ++i) {
6159 Object o = old_strings_[i];
6160 // Dont finalize thin strings.
6161 if (o.IsThinString()) continue;
6162 heap_->FinalizeExternalString(ExternalString::cast(o));
6163 }
6164 old_strings_.clear();
6165}
6166
6167
6168void Heap::RememberUnmappedPage(Address page, bool compacted) {
6169 // Tag the page pointer to make it findable in the dump file.
6170 if (compacted) {
6171 page ^= 0xC1EAD & (Page::kPageSize - 1); // Cleared.
6172 } else {
6173 page ^= 0x1D1ED & (Page::kPageSize - 1); // I died.
6174 }
6175 remembered_unmapped_pages_[remembered_unmapped_pages_index_] = page;
6176 remembered_unmapped_pages_index_++;
6177 remembered_unmapped_pages_index_ %= kRememberedUnmappedPages;
6178}
6179
6180size_t Heap::YoungArrayBufferBytes() {
6181 return array_buffer_sweeper()->YoungBytes();
6182}
6183
6184size_t Heap::OldArrayBufferBytes() {
6185 return array_buffer_sweeper()->OldBytes();
6186}
6187
6188void Heap::RegisterStrongRoots(FullObjectSlot start, FullObjectSlot end) {
6189 StrongRootsList* list = new StrongRootsList();
6190 list->next = strong_roots_list_;
6191 list->start = start;
6192 list->end = end;
6193 strong_roots_list_ = list;
6194}
6195
6196void Heap::UnregisterStrongRoots(FullObjectSlot start) {
6197 StrongRootsList* prev = nullptr;
6198 StrongRootsList* list = strong_roots_list_;
6199 while (list != nullptr) {
6200 StrongRootsList* next = list->next;
6201 if (list->start == start) {
6202 if (prev) {
6203 prev->next = next;
6204 } else {
6205 strong_roots_list_ = next;
6206 }
6207 delete list;
6208 } else {
6209 prev = list;
6210 }
6211 list = next;
6212 }
6213}
6214
6215void Heap::SetBuiltinsConstantsTable(FixedArray cache) {
6216 set_builtins_constants_table(cache);
6217}
6218
6219void Heap::SetDetachedContexts(WeakArrayList detached_contexts) {
6220 set_detached_contexts(detached_contexts);
6221}
6222
6223void Heap::SetInterpreterEntryTrampolineForProfiling(Code code) {
6224 DCHECK_EQ(Builtins::kInterpreterEntryTrampoline, code.builtin_index())((void) 0);
6225 set_interpreter_entry_trampoline_for_profiling(code);
6226}
6227
6228void Heap::PostFinalizationRegistryCleanupTaskIfNeeded() {
6229 // Only one cleanup task is posted at a time.
6230 if (!HasDirtyJSFinalizationRegistries() ||
6231 is_finalization_registry_cleanup_task_posted_) {
6232 return;
6233 }
6234 auto taskrunner = V8::GetCurrentPlatform()->GetForegroundTaskRunner(
6235 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(isolate()));
6236 auto task = std::make_unique<FinalizationRegistryCleanupTask>(this);
6237 taskrunner->PostNonNestableTask(std::move(task));
6238 is_finalization_registry_cleanup_task_posted_ = true;
6239}
6240
6241void Heap::EnqueueDirtyJSFinalizationRegistry(
6242 JSFinalizationRegistry finalization_registry,
6243 std::function<void(HeapObject object, ObjectSlot slot, Object target)>
6244 gc_notify_updated_slot) {
6245 // Add a FinalizationRegistry to the tail of the dirty list.
6246 DCHECK(!HasDirtyJSFinalizationRegistries() ||((void) 0)
6247 dirty_js_finalization_registries_list().IsJSFinalizationRegistry())((void) 0);
6248 DCHECK(finalization_registry.next_dirty().IsUndefined(isolate()))((void) 0);
6249 DCHECK(!finalization_registry.scheduled_for_cleanup())((void) 0);
6250 finalization_registry.set_scheduled_for_cleanup(true);
6251 if (dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail().IsUndefined(isolate())) {
6252 DCHECK(dirty_js_finalization_registries_list().IsUndefined(isolate()))((void) 0);
6253 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(finalization_registry);
6254 // dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_ is rescanned by
6255 // ProcessWeakListRoots.
6256 } else {
6257 JSFinalizationRegistry tail = JSFinalizationRegistry::cast(
6258 dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail());
6259 tail.set_next_dirty(finalization_registry);
6260 gc_notify_updated_slot(
6261 tail, tail.RawField(JSFinalizationRegistry::kNextDirtyOffset),
6262 finalization_registry);
6263 }
6264 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail(finalization_registry);
6265 // dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail_ is rescanned by
6266 // ProcessWeakListRoots.
6267}
6268
6269MaybeHandle<JSFinalizationRegistry> Heap::DequeueDirtyJSFinalizationRegistry() {
6270 // Take a FinalizationRegistry from the head of the dirty list for fairness.
6271 if (HasDirtyJSFinalizationRegistries()) {
6272 Handle<JSFinalizationRegistry> head(
6273 JSFinalizationRegistry::cast(dirty_js_finalization_registries_list()),
6274 isolate());
6275 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(head->next_dirty());
6276 head->set_next_dirty(ReadOnlyRoots(this).undefined_value());
6277 if (*head == dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail()) {
6278 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail(
6279 ReadOnlyRoots(this).undefined_value());
6280 }
6281 return head;
6282 }
6283 return {};
6284}
6285
6286void Heap::RemoveDirtyFinalizationRegistriesOnContext(NativeContext context) {
6287 if (!FLAG_harmony_weak_refs) return;
6288
6289 DisallowHeapAllocation no_gc;
6290
6291 Isolate* isolate = this->isolate();
6292 Object prev = ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).undefined_value();
6293 Object current = dirty_js_finalization_registries_list();
6294 while (!current.IsUndefined(isolate)) {
6295 JSFinalizationRegistry finalization_registry =
6296 JSFinalizationRegistry::cast(current);
6297 if (finalization_registry.native_context() == context) {
6298 if (prev.IsUndefined(isolate)) {
6299 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list(
6300 finalization_registry.next_dirty());
6301 } else {
6302 JSFinalizationRegistry::cast(prev).set_next_dirty(
6303 finalization_registry.next_dirty());
6304 }
6305 finalization_registry.set_scheduled_for_cleanup(false);
6306 current = finalization_registry.next_dirty();
6307 finalization_registry.set_next_dirty(
6308 ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).undefined_value());
6309 } else {
6310 prev = current;
6311 current = finalization_registry.next_dirty();
6312 }
6313 }
6314 set_dirty_js_finalization_registries_list_tail(prev);
6315}
6316
6317void Heap::KeepDuringJob(Handle<JSReceiver> target) {
6318 DCHECK(FLAG_harmony_weak_refs)((void) 0);
6319 DCHECK(weak_refs_keep_during_job().IsUndefined() ||((void) 0)
6320 weak_refs_keep_during_job().IsOrderedHashSet())((void) 0);
6321 Handle<OrderedHashSet> table;
6322 if (weak_refs_keep_during_job().IsUndefined(isolate())) {
6323 table = isolate()->factory()->NewOrderedHashSet();
6324 } else {
6325 table =
6326 handle(OrderedHashSet::cast(weak_refs_keep_during_job()), isolate());
6327 }
6328 table = OrderedHashSet::Add(isolate(), table, target).ToHandleChecked();
6329 set_weak_refs_keep_during_job(*table);
6330}
6331
6332void Heap::ClearKeptObjects() {
6333 set_weak_refs_keep_during_job(ReadOnlyRoots(isolate()).undefined_value());
6334}
6335
6336size_t Heap::NumberOfTrackedHeapObjectTypes() {
6337 return ObjectStats::OBJECT_STATS_COUNT;
6338}
6339
6340
6341size_t Heap::ObjectCountAtLastGC(size_t index) {
6342 if (live_object_stats_ == nullptr || index >= ObjectStats::OBJECT_STATS_COUNT)
6343 return 0;
6344 return live_object_stats_->object_count_last_gc(index);
6345}
6346
6347
6348size_t Heap::ObjectSizeAtLastGC(size_t index) {
6349 if (live_object_stats_ == nullptr || index >= ObjectStats::OBJECT_STATS_COUNT)
6350 return 0;
6351 return live_object_stats_->object_size_last_gc(index);
6352}
6353

6356 const char** object_sub_type) {

6361 case name: \

6363 *object_sub_type = ""; \
6364 return true;

) COMPARE_AND_RETURN_NAME(STRING_SPLIT_CACHE_TYPE) COMPARE_AND_RETURN_NAME
(STRING_EXTERNAL_RESOURCE_ONE_BYTE_TYPE) COMPARE_AND_RETURN_NAME
(STRING_EXTERNAL_RESOURCE_TWO_BYTE_TYPE) COMPARE_AND_RETURN_NAME
(SOURCE_POSITION_TABLE_TYPE) COMPARE_AND_RETURN_NAME(UNCOMPILED_SHARED_FUNCTION_INFO_TYPE
) COMPARE_AND_RETURN_NAME(WEAK_NEW_SPACE_OBJECT_TO_CODE_TYPE)
6374#undef COMPARE_AND_RETURN_NAME
6375 }
6376 return false;
6377}
6378
6379size_t Heap::NumberOfNativeContexts() {
6380 int result = 0;
6381 Object context = native_contexts_list();
6382 while (!context.IsUndefined(isolate())) {
6383 ++result;
6384 Context native_context = Context::cast(context);
6385 context = native_context.next_context_link();
6386 }
6387 return result;
6388}
6389
6390std::vector<Handle<NativeContext>> Heap::FindAllNativeContexts() {
6391 std::vector<Handle<NativeContext>> result;
6392 Object context = native_contexts_list();
6393 while (!context.IsUndefined(isolate())) {
6394 NativeContext native_context = NativeContext::cast(context);
6395 result.push_back(handle(native_context, isolate()));
6396 context = native_context.next_context_link();
6397 }
6398 return result;
6399}
6400
6401std::vector<WeakArrayList> Heap::FindAllRetainedMaps() {
6402 std::vector<WeakArrayList> result;
6403 Object context = native_contexts_list();
6404 while (!context.IsUndefined(isolate())) {
6405 NativeContext native_context = NativeContext::cast(context);
6406 result.push_back(native_context.retained_maps());
6407 context = native_context.next_context_link();
6408 }
6409 return result;
6410}
6411
6412size_t Heap::NumberOfDetachedContexts() {
6413 // The detached_contexts() array has two entries per detached context.
6414 return detached_contexts().length() / 2;
6415}
6416
6417void VerifyPointersVisitor::VisitPointers(HeapObject host, ObjectSlot start,
6418 ObjectSlot end) {
6419 VerifyPointers(host, MaybeObjectSlot(start), MaybeObjectSlot(end));
6420}
6421
6422void VerifyPointersVisitor::VisitPointers(HeapObject host,
6423 MaybeObjectSlot start,
6424 MaybeObjectSlot end) {
6425 VerifyPointers(host, start, end);
6426}
6427
6428void VerifyPointersVisitor::VisitRootPointers(Root root,
6429 const char* description,
6430 FullObjectSlot start,
6431 FullObjectSlot end) {
6432 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
6433}
6434
6435void VerifyPointersVisitor::VisitRootPointers(Root root,
6436 const char* description,
6437 OffHeapObjectSlot start,
6438 OffHeapObjectSlot end) {
6439 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
6440}
6441
6442void VerifyPointersVisitor::VerifyHeapObjectImpl(HeapObject heap_object) {
6443 CHECK(IsValidHeapObject(heap_, heap_object))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(IsValidHeapObject(heap_, heap_object
))), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "IsValidHeapObject(heap_, heap_object)"
); } } while (false);
6444 CHECK(heap_object.map().IsMap())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(heap_object.map().IsMap())), 0
))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "heap_object.map().IsMap()"
); } } while (false);
6445}
6446
6447template <typename TSlot>
6448void VerifyPointersVisitor::VerifyPointersImpl(TSlot start, TSlot end) {
6449 Isolate* isolate = heap_->isolate();
6450 for (TSlot slot = start; slot < end; ++slot) {
6451 typename TSlot::TObject object = slot.load(isolate);
6452 HeapObject heap_object;
6453 if (object.GetHeapObject(&heap_object)) {
6454 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(heap_object);
6455 } else {
6456 CHECK(object.IsSmi() || object.IsCleared())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(object.IsSmi() || object.IsCleared
())), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "object.IsSmi() || object.IsCleared()"
); } } while (false);
6457 }
6458 }
6459}
6460
6461void VerifyPointersVisitor::VerifyPointers(HeapObject host,
6462 MaybeObjectSlot start,
6463 MaybeObjectSlot end) {
6464 // If this DCHECK fires then you probably added a pointer field
6465 // to one of objects in DATA_ONLY_VISITOR_ID_LIST. You can fix
6466 // this by moving that object to POINTER_VISITOR_ID_LIST.
6467 DCHECK_EQ(ObjectFields::kMaybePointers,((void) 0)
6468 Map::ObjectFieldsFrom(host.map().visitor_id()))((void) 0);
6469 VerifyPointersImpl(start, end);
6470}
6471
6472void VerifyPointersVisitor::VisitCodeTarget(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) {
6473 Code target = Code::GetCodeFromTargetAddress(rinfo->target_address());
6474 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(target);
6475}
6476
6477void VerifyPointersVisitor::VisitEmbeddedPointer(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo) {
6478 VerifyHeapObjectImpl(rinfo->target_object());
6479}
6480
6481void VerifySmisVisitor::VisitRootPointers(Root root, const char* description,
6482 FullObjectSlot start,
6483 FullObjectSlot end) {
6484 for (FullObjectSlot current = start; current < end; ++current) {
6485 CHECK((*current).IsSmi())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!((*current).IsSmi())), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "(*current).IsSmi()"); } } while (false
);
6486 }
6487}
6488
6489bool Heap::AllowedToBeMigrated(Map map, HeapObject obj, AllocationSpace dst) {
6490 // Object migration is governed by the following rules:
6491 //
6492 // 1) Objects in new-space can be migrated to the old space
6493 // that matches their target space or they stay in new-space.
6494 // 2) Objects in old-space stay in the same space when migrating.
6495 // 3) Fillers (two or more words) can migrate due to left-trimming of
6496 // fixed arrays in new-space or old space.
6497 // 4) Fillers (one word) can never migrate, they are skipped by
6498 // incremental marking explicitly to prevent invalid pattern.
6499 //
6500 // Since this function is used for debugging only, we do not place
6501 // asserts here, but check everything explicitly.
6502 if (map == ReadOnlyRoots(this).one_pointer_filler_map()) return false;
6503 InstanceType type = map.instance_type();
6504 MemoryChunk* chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(obj);
6505 AllocationSpace src = chunk->owner_identity();
6506 switch (src) {
6507 case NEW_SPACE:
6508 return dst == NEW_SPACE || dst == OLD_SPACE;
6509 case OLD_SPACE:
6510 return dst == OLD_SPACE;
6511 case CODE_SPACE:
6512 return dst == CODE_SPACE && type == CODE_TYPE;
6513 case MAP_SPACE:
6514 case LO_SPACE:
6515 case CODE_LO_SPACE:
6516 case NEW_LO_SPACE:
6517 case RO_SPACE:
6518 return false;
6519 }
6520 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
6521}
6522
6523size_t Heap::EmbedderAllocationCounter() const {
6524 return local_embedder_heap_tracer()
6525 ? local_embedder_heap_tracer()->allocated_size()
6526 : 0;
6527}
6528
6529void Heap::CreateObjectStats() {
6530 if (V8_LIKELY(!TracingFlags::is_gc_stats_enabled())(__builtin_expect(!!(!TracingFlags::is_gc_stats_enabled()), 1
))) return;
6531 if (!live_object_stats_) {
6532 live_object_stats_.reset(new ObjectStats(this));
6533 }
6534 if (!dead_object_stats_) {
6535 dead_object_stats_.reset(new ObjectStats(this));
6536 }
6537}
6538
6539Map Heap::GcSafeMapOfCodeSpaceObject(HeapObject object) {
6540 MapWord map_word = object.map_word();
6541 return map_word.IsForwardingAddress() ? map_word.ToForwardingAddress().map()
6542 : map_word.ToMap();
6543}
6544
6545Code Heap::GcSafeCastToCode(HeapObject object, Address inner_pointer) {
6546 Code code = Code::unchecked_cast(object);
6547 DCHECK(!code.is_null())((void) 0);
6548 DCHECK(GcSafeCodeContains(code, inner_pointer))((void) 0);
6549 return code;
6550}
6551
6552bool Heap::GcSafeCodeContains(Code code, Address addr) {
6553 Map map = GcSafeMapOfCodeSpaceObject(code);
6554 DCHECK(map == ReadOnlyRoots(this).code_map())((void) 0);
6555 if (InstructionStream::TryLookupCode(isolate(), addr) == code) return true;
6556 Address start = code.address();
6557 Address end = code.address() + code.SizeFromMap(map);
6558 return start <= addr && addr < end;
6559}
6560
6561Code Heap::GcSafeFindCodeForInnerPointer(Address inner_pointer) {
6562 Code code = InstructionStream::TryLookupCode(isolate(), inner_pointer);
6563 if (!code.is_null()) return code;
6564
6565 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse) {
6566 Address start = tp_heap_->GetObjectFromInnerPointer(inner_pointer);
6567 return GcSafeCastToCode(HeapObject::FromAddress(start), inner_pointer);
6568 }
6569
6570 // Check if the inner pointer points into a large object chunk.
6571 LargePage* large_page = code_lo_space()->FindPage(inner_pointer);
6572 if (large_page != nullptr) {
6573 return GcSafeCastToCode(large_page->GetObject(), inner_pointer);
6574 }
6575
6576 if (V8_LIKELY(code_space()->Contains(inner_pointer))(__builtin_expect(!!(code_space()->Contains(inner_pointer)
), 1))) {
6577 // Iterate through the page until we reach the end or find an object
6578 // starting after the inner pointer.
6579 Page* page = Page::FromAddress(inner_pointer);
6580
6581 Address start =
6582 page->GetCodeObjectRegistry()->GetCodeObjectStartFromInnerAddress(
6583 inner_pointer);
6584 return GcSafeCastToCode(HeapObject::FromAddress(start), inner_pointer);
6585 }
6586
6587 // It can only fall through to here during debugging, where for instance "jco"
6588 // was called on an address within a RO_SPACE builtin. It cannot reach here
6589 // during stack iteration as RO_SPACE memory is not executable so cannot
6590 // appear on the stack as an instruction address.
6591 DCHECK(ReadOnlyHeap::Contains(((void) 0)
6592 HeapObject::FromAddress(inner_pointer & ~kHeapObjectTagMask)))((void) 0);
6593
6594 // TODO(delphick): Possibly optimize this as it iterates over all pages in
6595 // RO_SPACE instead of just the one containing the address.
6596 ReadOnlyHeapObjectIterator iterator(isolate()->read_only_heap());
6597 for (HeapObject object = iterator.Next(); !object.is_null();
6598 object = iterator.Next()) {
6599 if (!object.IsCode()) continue;
6600 Code code = Code::cast(object);
6601 if (inner_pointer >= code.address() &&
6602 inner_pointer < code.address() + code.Size()) {
6603 return code;
6604 }
6605 }
6606 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
6607}
6608
6609void Heap::WriteBarrierForCodeSlow(Code code) {
6610 for (RelocIterator it(code, RelocInfo::EmbeddedObjectModeMask()); !it.done();
6611 it.next()) {
6612 GenerationalBarrierForCode(code, it.rinfo(), it.rinfo()->target_object());
6613 WriteBarrier::Marking(code, it.rinfo(), it.rinfo()->target_object());
6614 }
6615}
6616
6617void Heap::GenerationalBarrierSlow(HeapObject object, Address slot,
6618 HeapObject value) {
6619 MemoryChunk* chunk = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
6620 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(chunk, slot);
6621}
6622
6623void Heap::RecordEphemeronKeyWrite(EphemeronHashTable table, Address slot) {
6624 DCHECK(ObjectInYoungGeneration(HeapObjectSlot(slot).ToHeapObject()))((void) 0);
6625 int slot_index = EphemeronHashTable::SlotToIndex(table.address(), slot);
6626 InternalIndex entry = EphemeronHashTable::IndexToEntry(slot_index);
6627 auto it =
6628 ephemeron_remembered_set_.insert({table, std::unordered_set<int>()});
6629 it.first->second.insert(entry.as_int());
6630}
6631
6632void Heap::EphemeronKeyWriteBarrierFromCode(Address raw_object,
6633 Address key_slot_address,
6634 Isolate* isolate) {
6635 EphemeronHashTable table = EphemeronHashTable::cast(Object(raw_object));
6636 MaybeObjectSlot key_slot(key_slot_address);
6637 MaybeObject maybe_key = *key_slot;
6638 HeapObject key;
6639 if (!maybe_key.GetHeapObject(&key)) return;
6640 if (!ObjectInYoungGeneration(table) && ObjectInYoungGeneration(key)) {
6641 isolate->heap()->RecordEphemeronKeyWrite(table, key_slot_address);
6642 }
6643 WriteBarrier::Marking(table, key_slot, maybe_key);
6644}
6645
6646enum RangeWriteBarrierMode {
6647 kDoGenerational = 1 << 0,
6648 kDoMarking = 1 << 1,
6649 kDoEvacuationSlotRecording = 1 << 2,
6650};
6651
6652template <int kModeMask, typename TSlot>
6653void Heap::WriteBarrierForRangeImpl(MemoryChunk* source_page, HeapObject object,
6654 TSlot start_slot, TSlot end_slot) {
6655 // At least one of generational or marking write barrier should be requested.
6656 STATIC_ASSERT(kModeMask & (kDoGenerational | kDoMarking))static_assert(kModeMask & (kDoGenerational | kDoMarking),
"kModeMask & (kDoGenerational | kDoMarking)");
6657 // kDoEvacuationSlotRecording implies kDoMarking.
6658 STATIC_ASSERT(!(kModeMask & kDoEvacuationSlotRecording) ||static_assert(!(kModeMask & kDoEvacuationSlotRecording) ||
(kModeMask & kDoMarking), "!(kModeMask & kDoEvacuationSlotRecording) || (kModeMask & kDoMarking)"
)
6659 (kModeMask & kDoMarking))static_assert(!(kModeMask & kDoEvacuationSlotRecording) ||
(kModeMask & kDoMarking), "!(kModeMask & kDoEvacuationSlotRecording) || (kModeMask & kDoMarking)"
);
6660
6661 MarkingBarrier* marking_barrier = this->marking_barrier();
6662 MarkCompactCollector* collector = this->mark_compact_collector();
6663
6664 for (TSlot slot = start_slot; slot < end_slot; ++slot) {
6665 typename TSlot::TObject value = *slot;
6666 HeapObject value_heap_object;
6667 if (!value.GetHeapObject(&value_heap_object)) continue;
6668
6669 if ((kModeMask & kDoGenerational) &&
6670 Heap::InYoungGeneration(value_heap_object)) {
6671 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::Insert<AccessMode::NON_ATOMIC>(source_page,
6672 slot.address());
6673 }
6674
6675 if ((kModeMask & kDoMarking) &&
6676 marking_barrier->MarkValue(object, value_heap_object)) {
6677 if (kModeMask & kDoEvacuationSlotRecording) {
6678 collector->RecordSlot(source_page, HeapObjectSlot(slot),
6679 value_heap_object);
6680 }
6681 }
6682 }
6683}
6684
6685// Instantiate Heap::WriteBarrierForRange() for ObjectSlot and MaybeObjectSlot.
6686template void Heap::WriteBarrierForRange<ObjectSlot>(HeapObject object,
6687 ObjectSlot start_slot,
6688 ObjectSlot end_slot);
6689template void Heap::WriteBarrierForRange<MaybeObjectSlot>(
6690 HeapObject object, MaybeObjectSlot start_slot, MaybeObjectSlot end_slot);
6691
6692template <typename TSlot>
6693void Heap::WriteBarrierForRange(HeapObject object, TSlot start_slot,
6694 TSlot end_slot) {
6695 MemoryChunk* source_page = MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
6696 base::Flags<RangeWriteBarrierMode> mode;
6697
6698 if (!source_page->InYoungGeneration()) {
6699 mode |= kDoGenerational;
6700 }
6701
6702 if (incremental_marking()->IsMarking()) {
6703 mode |= kDoMarking;
6704 if (!source_page->ShouldSkipEvacuationSlotRecording<AccessMode::ATOMIC>()) {
6705 mode |= kDoEvacuationSlotRecording;
6706 }
6707 }
6708
6709 switch (mode) {
6710 // Nothing to be done.
6711 case 0:
6712 return;
6713
6714 // Generational only.
6715 case kDoGenerational:
6716 return WriteBarrierForRangeImpl<kDoGenerational>(source_page, object,
6717 start_slot, end_slot);
6718 // Marking, no evacuation slot recording.
6719 case kDoMarking:
6720 return WriteBarrierForRangeImpl<kDoMarking>(source_page, object,
6721 start_slot, end_slot);
6722 // Marking with evacuation slot recording.
6723 case kDoMarking | kDoEvacuationSlotRecording:
6724 return WriteBarrierForRangeImpl<kDoMarking | kDoEvacuationSlotRecording>(
6725 source_page, object, start_slot, end_slot);
6726
6727 // Generational and marking, no evacuation slot recording.
6728 case kDoGenerational | kDoMarking:
6729 return WriteBarrierForRangeImpl<kDoGenerational | kDoMarking>(
6730 source_page, object, start_slot, end_slot);
6731
6732 // Generational and marking with evacuation slot recording.
6733 case kDoGenerational | kDoMarking | kDoEvacuationSlotRecording:
6734 return WriteBarrierForRangeImpl<kDoGenerational | kDoMarking |
6735 kDoEvacuationSlotRecording>(
6736 source_page, object, start_slot, end_slot);
6737
6738 default:
6739 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
6740 }
6741}
6742
6743void Heap::GenerationalBarrierForCodeSlow(Code host, RelocInfo* rinfo,
6744 HeapObject object) {
6745 DCHECK(InYoungGeneration(object))((void) 0);
6746 Page* source_page = Page::FromHeapObject(host);
6747 RelocInfo::Mode rmode = rinfo->rmode();
6748 Address addr = rinfo->pc();
6749 SlotType slot_type = SlotTypeForRelocInfoMode(rmode);
6750 if (rinfo->IsInConstantPool()) {
6751 addr = rinfo->constant_pool_entry_address();
6752 if (RelocInfo::IsCodeTargetMode(rmode)) {
6753 slot_type = CODE_ENTRY_SLOT;
6754 } else if (RelocInfo::IsCompressedEmbeddedObject(rmode)) {
6755 slot_type = COMPRESSED_OBJECT_SLOT;
6756 } else {
6757 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsFullEmbeddedObject(rmode))((void) 0);
6758 slot_type = FULL_OBJECT_SLOT;
6759 }
6760 }
6761 uintptr_t offset = addr - source_page->address();
6762 DCHECK_LT(offset, static_cast<uintptr_t>(TypedSlotSet::kMaxOffset))((void) 0);
6763 RememberedSet<OLD_TO_NEW>::InsertTyped(source_page, slot_type,
6764 static_cast<uint32_t>(offset));
6765}
6766
6767bool Heap::PageFlagsAreConsistent(HeapObject object) {
6768 if (V8_ENABLE_THIRD_PARTY_HEAP_BOOLfalse) {
6769 return true;
6770 }
6771 BasicMemoryChunk* chunk = BasicMemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
6772 heap_internals::MemoryChunk* slim_chunk =
6773 heap_internals::MemoryChunk::FromHeapObject(object);
6774
6775 // Slim chunk flags consistency.
6776 CHECK_EQ(chunk->InYoungGeneration(), slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration())do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(chunk->InYoungGeneration()
)>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype
(slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration())>::type>((chunk->
InYoungGeneration()), (slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration())); do
{ if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s."
, "chunk->InYoungGeneration()" " " "==" " " "slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration()"
); } } while (false); } while (false);
6777 CHECK_EQ(chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::INCREMENTAL_MARKING),do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk
::INCREMENTAL_MARKING))>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref
<decltype(slim_chunk->IsMarking())>::type>((chunk
->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::INCREMENTAL_MARKING)), (slim_chunk
->IsMarking())); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0
))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::INCREMENTAL_MARKING)"
" " "==" " " "slim_chunk->IsMarking()"); } } while (false
); } while (false)
6778 slim_chunk->IsMarking())do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk
::INCREMENTAL_MARKING))>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref
<decltype(slim_chunk->IsMarking())>::type>((chunk
->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::INCREMENTAL_MARKING)), (slim_chunk
->IsMarking())); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0
))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "chunk->IsFlagSet(MemoryChunk::INCREMENTAL_MARKING)"
" " "==" " " "slim_chunk->IsMarking()"); } } while (false
); } while (false);
6779
6780 AllocationSpace identity = chunk->owner()->identity();
6781
6782 // Generation consistency.
6783 CHECK_EQ(identity == NEW_SPACE || identity == NEW_LO_SPACE,do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(identity == NEW_SPACE || identity
== NEW_LO_SPACE)>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref
<decltype(slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration())>::type>
((identity == NEW_SPACE || identity == NEW_LO_SPACE), (slim_chunk
->InYoungGeneration())); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp
)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "identity == NEW_SPACE || identity == NEW_LO_SPACE"
" " "==" " " "slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration()"); } } while
(false); } while (false)
6784 slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration())do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(identity == NEW_SPACE || identity
== NEW_LO_SPACE)>::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref
<decltype(slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration())>::type>
((identity == NEW_SPACE || identity == NEW_LO_SPACE), (slim_chunk
->InYoungGeneration())); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp
)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "identity == NEW_SPACE || identity == NEW_LO_SPACE"
" " "==" " " "slim_chunk->InYoungGeneration()"); } } while
(false); } while (false);
6785 // Read-only consistency.
6786 CHECK_EQ(chunk->InReadOnlySpace(), slim_chunk->InReadOnlySpace())do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(chunk->InReadOnlySpace())>
::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(slim_chunk
->InReadOnlySpace())>::type>((chunk->InReadOnlySpace
()), (slim_chunk->InReadOnlySpace())); do { if ((__builtin_expect
(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "chunk->InReadOnlySpace()"
" " "==" " " "slim_chunk->InReadOnlySpace()"); } } while (
false); } while (false);
6787
6788 // Marking consistency.
6789 if (chunk->IsWritable()) {
6790 // RO_SPACE can be shared between heaps, so we can't use RO_SPACE objects to
6791 // find a heap. The exception is when the ReadOnlySpace is writeable, during
6792 // bootstrapping, so explicitly allow this case.
6793 Heap* heap = Heap::FromWritableHeapObject(object);
6794 CHECK_EQ(slim_chunk->IsMarking(), heap->incremental_marking()->IsMarking())do { bool _cmp = ::v8::base::CmpEQImpl< typename ::v8::base
::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(slim_chunk->IsMarking())>
::type, typename ::v8::base::pass_value_or_ref<decltype(heap
->incremental_marking()->IsMarking())>::type>((slim_chunk
->IsMarking()), (heap->incremental_marking()->IsMarking
())); do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(_cmp)), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "slim_chunk->IsMarking()" " " "==" " "
"heap->incremental_marking()->IsMarking()"); } } while
(false); } while (false);
6795 } else {
6796 // Non-writable RO_SPACE must never have marking flag set.
6797 CHECK(!slim_chunk->IsMarking())do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(!slim_chunk->IsMarking()))
, 0))) { V8_Fatal("Check failed: %s.", "!slim_chunk->IsMarking()"
); } } while (false);
6798 }
6799 return true;
6800}
6801
6802void Heap::SetEmbedderStackStateForNextFinalizaton(
6803 EmbedderHeapTracer::EmbedderStackState stack_state) {
6804 local_embedder_heap_tracer()->SetEmbedderStackStateForNextFinalization(
6805 stack_state);
6806}
6807
6808#ifdef DEBUG
6809void Heap::IncrementObjectCounters() {
6810 isolate_->counters()->objs_since_last_full()->Increment();
6811 isolate_->counters()->objs_since_last_young()->Increment();
6812}
6813#endif // DEBUG
6814
6815} // namespace internal
6816} // namespace v8
